short_description: cannot execute script saved to a file
long_description:
OpenOffice.org 643C Srcipting framework early developer release version 0.1.

This bug is described in two parts firt user deploys a script to the user
application area creates a binding and then removes the script. The user then
deploys a new script with the same name as the original to a document the
previouslky created key binding should cause the script deployed to the document
to execute.

Part 1. 
1. Start jedit
     Browse to Utilities>Global Options...
     Browse in the Global Options dialog box to the Proxy Servers.
     Check Use HTTP proxy Servers and set all information needed for jEdit to
access the web.
     Click on OK. 

     2. Browse to Plugins->Plugin Manager...
     Click on Install Plugins (If you get errors then your Proxy is not well
setup)
     Then you get a list of plugins.
     The plugins needed for Scripting IDE are AntFarm and Console.
     So just select them if you cant find them on the list then you have them
already installed.
     Click on install
     Just to make sure you have the latest AntFarm and Console click on Update
Plugins
     Click on Close.
     Exit jEdit.

     4. Start jEdit again.
     Browse to Utilities>Global Options...
     Select Plugins->Office Scripting
     Select the Path of your Office installation.
     Ensue you select Apply  select OK.

     5. Select Plugins->AntFarm->Build Options
     Select Run Ant Targets in the same JVM.

     6. Browse to Utilities>Global Options...
     Select Docking
     Activity Log docking position: bottom
     Ant Farm docking position: right
     Console docking position: bottom
     Error List docking position: bottom
     File System Browser docking position: left
     Office Scripting docking position: right
     Click on Apply click onOK.

     7. Click on the Office Scripting button on the right of the frame.
     Right click on all parcels.
     Select New
     Enter the name of the new parcel e.g. HelloJedit.
     Select a directory where you want the parcel to be built .

     8. In the left hand frame the HelloJedit script is opened you need to add
the following lines to the top of the script
     immediately after the first import statement

     import com.sun.star.uno.UnoRuntime;
     import com.sun.star.frame.XModel;
     import com.sun.star.text.*;


     9. Add the following lines within the public class HelloJedit class.

     XModel model = xSc.getDocument();
      XTextDocument textdoc = (XTextDocument)
                 UnoRuntime.queryInterface(XTextDocument.class model);
      XText oText = textdoc.getText();
      XTextCursor oCursor = oText.createTextCursor();
      oText.insertString(oCursor Hello jEdit false);


     10. Right click on  'HelloJedit' and select ScriptCompile.
     After complation has successfully completed right click on 'HelloJedit'
and select Build Parcel SXP.
     In the scripting framework dialog that appears select all methods in the
left frame and add to scripts (right frame).
     Select Finish.

     11. Right click on the HelloJedit.sxp parcel and select Deploy to
OpenOffice.org.
     Check that the scripts have been deployed to
/user/Scripts/java.

     12. Assign an event  to execute the script.
     -Start OpenOffice.org  writer document.
     - Select Tools Assign Script(java) To Menu.
     -In the popup dialog
          in the select script function select a script e.g. HelloJedit.doMethod
         Select File in the Top Level menu drop down list.
         In the New Menu enter a menu item name e.g. HelloJedit.
         Select New Script Menu select ok.
     - Select OK when prompted to restart OpenOffice.org. Exit and restart
OpenOffice.org writer document.
     - Select File HelloJedit - Hello jEdit should be inserted into the
document.


Part 2.

     Delete directory /user/Scripts/java/HelloJedit.
     OpenOffice.org is not running.
     A previously created OpenOffice.org writer document e.g. TestBindjE.sxw


     1. Start Jedit
     Click on the HelloJedit.java file listed under All Parcels HelloJedit.
     Change the text in the hellojedit.java file from Hello jEdit  to Hello
jEdit 3---.
     Select File Save.

     2. Right click on hellojedit and select Script Compile.
     After complation has successfully completed right click on 'HelloJedit'
and select Build Parcel SXP.
     Select Finish.

     3. Right click on the HelloJedit.sxp parcel and select Deploy to Document.

     4. Check that the script has been successfully deployed to the document by
running unzip -l  TestBindjE.sxw. (Unix) 
     or pkunzip -v  TestBindjE.sxw (Windows). You should see the script saved in
the document.

     5. Launch OpenOffice.org note the previously assigned bindings as setup in
part 1 still apply to the TestBindjE.sxw 
     document. Open the TestBindjE.sxw document.

     6. Select File HelloJedit - Hello jEdit  3--- should be inserted into the
document.

short_description: OOO_STABLE_1_PORTS/X11:  (vcl) disable xkb discovery so menus draw faster
long_description:
XDarwin has incomplete Xkeyboard extension support.  This results in a message
being printed out the stderr every time XkbGetKeyboard() is called in
vcl/unx/source/app/keysymnames.cxx.  This error message slows down the drawing
of all menus in OOo considerably.

Therefore its going to get disabled until XDarwin gets better Xkeyboard support.

Dan

short_description: Similarity Search
long_description:
Similarity search when checked disables the search's ability to search for 
anything.  It simply finds nothing each search.  Once I disable that it finds 
stuff.  I really love that feature in StarOffice and it works great in 5.2.

short_description: Openoffice.org Bonsai
long_description:
There needs to be a version of bonsai on openoffice.org. Personally I 
need to be able to see what code is being checked in and what it does. 
Bonsai is not the same as CVSWeb it displays the latest checkins unlike 
CVSWeb which views the cvs repository. Bonsai isn't the easist thing in 
the world to setup but is not very hard. Just pull mozillla/webtools/bonsai 
from the mozilla.org CVS (cvs instructions at mozilla.org/cvs.html) and 
follow the instructions in the README file.

short_description: Problem with locking cells in table
long_description:
I have a problem with the attached document. Whenever I unlock a cell and save 
the document the unlock settings are not saved. Also I locked two cells in the 
upper table and suddenly after having saved the document a third cell was also 
locked.

Howto reproduce this issue.
1. 
Lock the the upper right cell and the lower left cell. Save the document and 
close OOO. Now open the document and the upper left cell is now also locked.

2.
Lock the upper left cell and the lower right cell. Save the document and 
close OOO. Now open the document and the lower left cell is now also locked.

3.
Lock the cell containing the word: Vedr.:. Save the document and close OOO. 
Now the cell just below the this cell is now locked.

My guess is that this properly also is the cause of OOO not saving the 
information when I unlock a cell.

short_description: Fix references to errno
long_description:
Hi

Per ISO C standard (7.5 [#2]) errno is not guaranteed/supposed to be a variable. The 
attached patch fix that for dmake. Indeed on recent enough glibc 2.3.X (CVS) errno is a 
macro.

Rationale: nuke reference to extern int errno; and #include  instead.

short_description: 'Brochure' printing explanation unclear
long_description:
It is really unclear from the Help how exactly to use the 'brochure' function to
produce a fold-up booklet. Since there's no print preview as yet I don't want
to waste paper experimenting so I thought I'd ask for clarification first.
Say you start with e.g. a set of A4 landscape pages laid out in two columns
what do you have to do (apart from ticking the 'brochure' option in Print) in
order to end up with the pages laid out as A5 on folded A4 landscape paper?
I'm used to using the booklet function in WordPerfect where you use Page
Divide and then the print system knows to reorder the pages to get them in the
right place for a folding booklet. Is this the same and if yes how do I set up
the pages?
Thanks
- Padmavyuha

short_description: EPS export doesn't work properly (Text width is not correct)
long_description:
When EPS exporting a drawing a few problems occur:
1. gradient filled non-square objects are transformed into black rectangles (see
issue 8131 which's closed in Linux but clearly should be reopened);
2. more important the transparency effect doesn't turn out in the exported
files. This is a common problems with exporting in EPS (yet in this case it
happens also with GIF and I suppose other formats).
3. Marginally text isn't recognised as such by LaTeX psfrag and accordingly
replaced. However my inability to operate psfrag could take a big role in this.
Thanks.

short_description: dmake throws exception
long_description:
The following describes a reproducable way to crash the MSVC 6.0 build
dmake.exe

Take your normal OOo build environement with already generated winenv.bat.

start a cygwin bash.

In bash start a 4nt shell:
$ c:/4NT401/4NT.EXE

Go to your OOo source directory
E:\>cd w1\testdmake

Call winenv.bat
E:\w1\testdmake>winenv.bat

Enter soltools
E:\w1\testdmake>cd soltools

Build it!
E:\w1\testdmake\soltools>build

Boom! You get the following exception.

You don't get this if you start 4nt from the desktop and not from a shell.

You don't get this if you use a self-made MinGW dmake.exe

short_description: please connect form elements in calc with cells
long_description:
Hi

form elements in calc should have more abilities to interact
with the cells in a spreadsheet document.

E.g. combo- list- checkboxes command- and optionbuttons should
have the possibility to write the user selection into a cell.
At least the list-/reference entries of combo-/listboxes should have
the possibility to be filled over a cellrange (or better a named range
like X_DATA -> $Sheet1.A1:A10). If the values in the cell range change
an automatic update should be possible ...

It would be cool if some of the configuration could be done 
with the autopilot ... such as

connect the form with 
a) a database
b) the spreadsheet

At the moment I use the control model Tag like X_SELECTION;X_DATA
in combination with a macro to do this but for an automatic update
I think I would have to install some listeners ...
And this solution seems to  difficult for a normal user ...

The automatic update problems refers to my RFE Issue 10896 ...

best regards

Oliver

short_description: bad $vlang  or $(vlang) variable leads to bad directory name
long_description:
Due to some errors after installing the hungarian edition directory entries are
share/template/hu-HU -> should be hungarian
it's root is common.xcd -> common.xml  it holds the directory data and gets 
it from the $(vlang) variable. 

$vlang variable is set in two .cxx files in the OpenOffice source tree. While 
the first is o.k. for hungarian  the second one contains the hungarian $vlang 
variable remarked. So this patch was needed:

--- pathoptions.cxx.orig	2002-05-30 13:46:39.000000000 +0200
+++ pathoptions.cxx	2003-02-10 12:33:16.000000000 +0100
@@ -1667 +1667 @@
 #define	REPLACEMENT_SWEDISH				ASCII_STR
(swedish)
 //#define	REPLACEMENT_TURKISH				ASCII_STR
(turkish)
 //#define	REPLACEMENT_NORWEGIAN			ASCII_STR(norwegian)
-//#define	REPLACEMENT_HUNGARIAN			ASCII_STR(hungarian)
+#define	REPLACEMENT_HUNGARIAN			ASCII_STR(hungarian)
 //#define	REPLACEMENT_BULGARIAN			ASCII_STR(bulgarian)
 #define	REPLACEMENT_CHINESE_TRADITIONAL	ASCII_STR
(chinese_traditional)
 #define	REPLACEMENT_CHINESE_SIMPLIFIED	ASCII_STR(chinese_simplified)
@@ -6959 +69510 @@
 				case LANGUAGE_NORWEGIAN_BOKMAL		:
 				case LANGUAGE_NORWEGIAN_NYNORSK		:
	aReplacement = REPLACEMENT_NORWEGIAN;
 									
					break ;
-
+*/
 				case LANGUAGE_HUNGARIAN			
	:	aReplacement = REPLACEMENT_HUNGARIAN;
 									
					break ; 
+/*
 
 				case LANGUAGE_BULGARIAN			
	:	aReplacement = REPLACEMENT_BULGARIAN;
 									
					break ; */

Note: The default branch of the case in the source does nothing and thus 
aReplacement's value remains the previously set LanguageID or something this 
is a no-good thing. Enter 
aReplacement=checkpathoptions.cxx.for.this.language; to the default branch...

short_description: EPS export fails (wrong PS Font Name & strange commands)
long_description:
Please take a look at these files: 
http://www.icsy.de/~jfrey/demo.sxd and
http://www.icsy.de/~jfrey/demo.eps 

The generated .eps cannot be display as it contains 
very obscure commands at the end of the file
For example:
=======================> snip <===============================
-2147483648.-2147483648 -2147483648.-2147483648 t
-2147483648.-2147483648 -2147483648.-2147483648 m -2147483648.-2147483648 
-21474
83648.-2147483648 l -2147483648.-2147483648 -2147483648.-2147483648 l 
-214748364
8.-2147483648 -2147483648.-2147483648 l -2147483648.-2147483648 
-2147483648.-214
7483648 l
eoclip newpath
gr
=======================> snip <===============================

Furthermore the file prints incorrectly on my PS printer (HP LJ6MP)
as the font Helvetica Italic is named HelveticaOblique whereas
its real postscript name (see .ppd file) is Helvetica-Oblique.

Another problem always occuring is that texts in Helvetica font 
get odd character spacing. This must be related to font display
at it does not occur if _all_ helvetica fonts are removed from
the system. (Well that ain't even a workaround a linux without
any helvetica does not last long - believe me.) I assume that 
character spacing is calculated by the screen fonts which will 
always be the rasterized version ahead of anything else. That oblviously
leads to _very bad_ printout.

short_description: remove the need for pre-compiled Mozilla tarballs from OOo build environment
long_description:
The Address Book integration of OpenOffice.org is implemented using Mozilla
components. For this to achieve pre-compiled Mozilla components are checked
into the CVS repository
(http://external.openoffice.org/source/browse/external/moz) from where they're
used during build time (this includes the complete include tree of Mozilla as
well as libraries needed at build or only runtime).

This approach has several disadvantages:
* It unnecessarily increases the size of the source tree
* It is heavily platform/compiler dependent: Potentially there needs to be a
dedicated set of tarballs for every supported platform/compiler combination.
This will become a nightmare the more platforms OOo will support.
* It is very unflexible: Every small fix requires a complete rebuild and
re-checkin of all tarballs.

We should change this so that
* only our patches to Mozilla (relative to a given milestone of Mozilla perhaps
different versions relative to different milestones) are checked into the CVS
repository
* the mozilla tarballs are built during a regular OpenOffice.org build (this is
probably the preferred way)
OR
* the mozilla tarballs can be build separately and a configure option allows
the OOo build environment to point to these pre-built tarballs

short_description: Date recognition broken - feature should be configurable
long_description:
I have had many problems with data files containing text looking vaguely like
dates but _not_ being dates at all. For instance I have a text file with the
value 20-29 in a column by which a mean a _range_. I want this to be considered
as text. But the spreadsheet tries to convert those strings into dates giving
meaningless results and corrupting my data. I can't find a way to turn this
feature off.

The date recognition feature should be configurable (at least at an on/off
level).

beanshell language right click on the new parcel and build it.

user.

Bug-->
NetBeans incorrectly reports that there is already an existing beanshell.sxp

It appears that NetBeans is erroneously recognising the user/beanshell directory
as a valid deployed script ??.

long_description:

short_description: uno interfaces broken by subclasses
long_description:
In ::com::sun::star::uno::XInterface and ::com::sun::star::uno::Reference 
virtual member functions throw () or nothing yet derived classes 
throw ::com::sun::star::uno::RuntimeException 
and ::com::sun::star::lang::IllegalArgumentException.

I found this problem in cppuhelper and now again in UnoControls.  I may be 
building on IRIX 6.5 with gcc 3.0 using libstdc++ rather than STLport however 
these 'wrongs' dont make the code right.

My guess is that the correct fix is for the uno interfaces to throw all 
possible exceptions by all current derived classes

(ps Sorry if this is the wrong product)

short_description: handling of overlapping cell boundaries different to Excel (alignment - left justified)

if it would attempt to display the contents anyway ala Excel.
Also the alignment of the text which is displayed is unpredictable.
For example say I have a column total is given a title (Total Sales This
Month) and I try to right-align the text so that it just reaches the next field.
Doesn't work. It displays Total S> (where the > is the little arrow). Even when
the field is expanded to be large enough to properly display the text the
right-alignment never happens.
Good luck whoever works on it!
Great work so far...

Dan

framework fail to provide (symbol scoping) linker mapfiles.

For a detailed description see the 'meta task' issue 11945.

short_description: Script URI syntax change separator to &
long_description:
Currently the Script URI syntax allows optional paramsters to be added as name
value pairs separated by + 
It is legal to do so but more common practice would suggest that & should be
used. Normal HTTP query syntax so should reuse the metaphor.

Should not impact any examples or script uri's that just use the logical name.
Check the support Star Basic code to see if any script uri's are being
constructed with name value pairs.

short_description: Can't resize table column with mouse without ruler
long_description:
Title: You can't resize a table column with the mouse unless the ruler has been 
opened in this editing session.

Steps to reproduce:

1) Create a new text document.
2) Add a table with at least two columns.
3) Click on the divider between any two columns (you'll see the splitter icon) 
and attempt to drag the divider.

Observed: Nothing happens
Expected: Columns to resize.

4) Now turn on the ruler: View | Ruler.
5) Repeat step 3. It works.
6) Now turn off the ruler: View | Ruler
7) Repeat step 3. It still works.
8) Save the document. Close it.
9) Reopen the document.
10) Repeat step 3.

Observed: Nothing happens
Expected: To resize columns.

short_description: Fill handle double-click
long_description:
In most spreadsheets adjacent columns simple fill in rows sequentially until 
the last row that is filled in the previous column. I noticed that Excel has a 
very useful feature to exploit this fact to make it easy to enter large amounts 
of data using the fill handle instead of copy-paste. If you double-click on the 
fill-handle (the plus sign at the bottom right corner of the last cell in the 
selected range) the sequence in the data in the selected range is copied till 
the last row for which data is entered in the previous column.




Starofice should also have this feature.

short_description: ROW function faults
long_description:
Formula:
=CELL(ROW)

Spreadsheet structure:
This function in same column and multiple sequential rows.  Should result in a
column of sequential numbers based on row number.

Symptoms:
If a preceding row is deleted the following cell values are not updated even
with a manual recalc.

Expected result:
The values following the deleted row should be updated.

Secondary problems:
Calc becomes unstable.  Usually results in a crash at some point during further
editing.  May also crash if the spreadsheet is saved and reloaded to force a
refresh.  Hard to reproduce.

short_description: no DESTDIR support
long_description:
So; in the Unix package world there is this DESTDIR concept by which you can
alter the behavior of a normal package install via. an environment variable.

This causes the package to install to a new prefix; and yet that package itself
_thinks_ that it is being installed to the root prefix. This is a very powerful
technique for RPM / DPKG etc. building and there are a number of ugly hacks in
the packages out there to accomodate the problems that arise with this.

[ namely sedding Office/Common.xml and then trying to force the config cache to
re-generate (if you're lucky) ].

This patch adds support for DESTDIR and OODESTDIR environment vars that achieve
a similar effect.

The tag suffix '_nodestdir' is inelegant but functional. Of course it's likely
that other instances of progdir need that suffix; I was targetting only that one.

Comments most welcome.

the resulting impress file

short_description: Confusing text in data source dialog
long_description:
When there is no address book defined and you select mail merge a dialog shows
up with the text:

'No data source has been set up yet. You need a data source such as a database
to supply data (for example names and addresses) for the fields?
[OK] [Help]'

The second sentence starts as a factual statement but ends as a question.
However the question can only be answered with 'OK'.

Suggested text:

'No data source has been set up yet. You need a data source such as a database
to supply data (for example names and addresses). Do you want to set up a data
source now?
[Help] [Don't set up] [Set up]'

short_description: Mistake in faq answer..
long_description:
The answer to question 006 about outlines incorrectly says that the button to
show the numbering toolbar is to the left of the text toolbar:

At the extreme far left of the text toolbar (the bar that displays font name
font size etc.) there is a small arrow that points to the left. Click on it.
You will now see the numbering toolbar.

That button is actually to the far RIGHT of the text toolbar.  This took me a
while to figure out but it is stately correctly later in the answer:

Click on the left pointing arrow to the far right of the text toolbar. This
will expose the numbering toolbar.

Just need to fix that first part..

short_description: Increase accuracy for dimension lines
long_description:
When displaying in inches the dimension lines only resolve one decimal place.
Common US measurements use 1/8 1/16 and even 1/32 accuracy which can't be
conveyed with only 1 decimal place. 

The best solution would be to allow fractional representation of values as that
is what most users would use both professionally and for
hobby/repair/renovation projects. Decimal is usually only used for mechanical
design work and that is normally with three decimal places.

And when the units are set to feet the common breakdown is feet-inches -
fractional inches. Draw only resolves to 10ths of a foot which is rarely practical.

Alternatively giving users the option to select the number of decimal places
would be a big improvement over 10ths of an inch. We normally can convert at
least to 1/8 increments in our heads and smaller increments using charts.

This would open an entirely new set of users to Draw - architects woodworkers
cabinet-makers and blacksmiths (that's me :=).

short_description: TIS-620 encoding on Linux
long_description:
TIS-620 is the standard encoding of th_TH (glibc) locale.
It can be converted to Unicode using RTL_TEXTENCODING_MS_874.
Although MS-874 is not TIS-620 but rather an extension
it has been used heavily in MS environment. So using MS_874
repertoire under the TIS-620 signature known to Linux rather
than creating a new repertoire can provide compatibility
across platforms.

The patch is also essential in making SalFrameData::HandleKeyEvent()
{vcl/unx/source/window/salframe.cxx} work properly with Thai XIM
in XFree86 4.1.0 so that the 8-bit key codes are converted to
Unicode instead of being interpreted as Latin-1 characters.

diff -Nuar sal/osl/unx/nlsupport.c sal.fixed/osl/unx/nlsupport.c
--- sal/osl/unx/nlsupport.c     2001/07/17 11:34:19
+++ sal.fixed/osl/unx/nlsupport.c       2001/07/26 08:08:18
@@ -3446 +3447 @@
     { T.101-G2                   RTL_TEXTENCODING_DONTKNOW }    /*
ISO-IR-128 */
     { T.61-7BIT                  RTL_TEXTENCODING_DONTKNOW }    /*
ISO-IR-102 */
     { T.61-8BIT                  RTL_TEXTENCODING_DONTKNOW }    /* T.61
ISO-IR-103 */
+    { TIS-620                    RTL_TEXTENCODING_MS_874   }    /*
th_TH.TIS-620 */
     { UTF-8                      RTL_TEXTENCODING_UTF8 }        /*
ISO-10646/UTF-8 */
     { VIDEOTEX-SUPPL             RTL_TEXTENCODING_DONTKNOW }    /*
ISO-IR-70 */
     { WIN-SAMI-2                 RTL_TEXTENCODING_DONTKNOW }     /* WS2 */
diff -Nuar tools/source/string/charset.cxx tools.fixed/source/string/charset.cxx
--- tools/source/string/charset.cxx     2001/07/17 11:35:17
+++ tools.fixed/source/string/charset.cxx       2001/07/26 08:08:46
@@ -5376 +5377 @@
     { T.61-8BIT      RTL_TEXTENCODING_DONTKNOW }    /* T.61 ISO-IR-103 */
     { UTF-8          RTL_TEXTENCODING_UTF8 }        /* ISO-10646/UTF-8 */
     { VIDEOTEX-SUPPL RTL_TEXTENCODING_DONTKNOW }    /* ISO-IR-70 */
+    { TIS-620        RTL_TEXTENCODING_MS_874   }    /* th_TH.TIS-620 */
     { WIN-SAMI-2     RTL_TEXTENCODING_DONTKNOW }     /* WS2 */

 };

short_description: DB connection handling in Subforms
long_description:
Subforms in design mode open additional connections to the underlying database 
and the connection is not always being closed after closing the form.

Proof: Create a subform in Adabas while logged on as a user who has only the 
right to have a single connection and try to enter the database in the subform 
properties.

With a multi-connection user Adabas refuses the connection with Too many 
users connected after working with several subforms in design mode.

Closing the form doesn't help you have to close the quick launch in order to 
get rid of the connections.

short_description: Problem with VLOOKUP when saved as XLS
long_description:
There seems to be a problem with the VLOOKUP formula when the spreadsheet is 
saved as an XLS file and re-opened. When you do this and then try to edit the 
formula it changes to displaying the formula itself rather than the result. I 
noticed this with 1.0.2 and have just re-tested with 1.0.3 and the problem is 
still there. 

To replicate do the following:

1. Create a Calc spreadsheet as follows:

	1	Apples
	2	Bananas
	3	Pears
	4	Peaches
	5	Grapes
		
	5	=VLOOKUP(A7;A1:B5;2;0)
	2
 
The VLOOKUP formula displays Grapes as expected. 

2. Save as an OpenOffice spreadsheet (SXC) and close. 

3. Open the SXC edit the formula everything works fine.

3. Save as an XLS and close.

4. Open the XLS and edit the formula by changing the A7 to A8 i.e. 
   to say =VLOOKUP(A8;A1:B5;2;0)

   Instead of displaying Bananas the formula itself is displayed i.e. 
   =VLOOKUP(A8;A1:B5;2;0). After that nothing you can do will get it
   to display the formula result again. 

   Tools | Options | Spreadsheet | View | Display formulas is un-checked so
    that is not the problem.

short_description: Table of contents not word-compatible
long_description:
Word2K document with table of contents opened in OO displaying the TOC
incorrectly and when re-saved from OO the new file displays the TOC
incorrectly in Word as well.

In OO the TOC appears with the section numbers in the correct locations but
the section titles are right-justified and the connecting character runs
between the section number and the section header text.  The page number is
wrapped to the next line with a new line of connecting characters.  Updating the
TOC with 

When this document is saved and the result reopened in Word the text is still
right-justified but the ruler appears to be offset by the amount of indent
given the section header -- in other words the right-justification is ragged
but consistent with the left edge of the section header number.  The page number
is even farther right outside of the normal text area.  Doing an update field
on the TOC results in a display like OO gives -- page numbers wrapped to the
next line and all lines right-aligned.

Headers in this document are constructed as heading 2 type with tabs between
the (typed) heading numbers and the heading text.

short_description: Hyphenation doesn't honor user settings
long_description:
Use a paragraph style with Hyphenation set to automatically and 3 Chars at line
end and 3 at line begin.
The language doen't matter as long you have hyphenation enabled for that language.
(Tested with german and english).

Now write a line and near the end write blabla QPD 1 blubb
---------------------------------------------------^ fixed space.

If you now insert some random signs at the beginning of the line you'll see
that you will get:
blabla QP-(here is the wrap)
D 1 blubb

It doesn't help to put QPD= in a user dictionary either.

Oh I just saw it divides QPD1 (without space) also into QP-D1

It doesn't honor the Tools-Options-Writing Aids: Minimal number for hyphenation
settings either.

Only setting the language to something unknown helps.

(QPD is Quadrant-Photo-Detector)

short_description: Heading Titles Display Improperly When Scrolling Through Document

Appendix A
My Appendix

Then the scroll title appears as Appendix AMy Appendix with a small box in-
between the entries.  Perhaps this box should be replaced with simply a space.

Many text process object in Openoffice.org seem to work this way. 

What you see is what you get! is great but if what you see is not what you 
expected you have to stop you project. Process True Type font correctly is a 
must.  
I am supprise to see Openoffice has this problem.

short_description: can no longer build toolkit with -frtti since IComboListBoxHelper added
long_description:
Hi

Up through 644 m11 I have been able to build every OOo build
using -frtti as my CXXFLAGS in unxlngppc4.mk

Now since the addition of the IComboListBoxHelper.hxx and friends
in the OOo 1.1 Beta 2 of toolkit I get the following error
when checkdll is run:

Checking DLL ../unxlngppc.pro/lib/check_libtk644lp.so ...: ERROR: 
../unxlngppc.pro/lib/check_libtk644lp.so: 

undefined symbol: _ZTIN7toolkit19IComboListBoxHelperE
dmake:  Error code 1 while making '../unxlngppc.pro/lib/libtk644lp.so'
---* TG_SLO.MK *---

ERROR: Error 65280 occurred while making /src2/ooo11b2/toolkit/util
dmake:  Error code 1 while making 'build_all'
---* TG_SLO.MK *---



And c++filt _ZTIN7toolkit19IComboListBoxHelperE shows:

typeinfo for toolkit::IComboListBoxHelper

and yes I am building with -frtti

Is there any reason why gcc 3.2.2 can not generate the proper type information
here?  I looked at IComboListBoxHelper.hxx and noticed there where no
local or class vars included int he class defintion but and it first glance
I thought all of the methods were pure virtual (= 0).

But 3 new mthods at the end are classifeid as virtual but are not pure virtual
methods like the ones above it.

I am not sure this has anything top do with what is confusing gcc here and why
it can't generate type info for a global IComboListBoxHelper class.

Will someone please take a look at that class and see if they can recreate the
problem when building with -frtti

Thanks

Kevin

short_description: Arrow for cell note misaligned when column near right screen edge
long_description:
This is probably not a bug but it could stand some visual improvement.

Put a note in any cell.  Scroll the sheet so that the cell column is closest 
to the right edge of the screen.  Hover the mouse over it to display the 
note.  The note overlays the cell (can no longer see contents) and the arrow 
appears inside the note box.

This contrasts to the normal behaviour -- when there is room -- of a cell note 
appearing to the right of the cell and the arrow appearing outside the note 
linking the cell and note.

Is it possible to detect when there is not enough room to properly display the 
note on the righthand side of the cell and instead flip it over to the 
lefthand side?

short_description: Remove the static library version from the tg_compv.mk
long_description:
The tg_compv.mk contains a list of glibc for the particular compiler in use. 
For example gcc 3.2 has version 5.0.3 glibc library.  This is valid at the time
of basic installation however it is equally as likely that this will be upgraded
to a newer version later  for example when I install gcc 3.3 it also install
library 5.0.4 and this is ABI compatible with the 5.0.3 version so it was
superceded and gcc 3.2 also started to use that version.

I belive that what we need to do is to parse the library list for 5.0.? and then
pick the largest number.

For an understanding on how library numbers are defined there is a discussion in
the autoconf book under libtool.

library of the document. Nothing is visible at all so a developer has no
reference for migrating imported macros.

short_description: Multiline cells in Calc - How to create them ?
long_description:
********* THE DEFECT *********
It's easy to create multiline cells in Calc typing some text then tapping
Control-Enter. This is a KEYBOARD entry method. 
Alas CALCULATED entry doesn't seem to work. For instance the following FORMULA
=ABC&car(10)&DEF
displays ABC?DEF in the cell nothing else. 
Trying to replace car(10) by car(13) or car(31) gives nothing different.
********* THE ENHANCEMENT ****
I suggest to change the CAR() function so that CAR(10) or CAR(13) or car(31)
work as line separators (these values are unused at present).
As a reference FileMaker Pro can export multiline cells using the CAR(31)
character as separator while Excel seems to use CAR(10)=LF. I fact the formula
=ABC&car(10)&DEF doesn't work as entry in Excel ne marche pas davantage dans
Excel mais but at export the individual lines come separated by a LF.

************** Below in french ****************

Dans Calc on peut crÃ©er des cellules contenant du texte sur plusieurs
lignes sÃ©parant les lignes Ã  l'entrÃ©e en appuyant sur ContrÃ´le-EntrÃ©e.
En revanche on ne peut pas crÃ©er ce genre de cellule par formule. Ainsi:
=ABC&car(10)&DEF
affiche ABC?DEF et rien d'autre. Et remplacer car(10) par car(13) ou
car(31) ne donne rien de mieux.
J'aimerais que car(10) ou car(13) ou car(31) soit pris en compte
comme sÃ©parateur. On peut penser Ã  car(31) parce que c'est effectivement
le sÃ©parateur qu'on obtient dans les documents texte exportÃ©s par
FileMaker Pro mais Excel prÃ©fÃ¨re car(10) (la formule
=ABC&car(10)&DEF ne marche pas davantage dans Excel mais Ã 
l'exportation on rÃ©cupÃ¨re un caractÃ¨re LF entre les diffÃ©rentes lignes
et Ã§a marche aussi en importation).
De fait Calc perd cette mise en forme Ã  l'exportation vers un fichier
CSV DIF ou SLK il met une espace Ã  la place du saut de ligne.

short_description: misinterpretation of real numbers in imported CSV files
long_description:
In czech version of Calc when importing .CSV (coma separated values) file into 
spreadsheet some real numbers are misinterpreted as date value. When integer 
part is in range 1 - 12 and fractional part is 2 or 4 digit long then integer 
part is interpreted as month and fractional part as year. Day is assumed as 1. 
I.e. 2.6685 is interpreted as 1.2.6685 (Februar 1st 6685).
The only way I have found to get rid out of it is to manualy change type of 
column from Standardni to Anglicky (USA) for all affected columns (each 
column individualy).

* select Bibliography/biblio as well as 3 arbitrary columns

* press Next 2 times
* press Back 2 times
* press Next reaching the sort page this way.
  Note that the document in the background behaves as if you reached the layout
  page - the table for the report is already added (this normally happens only
  when you enter the layout page)
* press Next

actual result
=============
nothing happens

expected result
===============
the layout page is opened

short_description: Page margins & table of contents not set correctly
long_description:
Hi

I just downloaded OpenOffice 1.1Beta 2 for testing purposes and I found these 
bugs (i couldn't find another bug but appologies if there is one) in the 
margin translations and page settings.

To test OpenOffice I downloaded a word document 
(http://www.microsoft.com/windowsserver2003/docs/ADtechover.doc) from the MS 
webiste and then opened it in both word and open office. Here's some of the 
probs I found:

In page 3 (contents) in OO the Contents 2 style has been rendered correctly 
however the information has been indented past the edge of the page. Now I have 
checked it in word and it renders it correctly however it has done this by 
setting a manual tab stop at 15.22cm. Also for some reason OO displays the 
page settings as riduculously large for the TOC only.

Also I found that the page margin settings in OO seem to be broken as while 
the left and right margins are correct the top and bottom appear to have been 
set to the header and footers instead of the actual top and bottom.

There are some other issues such as paragraph after bullet style hasn't had 
the indent settings set correctly in OO but overally - bloddy good job and it's 
heaps better than the earlier versions.

short_description: Spellcheck problem with straight and typographic apostrophes
long_description:
Maybe this is this a lingucomponent problem? 
 
If while custom single quotes are disabled I add a word to the dictionary 
that contains an apostrophe the word will be considered a spelling error if I 
later enable custom single quotes and retype the apostrophe.  Vice versa. 
 
For instance the spellchecker considers Babington's to be a different word than 
Babington?s. 
 
Shouldn't both be considered the same word?

short_description: Erro ao trocar a impressora na hora de imprimir
long_description:
Caros colegas

Percebi que ao imprimir no OpenOffice se a impressora que desejo imprimir não 
for a padrão ele não imprime.
Por exemplo tenho as impressoras imp1 imp2 e imp3. A impressora imp1 é a 
padrão. Quero imprimir na imp2. Então após selecionar Arquivo Imprimir mudar 
para imp2 e clicar em Ok aparece a seguinte mensagem: Ocorreu um erro 
irrecuperável. Todos os arquivos foram salvos e poderão provavelmente ser 
recuperados ao reiniciar o programa.
Já fiz vários testes inclusive reinstalar as impressoras e o OpenOffice mas 
não resolveu.
Sempre que preciso imprimir e a impressora não for a padrão acontece esse 
problema.

Nenhum outro programa apresenta erro algum ao imprimir em qualquer uma das 
impressoras instaladas.

Meu sistema operacional é Windows NT Workstation 4.0 Português com Service Pack 
6 o OpenOffice é o 1.0.3 (pt_br) e a impressora é a HP Laserjet 4000 com 
driver para PCL 6 e outra com driver para PCL 5e.
As impressoras estão instaladas na rede através do Samba.

Atenciosamente

José Eduardo Candido Ribeiro
suporte@elvepe.com.br

short_description: Problem with Windows XP Startmenue
long_description:
English:

Only one OO Icon can appear in Windows XP (Most Recent) Startmenu at the same 
time:

Problem:

In Windows XP appears only one OO Icon (link) in the (most recent programs) 
startmenu even if you start a second Module for hundreds of times. It seems 
that Windows XP only shows ONE link/icon for ONE program. Since quite some time 
the separate modules are not started via separate exe files but via the 
soffice.exe. So Windows XP only recognizes ONE program and shows just one icon 
(the first one which makes it into the list).

Workaround:

For every Module you want to display in XP most recent Program startmenu you 
have to make a copy from soffice.exe and rename it with e.g. modulename.exe 
(writer.exe calc.exe aso...). Now adjust the shortcut properties in the 
(conventional) Startmenu for every module you has created an separate exe file. 
For Example change programdir\soffice.exe -writer into programdir\writer.exe 
-writer. If you start the modules now often enough they will appear in the 
(most recent programs) startmenu.

Sideeffects:

Since now I only recognized one side effect. If (for example) the 'new' 
writer.exe is the first OO Application you start then will be WRITER.exe 
shown in Taskmanager and not soffice.exe even if you start calc.exe later 
which will not appear separately in Taskmanager. This has no effect on used 
memory.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------


German:

Wenn z.B. Writer das erste Programm ist dass es unter Windows XP ins StartmenÃ¼ 
der am hÃ¤ufigsten genutzten Programme schafft scheint dort nie ein anderes OO 
Icon auf egal wie oft man im nach hinein z.B. Calc startet. Grund dafÃ¼r ist 
dass XP scheinbar nur jeweils einen Link auf EIN Programm zulÃ¤sst. Und seit 
neuerem sind die einzelnen Module ja keine selbststÃ¤ndigen Programme mehr 
sondern werden nur Ã¼ber andere Flags unterschieden.

Workaround:

FÃ¼r alle Programme die im XP StartmenÃ¼ aufscheinen sollen muss man die soffice.
exe kopieren und umbenennen. FÃ¼r Writer z.B. in Writer.exe. Danach muss die 
VerknÃ¼pfung im Alle Programme StartmenÃ¼ entsprechend angepasst werden. Also 
statt  Programmverzeichniss\soffice.exe -calc muss Programmverzeichniss\calc.
exe -calc angegeben werden. Dann klappt's auch
mit dem XP StartmenÃ¼ ;-) Nebenwirkungen bisher -> keine. AuÃŸer das wenn Calc das 
erste Programm ist das man startet auch CALC.exe im Taskmanager steht egal ob 
man spÃ¤ter noch ein anderes Modul startet.

PS: Wer die Option Logo=0 in der soffice.ini nutzt muss auch die soffice.
ini kopieren und umbenennen. Z.B. Calc.exe braucht Calc.ini usw.


MfG Cole Bantam |  Salzburg/Austria

short_description: please add iscii-devanagari to sal/textenc to support Hindi
long_description:
Hi  
  
The Hindi developers are well under way  to creating a Hindi dictionary for OOo.  But MySpell has 
a constraint that all dictionaries and affix files be encoded in a 1 byte = 1 char style encoding and 
OOo conversion routines are used to convert from unicode to this encoding and back. 
 
Since there is no  1 byte-1char encoding for Hindi the uathor of the hindi dictionary would 
very much like to add iscii for Devanagari to sal/tentenc. 
 
They have written the unicode to iscii conversion routines and back which I will 
attach to this issue in case it helps. 
 
Thanks 
 
Kevin

short_description: Patch: This adds Quotation support to docbook XSLT files
long_description:
The following patch adds support for using the native Open Office Quotation
style in DocBook documents.  This is important because  charater is being
wrriten in UFT-16 or otherwise it's being translated to garbage in DocBook output.

Currently Quotation in the style list does not map to DocBook  markup
element. 

Note: Quotation (character style name in open office) is written as Citation in
the resulting native Open Office XML file format.  Is this correct? 

file docbooktosoffheadings.xsl

    
        
            Citation
            
        
    

file sofftodocbookheadings_article.xsl

short_description: Error converting MS-Word document to FlatXML
long_description:
The aforementioned MS-Word document seems to have something in it that causes
OOo to create invalid XML. When I convert this file to FlatXML using 1.1b2 and
run it through a Java XML parser I get the following error...

org.jdom.input.JDOMParseException: Error on line 1: Content is not allowed in
prolog. caused by: org.xml.sax.SAXParseException: Content is not allowed in prolog.

I'm not quite sure what the problem is. If I open the MS-Word document in Word
and re-save the problem seems to go away so probably my version of MS-Word is
doing something different than whatever version created this file. Suggest that
your Word conversion experts take a look at this one.

I suggest also that your OOo regression tests should have some rigorous XML
validity checking since the OOo XML seems to be invalid in a lot of boundary cases.

short_description: Proposal to change the Name of the Writer context menu Default Option and add other options.
long_description:
Proposal to change the Name of the Writer context menu 'Default' Option and add other 
options. 
 
The name of writer (right-click) context menu 'Default' option is confusing as we have default 
styles and named styles. What this function does is force the selected text (or the word the 
cursor is on) back to the named paragraph style (not the Default paragraph style). The function 
also removes all other character style and settings. 
 
What I suggest we have an option to force the selected text back to the named paragraph 
AND character styles only. That is all the arbitrary margin shifts bold italics are removed but 
not the named character styles. 
 
My suggestion is the current context menu Default item be replace with a Item to an other 
menu. It could be called 
 
Revert Format  > 
 
or  
 
Force Format  > 
 
The 3 menu options would be  
 
-------------------------------------- 
Force Format to style - 
 
Default  
Named Paragraph  
Named Paragraph & Character 
 -------------------------------------- 
 
Or these could be placed in the context menu if it seems better no to require another menu 
selection. 
 
One of the goals of the OpenOffice Bibliographic project is to be able to ensure that a document 
conforms to a style standard. Functions like this proposal are necessary to achieve this.

long_description:
Hi

'00:00:00:00:00:00'\n);

I'm not connected via ethernet now so DHCP running on eth0 did not received any
reply thus SIOCGIFADDR got 00::00.

short_description: OpenOffice1.0.3 Writer - Contour graphics are laid over text
long_description:
If a graphic is inserted by Insert/Graphic/From File and after it is put on 
the right place the contour feature is turned on in the context menue all 
seems to works fine: The text is aligned around the contour of the graphic.

But if the document is saved (as an sxw-file) closed and reopend the text 
isn't aligned on the contour of the inserted graphic anymore but the graphic 
is laid over the text.

If the graphic is moved a little bit and then released the text is realigned 
as it should be. But who wants to move every graphic every time the document is 
opened?

I observed this bug only on Windows 9x. Once I installed a SuSE-Linux-
Distibution on my computer and tryed out OpenOffice on it. But the bug wasn't 
there.

short_description: Cannot locate Configuration on start
long_description:
I just installed OpenOffice build 638 on my system (GLIBC 2.2.3 kernel 2.4.8
XFree86 4.1.0)

It was installed in my home directory as that user
(/home/odd/OpenOffice.org638). When I try to execute the soffice binary (the
symlink to program/soffice) found in the aforementioned directory I get this
failure message:

$ ./soffice 
Unable to retrieve application configuration data: Cannot locate Configuration:
Invalid user installationAborted
It should be mentioned that all of the files are owned by the user which
installed the software and which is trying to run the software.

I should also perhaps mentioned that I had problems with previous builds
because I didn't have lpr stuff installed and various relating commands. Of
course these shouldn't be a requirement (but that's a whole other bug!) but I
managed to pass that with some touch'ing of files et cetera et cetera. However
this looks like another problem...

short_description: Executing python scripts in win32-tcsh environment
long_description:
In order to execute python scripts in a win32-tcsh environment the following
things need to be done:

- add PYTHON environment variable which shall encaspulate all occurences where
the python interpreter is invoked.

- add PYTHONPATH and PYTHONHOME environment variables in the guw.pl
- adapt pyuno/test makefile so that it passes also the test in this env

short_description: Manuel de formation sur le traitement de texte
long_description: Manuel de formation pour utilsation srandard  pour la version 1.1

short_description: Initial support for Kaffe:  build officecfg with Kaffe
long_description:
This patch adds support for config_office to recognise Kaffe as a known JDK and
sets JDK=kaffe for the build makefiles.

Kaffe needs the classpath switch to be supplied in different ways depending on
whether you are compiling or running Java:

 javac -classpath xxxx
 java -addtoclasspath xxx

Therefore I have broken up the JAVACPS variable:  Now you need JAVACPS for Java
and JAVACCPS for javac.

I have updated solenv/inc to recognise JDK=kaffe and set JAVACPS/JAVACCPS
accordingly.

configure will print a warning message that Kaffe support is still experimental:

checking the installed JDK... checked (Kaffe 1.0.7)
configure: WARNING: EXPERIMENTAL: Kaffe is not a full JDK replacement - some
projects will fail to compile

There is no change in behaviour for the existing Sun JDK so it should not affect
normal builds.

Thanks to Jarno Elonen (elonen@openoffice.org) for help to get officecfg working
with Kaffe.

short_description: no font display using 16 bit display and Vera
long_description:
no font display using 16 bit display and Vera. Start the current Solaris
OpenOffice setup. It installs Vera to /var/tmp/* . Display to a 16 bit Linux
display does not show any glyph. Seems that Antialiased display to 16 fails
without using RENDER (the used Solaris box does not have libXrender).

short_description: puctuations' font in R2L text differ from the default paragraph font
long_description:
(Original bug Report by Mattan)
To recreate bug follow this steps:
1) write an hebrew doc. with puctuations. with different font then the default
2) check a puctuation's (say a dot) font - it's times-new-romans - should be
like the Hebrew one.
One of the sideeffects is that when choosing much Hebrew text - the choose-font
bar becomes blank (as there are two different fonts in the selected text the
dots and the text)

Pretty Hard to notice but Mattan really has it when it comes to obscure bugs...

short_description: Word 200 filter: export stw document to word loose formating
long_description:
Create a new Office document enter a few lines:
* centered text
* lines with bullets
When exporting to word: 
* centered formatting is lost
* bullets are not drawn with the right symbol
* there is no indentation between bullet and text 

Also standard bullet lines in word are with indentation indentation that is lost when importing a simple word document.

short_description: dbghelp.dll is missing within srx645m9s3 wntmsci8.pro master build
long_description:
After installing srx645m9s3 wntmsci8.pro ooo11rc integration build the
dbghelp.dll is missing within the program directory

short_description: pdf export converts italics to normal
long_description:
The pdf export funcionality does convert text that is in italics to normal 
(Tahoma) text that is in bold underlined italics to NONbold underlined italicy 
(TimesNewRoman). I think the press will love this feature ... 

Then I would like to add my comment to the other pdf-issues: I also think that a 
little bit more control over the pdf like resolution font embedding bookmarks 
and so on would be really necessary to make the PDF-funcionality not just a nice 
addon (that one occasionally uses instead of other and for this very point of 
time much better additional applications) but a killer feature. Although this 
means a lot of work ...

Nevertheless thanks to everyone who is trying to keep OOorg the best 
OfficeSuite available.

short_description: 11rc:  berkeleydb patch for OS X and gcc 3.3
long_description:
Not really specific to gcc 3.3 but bring in the updated berkeleydb patch.  Also make sure to use 
g++ for C++ linkage since Apple's g++ magically adds in require libraries whereas 'gcc' doesn't.

short_description: Testing issues@ mailing list
long_description: Test whether this goes to 'issues@' or 'bugs@' mailing list.

short_description: = appears as - in text files
long_description:
When addin a formula in the text editor with = for example the one from the 
Help
a^2+b^2=c^2 %% Pythagorean theorem.
the equality sign = appears as -.
(Most formulas do have =:)

long_description:
There is an omission of a word in part in the text of README(Japanese) this
patch correct a mistake.

short_description: Issuezilla mails not threaded
long_description:
One of the most useful features of issuezilla mail is the threading feature -
such that one can glup together all E-mail on an issue in a single thread.

This doesn't work with issuezilla but works with eg. Gnome / Ximian bugzilla -
and is sorely missed. It should be _extremely_ easy to add an:

In-Reply-To: 

header in every mail - and this would have the desired effect - presumably this
is a minor template change somewhere - can we have it ?

short_description: Record Number Field does not print out with Mail Merge
long_description:
How to reproduce:
Set up a mail merge and include the record number field as one of the data
fields inserted on to the page.  Perform the mail merge and the numbers will not
print out.

This bug was not part of the 1.0.x releases.  I wonder if it is related to Issue
15100 ?

long_description:

to allow work on i15986 to continue.

long_description:

Otherwise build fails at odk/pack/checkbin.
I created following patches:
patch-odk+util+makefile.pmk
patch-sdk_oo+util+makefile.pmk

short_description: Quasi-fixed position of figures tables etc.
long_description:
In LaTex figures tables etc. are normally put at some convenient place on a 
page according to layout rules.
Well of course OpenOffice is not LaTex (and should not be). Nonetheless it 
would be very nice to be able to place a figure at the top or bottom of a page 
although it is ankered to a specific paragraph. Thus the figure would always 
stay on the same page as the paragraph it belongs to but would behave as if it 
were fixed to the top or bottom of that page. 
In the situation as it is now fixing a figure to a page is of almost no use in 
a growing technical documentation e.g. Or is there a workaround I don't know?

Greetings
Walter

short_description: PDF Export: files need to be tagged to be accepted from Acrobat Reader for Palm OS
long_description:
exporting a file to pdf and afterwoods importing in for Acrobat Read for Palm 
OS runs into an errormessage and aboting of converting process.
Repro:
Load OpenOffice 1.1 RC load any text (should be more than one page) export 
it as pdf-file. Settings for exporting are not relevant but should be the 
whole text.
Now switch to Acrobat Reader for Palm OS and try add this exported pdf-file 
to the list of files for the Palm.
After adding there will be a warning that this is not a tagged PDF-File. 
Continue with klicking on the OK Button. Immidiatly after there will be an 
errormessage saying: error in converting to the tagged pdf-format 
pagestructure could not be read and the converting is aborted.

Expect: 
Full compatible pdf-format which could be used from any other pdf-enabled 
application especially from adobe !!

  http://www.openoffice.org/issues/show_bug.cgi?id=16222

       OPT=$OPT $PTHREAD_CFLAGS;;

  flags: -ldl -lnsl

framework project download list. After spending two days trying to figure out 
why the scripting framework that I downloaded from the download list wouldn't 
install correctly I finally found out there was a new version. A link to the 
new file will hopefully prevent other users from going through the same 
experience.

resulting page
(http://www.openoffice.org/issues/enter_bug.cgi?component=www&component=openoffice.org%20source%20downloads) 

conatins only:

(wwwopenoffice.org source downloads) in order to report an issue against it.

short_description: Insert Sheet... From file with text/CSV data Import Text dialog incomplete
long_description:
It looks like this would be the case for any text data that requires going through 
the import dialog to create the new sheet. 
 
To reproduce: 
 
Open Calc any Calc document new or otherwise 
Select Insert Sheet... from the Insert menu 
Insert Sheet dialog comes up 
Select From file radio button 
Press Browse... button 
File selection dialog comes up select any appropriate text (eg .csv) file and click 
Insert 
Import Text dialog comes up without anything in the Fields section 
Guess proper settings hit OK on Import Text dialog 
Hit OK on Insert Sheet dialog 
If settings were guessed correctly Sheet will be properly created

short_description: VLOOKUP in Help Files Has wrong reference
long_description:
Under Spreadsheet functions in the Help Files clicking on VLOOKUP does NOT take
you to VLOOKUP.

short_description: Hangs between slides of different background colors
long_description:
I created a new presentation where the title slide has black as its background
color while all other slides use the default white background color.

Upon starting the Slide Show in fullscreen mode the title slide is displayed
correctly but pressing the SPACE-key results in a blank screen rather than the
next slide. After that nothing happens until I escape the Slide Show mode.

Starting from slide 2 works fine. Changing the background color of the first
slide to white works fine too.

I am using the app-office/openoffice-bin-1.1_rc1 GENTOO package of OpenOffice.

short_description: wrong tooltip for restore view
long_description:
When using the configuration dialogue to map new commands to the menu the 
tooltip associated with restore View in the view submenu which appears when 
you mouseover the command in the selection list is wrong. It says that the 
command assigns or edits shortcut keys for OOo snip>. I haven't checked the 
customese tooptil to see if that has simply been swapped.

short_description: That navigator should allow us to move betweeen documents
long_description:
Maybe this is already possible: in that case I wil rewrite this as a bug in 
help. But I think that it should be possible to use the Navigator as a means of 
moving between two documents. At the moment it is possible to have one document 
in the Navigator and another one as active so that sections from the 
navigated document can be dragged (in one form or another) to the document 
you're working on. 
This is good. 
What would be better would be to let a ctrl-click on the navigator switch the 
main window to the navigated document at that point. This would about doble the 
usefulness of the Navigator since it means that you can easily find passages 
which for one reason or another don't show up there.

short_description: press kit files
long_description:
please update these files

louis

short_description: Flat XML Filter crashes Impress Presentations
long_description:
If you create a simple presentation save it as Flat XML using the Flat XML
filter then try and reopen it using the Flat XML Filter OpenOffice crashes and
dies. Spreadsheets and WP documents work fine.

At the attached URL I have my TypeDetection.xcu file which I have modified to
enable the Flat XML Filter which is included with OOo 1.1 RC2.

short_description: Word file import get confused when track changes enabled
long_description:
The file connected with this has been sent direct to stefan.baltzer
as it is Sun Internal.

I have been unable by nature of this problem to cut it down in size.

the problem is that the font size changes and paragraph settings appear to 
change.

If the word file is first saved with track changes turn off and all changed 
accepted openoffice does a MUCH better job.

For example the first 3 lines of the document should read:
Draft (12.5.200027.07.2000)  [Subject to contract]




Date                  2000





(bold)Sun Microsystems Ltd

(where vertical white space is present and the 12.5.2000 is deleted text 
and the 27.07.2000 is new text.

Openoffice deletes the vertical white spacing and the bold text of Sun 
Microsystems Ltd.  It also does not display the 15.5.2000 text instead 
displays a blank variable field.

Further in the document you will see the text in section 8.5 and 9.1 are 
different font sizes although they are the same in the source file.

Again if the edits were accepted in word before importing to openoffice this 
fault does not occur.

short_description: Menu can't be updated after a Floating Frame deleted
long_description:
This defect happened in Text Document and Spreadsheet.

Re-creatable steps:

1. New a file in Text Document or Spreadsheet
2. Insert a Floating Frame by clicking Insert -> Floating frame
3. In Floating frame fill out in Name input area attach a file in Contents 
area and then OK to exit
4. Select this floating frame
5. Delete this floating frame
6. The issues is: after the floating frame is deleted the menu items in object 
bar and menu items in main menu for example in Format menu will keep 
unchanged for floating frame object. 

At this moment you may try to type some text select the text click Format 
menu please not the format you look at is for floating frame but not for text.

This results in the menu is unusable for all of the other objects. Actually 
you will can't do most of thing unless closing and restarting the applicaation.

short_description: in as length unit
long_description:
When specifying a length in should also be an abbreviation for inches.
Currently OOo uses constructions like fo:margin-left=1.5inch instead of the
abbreviation that one would expect from the XSL-FO specification (namely
fo:margin-left=1.5in)

(I'm not sure if this is a defect or an enhancement; it's a little of both I
guess.)

short_description: If a bacground color is choosen for a style OpenOffice crashes
long_description:
This one is very easy to reproduce:
1-) Start a text document from start menu (Start>Programs>OpenOffice.org 
1.1>Text document)
2-)Save the document (if the document is not saved it does't crash)
3-)Click menu Format>Styles>Catalog
4-)Click New button.
5-)pick the name you want for a style (a non-existing name such as koko)
6-)Change the Next Style to Default
7-)Change Linked with as -None-
8-)Leave the category as Text Styles
9-)Go to the background tab
10-)Pick a color and click OK.

Right there OpenOffice crashes. If you have any other documents open (such as 
spreadsheet) will also be gone. An uncoverable error occured message will be 
displayed and you need to restart. Fortunately all the files is saved and 
automatically recovered.

In addition if you try to open a MS Word document with colored-background 
styles this crash occurs. So you are not really able to open such word 
documents.

short_description: problem pasting graphic objects (compressed)
long_description:
Hello.  I am using spss for windows and I take the output from the program and 
copy/paste the objects into OOo.  In earlier versions this worked fine.  In 
RC3 there is a problem with display.  the objects are pasted in but they are 
compressed all of the way against the left margin.  I can select them and then 
use the handles to pull them out but this is a strange behavior.   In 1.0.3 
and Office XP they will paste as their copied size.

I am attaching a file the demonstates this.  If you scroll through it you will 
see the headers and then a bloack line  in places along the left margin.  
Further down you will find a few objects that I have pulled out to their 
normal size.  Click on  one the black margin lines and then grab and pull the 
handle that appears it will reveal the object.  It should paste in at the 
normal full size.

Cheers

--chris

short_description: Autocorrect of I some text
long_description:
Hi

I've noticed an annoying AutoCorrect behaviour that needs fixing. It is an
incorrect automatic conversion of a block of text to a numbered list (capital
roman). To reproduce try typing in Writer:

I bob smith really dislike quirky autocorrect

When you hit return/enter after the word 'autocorrect' OO.o will convert your
sentance into the first point in a list with captial roman numbering.

Expected behaviour: no autocorrect functions activated.
Actual behaviour: sentance incorrectly converted to bullet list.

This makes sense for:

I: Blah Blah Blah

or

I. Blah Blah Blah

but not to my mind 

I Blah Blah Blah

I can reproduce this in OOorc{123} OO.o 1.0.3 and all others I've tried.

short_description: Color type in UNO API
long_description:
Many places in the UNO API (module udkapi) use type LONG to represent colors. 
There are currently three ways how this is done:
-  Use the UNOIDL typedef com::sun::star::drawing::color documented as ARGB.
-  Use the UNOIDL typedef com::sun::star::util::color documented as ARGB.
-  Use UNOIDL type long directly without documentation.  This is the vast majority.
The proposed fix (see dev@api.openoffice) is as follows:
1  Mark the UNOIDL typedefs com::sun::star::drawing::color and
com::sun::star::util::color as deprecated.  Their names (small c) do not
follow our guidelines.
2  Introduce a new UNOIDL typedef Color in an appropriate module documented as
ARGB.
3  Change all places that currently use long directly to use Color instead.  If
some of these places use long to represent RGB instead of ARGB (or something
else) probably more new UNOIDL typedefs have to be introduced.
4  Change all places that currently use com::sun::star::drawing::color or
com::sun::star::util::color to use Color instead.
The changes in 3 and 4 can be observed via the com.sun.star.reflection
mechanisms but should not be incompatible.

short_description: UDK: no documentation on what exports XUserInputInterception and XExtendedToolkit
long_description:
There is no documentation either in the Developer's Guide nor in the IDL
reference of the UDK 1.1 Beta on what service exports the XUserInputInterception
and XExtendedToolkit interfaces. As such these two interfaces are impossible to
use without without word-of-mouth information.

short_description: excessive indentation due to numbering level
long_description:
This is an incompatibility between uSoft Word and StarOffice 6.0 beta.

I'm sorry this is my first day with StarOffice or issueZilla I'm not sure 
which build version = 6.0 beta.

I have a Word document which has bullets attached to Heading styles.

StarOffice understands all the paragraph styles and properties regarding the 
indents.  However what it displays and prints has a lot of extra left indent 
due apparently to its own implicit numbering level assignment.  These 
paragraphs have numbering style None but nonetheless the default seems to 
get them severely indented (some past the margins).

Given that (to my knowledge) Word doesn't have Numbering styles maybe this
is an inherent conflict between number/bullet treatment in Word vs StarOffice?
I don't know.

Demo document is in http://www.cs.rochester.edu/STAROFFICE/BugDemo-2001-10-
12.doc

short_description: The summary of the events should be auto-sized in week view and month view
long_description:
The summary of the events in the week view and month view should be auto-sized.
i.e. if the space is wide enough the summary should include the start and end
time if the spance is relative wide the summary should include just the start
time of the event lastly if the space is too narrow to host the time
information no start and end time will be shown.

short_description: German language site
long_description:
Germanophones are one of largest usergroups of OOo and most of OOo's developers 
are germanophones. Yet there is little integration of the users and 
consequently little connection to developers of OOo. A lang.de project shall 
serve as platform to connect germanophone developers and users to the OOo 
project by providing forums of communication on code bugs and news related to 
OOo.

Phase 1: Evaluation of quantity and quality of participants
phase 2: definition of mission statement
phase 3: Analysis of lang.fr experiment results
phase 4: adaptation of lang.de to the findings of phase 3
phase 5: assignement of technical responsabilities by OOo community management
phase 6: implementation
phase 7: monthly feedback

parallel phase: buolding a nearby download software

short_description: general input/output error
long_description:
I have a presentation which when edited in Impress 1.1rc3 under either Windows
2000 _or_ RH 9 (2.4.22) eventually cannot be saved.  Saving fails with General
input/output error in both cases.

I would be happy to send the presentation to someone who debugs such things but
it contains company-confidential information.  If there is some set of actions I
can take to diagnose this such as running OO under gdb or compiling a version
that logs debugging information to a file I'd be delighted to do so.

Incidentally the following things work when I get into this situation:
a) create a new presentation copy all slides into the new presentation and
save that immediately.
b) generate PDF output
c) save as PPT (to the extent that saving any presentation as powerpoint works).

If I do (a) above I can edit that presentation for a while before I get into
this error situation again.  The presentation is large (2.3 MB) but not terribly so.

Here are some things that don't work:
a) rename file return to Impress and try to save to original filename again
b) save under a different name but still in sxi format
c) quit other applications and try again

Thanks.

short_description: When undoing a move operation of multiple objects selection should be restored
long_description:
Using the word processor:

1) Select multiple objects (using mouse click and SHIFT key)

2) While HOLDING DOWN the mouse button after the last selection drag the
objects somewhere else in the document
3) Undo

The multiple selection should be restored but it is not.  Note that this does
NOT occur if you simply do a multiple selection RELEASE the mouse the click
and drag the selection.

The reason this bug is annoying is that quite frequently when trying to select a
number of objects one accidentally will move the mouse causing some of the
objects to move (but not all the ones you want).  You then UNDO the accidental
move but you have to start all over again selecting all the objects.

short_description: database table column are shifted to the left after execute a special query
long_description:
OO 1.1.0 RC4 spreadsheet.

I made query something like this:

SELECT DISTINCT(Table1.IDField) Table1.* FROM Table1

Expected result: 
---------------------------------------
IDField | IDField | Field1 | IDField2 |
---------------------------------------
    1   |    1    |   aaa  |   bbb    |
    2   |    2    |   ccc  |   ddd    |
---------------------------------------

But i got :
-----------------------------------------
IDField |  Field1 | IDField2 | IDField2 |
-----------------------------------------
    1   |    1    |   aaa    |   bbb    |
    2   |    2    |   ccc    |   ddd    |
-----------------------------------------

Data are beeing displayed corect but all field names are shifted to the left.

short_description: Add further instruction to first page of Issuezilla
long_description:
Recently there have been a couple of questions on the users mailing list
requesting help on how to entering Issuezilla. I have the impression that at
least some of them can easily be avoided by a slight modification of the very
first page of Issuezilla:

Someone who´s new to Issuezilla might be put off by the first page of the
Issuezilla dialogue. While there´s no link to the HowTo page the list of
components is by no means easy to understand and get past it. Especially for
those who don´t know what component to select (e.g. if they want to report
printing problems).

So my suggestions are: To the first page of Issuezilla ...

(1) add a link to HowTo page
http://www.openoffice.org/bugs/bug_writing_guidelines.html

(2) after line First you must pick a component on which to enter an issue.
add: If not sure select a component which seems at least loosely connected with
your problem. It will be corrected by us later if necessary.

Guido

short_description: Report Autopilot grabbing phantom data.
long_description:
Report Autopilot grabbing phantom data. I have run many tests and keep getting the same 
results. These are the common steps 
1) Open oowrite 
2) View data sources 
3) Create new datasource connect to my database 
4) Right click on a table 
5) Select Report Autopilot... 
6) Select fields and format for the report 
7) Create the report 
 
My simple test table has 15 records in it. The result is the report has 70 or so records and only 
the first record has data each cell contains a text string that I do not have in my database and 
I have no idea what it means because it is a foreign language. This is the text Ut wisi enim 
ad minim veniam quis nostrud exerci tation. If one of my fields is a date field then that field 
will contain one date and time that is repeated in each record.  
 
If I use the default data source that comes with OO the biblio table and make a report form 
that then in the background I can see the cells fill with the funny text message but when it goes 
to generate the report the text is replaced with proper data and it works. It does not work with 
any other data source. I have tried ODBC data sources and oocalc files. If I use Form 
Autopilot... that works just fine I see the data and can work with it.  
 
I have tried this on Mandrake 9.1 Red Hat 9.0 Debian 3 and Windows all have the same 
results.  
 
I downloaded the newest 1.1RC4 for Linux and now it just crashes when I try to generate a 
report.

short_description: Q-PCD Security-17: Possibility for multiple people to sign a document (multiple signatures)
long_description:
Task tracking system for Childs
PLEASE CREATE CHILD-TASKS IN ISSUEZILLA!

Source
various

Category
Digital Signatures and Encryption

Product Requirement 
It must be possible for multiple people to sign a document (multiple signatures). 

Customer Need/Problem
Documents will be passed along or exchanged many times between parties.
Therefore the different authors must be able to sign the content that they
added or sign for approval purposes.

Comment
 

Eng Effort
 

Eng Owner
Michael Brauer/Matthias Huetsch

Product Concept
Supports of multiple signatures is added on document level (see Security-1) and
within documents (see Security-2). Within each level signatures are
independent. This means that even if two signatures reference the same content
or nested content none of the two signatures includes the other one in its
digest calculation. When a whole document is signed the document's signature
includes all signatures existing within the document. This means that after the
whole document has been signed signatures for parts of the document might be
added but the ones that exist at the signing time cannot be removed any longer.
Whenever a signature is added the referenced content gets non editable.
However it is still permitted to add additional signatures to such content.

Functional Specification
-

short_description: Q-PCD ThirdPartyIntegration-30
long_description:
Source
MBA

Category
-

Product Requirement 
Embedding SO/OOo into other clients.

Customer Need/Problem
Providing object linking and embedded functionality from SO/OOo to other
clients including in-place editing.

Comment
AI: MBA ? please provide more info. Some already targeted for Geordi

Eng Effort
-

Eng Owner
Mathias Bauer

Product Concept
SO can embed its own formats on all platforms and also OLE objects from other
applications on Windows. SOGeordi added the new feature that SO objects can be
embedded via OLE into other applications documents on Windows. In this case and
also in the case of 3rd party objects embedded in SO activation of the object is
only possible out-place no in-place activation is possible.  
Q will allow to use in-place activation in both cases and also add the currently
missing feature of linked objects. 
Besides that the whole embedding functionality and API (currently C++ in future
UNO based) will be redesigned to support arbitrary embedding techniques objects
and persistence models and to support the implementation of such objects in all
programming languages suppported by UNO.
The switch to an API solution will also drastically improve the maintainablitiy
stability and extendability  of the code. 
Some examples for features that will be enabled by these changes: 

- It is possible to add support for comparable embedding and activation
procedures from other platforms like Bonobo on Gnome (if there is a demand for
that) but also support for objects implemented in Java.

- Embedding persistence and activation will be treated as orthogonal
functionality that means embedded objects are not forced to support persistence
or acticvation. So we can have embedded and activatable objects without own
persistence data ('lightweight' objects) like embedded charts that get their
data from an ambedding container. This is a feature that makes our own charts
more usable and more comparable to Excel charts. 

-The enhanced embedding capabilities also improve the Microsoft operability on
the file level. Currently embedded SO/OOo objects in exported MS documents are
stored in MS format or in our old binary format. The first alternative has the
drawback that the object must be exported and imported back when loaded again
and this export/import cacle may cause some data loss.  The latter alternative
has the drawback that there is no way to activate the embedded object in the
document if it is loaded into the competing applications application and of
course the old binary format is also at risk to cause data loss f.e. we will
lose all CJK attributes).  In Q those objects will be stored as full featured
OLE objects using our XML file format with full support for activation in an
competing applications container without any possible data loss.

Functional Specification
-
