short_description: Q-PCD Performance-10
long_description:
Task tracking system for Childs
PLEASE CREATE CHILD-TASKS IN ISSUEZILLA!

Source
End users

Category
Responsiveness

Product Requirement 
ppt presentation takes a long time to load and the graphics draws/displays very
slowly Slide shows is takes too long to render each slide competing applications
presentation has 5 - 6 second delay with the hour glass icon between each
slide. Impress also does not seem to render the next slide in anticipation nor
does it cache previously rendered slides. Frequently users must return to a
previous slide. If it is 5 or 6 slides back it takes 30 seconds to step back.
Running Solaris 8 x86 dual 1.0 GHz cpus with a half GB of memory

Customer Need/Problem
Improve responsiveness speed on solaris especially in Impress

Comment
 

Eng Effort
 

Eng Owner
Kai Ahrens

Product Concept
The current presentation engine which is a separate part of the Impress
application has a long evolution history. Many parts of this engine are are
subject of improvement needs meanwhile. Beside loading of some special
presentation files which may take longer than in competing applications in
several cases all other Product Requirements seem to be addressable with a
redesign and complete reimplementation of the presentation engine of SO/OOo
Impress.   In detail:  - Slow graphics display and long rendering time will be
covered by the the redesign of the basic graphics toolkit. This toolkit is
responsible for drawing graphic primitives on the screen. Currently VCL is used
for this purpose which has the drawback of not being hardware accelerated
which is essential for smooth rendering and animations. Actually competing
applications seem to use DirectDraw/Direct3D for their presentations rendering 
engine. In the first step we should try to use Java2D as the low level part of
the Graphics Toolkit. If this doesnt fit our needs we have to think about a
complete new low level layer based on OpenGL for example.  - On the
presentation side we have to redesign the current engine. This is necessary to
make use of the new (fast) Graphics toolkit. The other reason for a redesign is
that we have to use double buffering for smooth object and slide animation
effects. This double buffering technique is completely different from the
current animation rendering model which makes up the biggest part of the
current engine.  - Currently the next slide is rendered in anticipation but
previous slide are not cached. A redesign will cover these questions of course
so that delays for slide changes during the presentation will be minimized. This
new cache will be very flexible so that adjustments can be made very easy to
get the best performance.

Functional Specification
-

short_description: WW8: writerword difference in handling tabstops outside page text area
long_description:
In the (to be attached) example there are three cases.

The first two cases are a tab and no following content to a tabstop outside the
page text area where word will not line wrap but writer will. This is quite a
common case the filter until recently would strip out trailing tabstops. The
underlined example of case two shows the obvious problem with that approach.

And case three shows an uncommon trick which you can make word do with these
tabstops

short_description: Q-PCD Improve Emergency Recovery and Combine with AutoSave Feature
long_description:
(Quality-3)

Source
Mktg

Category
Stability

Product Requirement 
Default action automatically saves a backup copy of the file based on number of
changes or time elapsed and automatically recovers the users work environment
when the apllication has been terminated anomaly.

Customer Need/Problem
Automatically saving a copy as the default will lessen the likelihood that a
crash will cause a user to lose a substantial amount of work if emergency would
not be able to save modified document.

Comment
-

Eng Effort
-

Eng Owner
Frank Loehmann

Product Concept
Introduce new ?AutoRecovery? function with the possibility to configure the
saving time frame. ?AutoRecovery? recovers all SO applications (including all
documents cursor and window positions) exactly to the previously saved state.
The user will get the same work environment he had before the application has
terminated. User will be informed using dialogs.

Functional Specification
- Restoring documents will happen regardless if documents were modified when SO
has been crashed. - Restore current application setting (default saving dialog
Picklist) - Default of option is on default time period is 10 minutes
(0=emergency saving only) saving the data will hapen in background. -
Furthermore SO tries to make an emergency save of all modified documents in the
moment when SO crashes. - These emergency saved documents will be restored in
favor when SO recovers if they are not present (hanging app/system power
blackout or defect emergency file the previously recovered docs will be used
instead - Latest AutoRecovery doc will be kept until the moment of successfully
restoring the emergency saved documents - Saving a document always updates
(withdraws) the emergency saved information for this doc. - Recovery information
will be used on startup if the application has been abnormaly terminated before
(hanging app protection fault or blackout) - Think about integration of
document repair function and error report wizard of CJ.

short_description: wierd behavior on opening and saving rtf files
long_description:
I have a rtf file written in Ted (version 2.14) I opened it on OO and it showed
some paragraphs in an vertical line (starting from the bottom and finishing on
the top of the page) mixed with normal formatting. (this looks similar to the
description in issue 10698)
I saved the file with OO and opened it in Ted and the paragraphs before
caracters such as [ and bold+underlined words had simply dissapeared! (these
were the paragraphs that OO showed in a vertical line) Also a jpg picture I
inserted on the document had dissapeared.
I fixed the paragraphs in Ted (furtunately I had a printed copy of my file) and
added the picture again. Then I opened the file in OO and now it shows all the
paragraphs in correct formatting (which is even wierder) and the picture.
I remember this vertical text problem happend also with may old OO version (I
think it was 1.0.2)
I will attach both files though I dont have the one with the wierd formatting
anymore. If it happens again I will save it and attach too.

- type in some text
- make it bigger and outline
- put a picture or square as background / under the text
- export to pdf

Then you will see that the outline text
is transparant instead of white fill. So
you see only the black outline of the text

short_description: Macro assigned to Function SAVE FILE
long_description:
Macro created with macrorecorder sorts four tables in a spreadsheet.
When assigning this macro to the function SAVE FILE this happens only once. In 
all further savings the macro has no effect.
Cancelling and reassigning the macro to SAVE FILE has the same result as above.

PS. A macro in word processor with the same function works fine.

short_description: Cut row and paste special crashes Calc
long_description:
1. Highlight an arbitrary row by clicking the row index on the left side.
2. Ctrl + X to cut the row.
3. Select a cell in the first column and right-click & do Paste special.
4. Under Shift cells the Down item is grayed out so select Right and
click OK.
5. A message pops up that reads Filled cells cannot be shifted beyond the
sheet.  Click OK to close the message box.
6. Select an arbitrary cell and type in something.
7. When you hit the enter the mouse corsor chages to an hourglass and after a
bit of hard disk access sound the error report dialog comes up indicating that
the application has just crashed.

There are two things to note here.  One is why is the Down item under the Shift
cells group grayed when a row is cut into the clipboard?  The other is of course
the crash.

When you copy a row instead of cutting it however you can successfully paste
it with cells shifting down as expected.

Kohei

short_description: crash on ODBC datasource when username not set
long_description:
Attempting to browse the tables of an ODBC datasource that was created
without entering anything in the username field causes OO to abort with
an unrecoverable error. Entering anything (even a nonexistent username)
into the username field prevents the crash.
I am connecting to a PostgreSQL DB with UnixODBC under linux. The problem
happens both in OO 638c and the Staroffice 6 beta.

To reproduce:
(install OO->workstation install; UnixODBC; create ODBC datasourcePostgreSQL)
1) in swriter choose Tools | Data sources ...
2) click New Data Source
3) set Database type -> ODBC
4) for Data source url -> press .. and choose ODBC datasource PostgreSQL
5) click OK to create datasource (do not enter anything under the ODBC tab!)
6) now choose View | Data sources
7) expand the new data source
8) expand Tables

Actual result:
OO aborts with an unrecoverable error.

Expected result:
OO should display a meaningful error message (and should not crash!).

My environment:
OpenOffice.org build 638c
Linux kernel 2.2.19; i686 with 128 MB ram;  glibc 2.1.2 (RedHat 6.1)
PostgreSQL 6.5.2  (from RH 6.1)
unixODBC 2.0.9 (from http://www.unixodbc.org/; compiled on RH 6.1)
(contents of /etc/odbc.ini available if you want it)

short_description: create (toolbox) icons for spin button form controls
long_description:
This is a sub task of issue 21605.

We need new icons for spin button controls in the following versions
- usual small toolbox format both in normal and high contrast versions
- usual large toolbox format both in normal and high contrast versions

fs->sts: The specification for this is linked from the main issue (21605).
A spin button is basically a scroll bar which contains *only* the arrow buttons
at the end but nothing inbetween :). If you want me to I could send you screen
shots of such a control for inspiration :)

short_description: spin buttons: allow for horizontal orientation
long_description:
In the course of issue 21605 we will offer the possibility to include spin
button form controls into documents.

There already is a VCL control which implements a spin button (SpinButton
spin.hxx/spinbtn.cxx) but it currently lacks a feature which is needed for the
new control: It must be able to have a horizontal orientation instead of always
being vertically oriented.

short_description: ScrollBar: no visual feedback when focused
long_description:
The SpinButton control does not provide visual feedback when focused which does
not conform to our Accessibility requirements.

This wasn't a problem until issue 21277 which requires us to implement
standalone scrollbar controls for the form layer.

fs->ssa: As talked about: The keyboard handling in scrollbars is already
present so when they are focused they keyboard already works. Fortunately
focussing is *not* done upon mouse click even with the WB_TABSTOP style.
So the only think needed is really the visual feedback. I suggest a blinking
thumb as seen in other applications.

Thanks :)

short_description: Immediate crash of the program at 'EXPAND SLIDE' button in the Insert menu.
long_description:
In an existing presentation containing more than one slidethe summary slide 
button inserts a slide in the presentation with the summary of all the titles 
in the existing presentation slides.If the 'EXPAND SLIDE' button is pressed 
after the summary slide has been inserted from the same menu ie 'INSERT'at the 
top menu bar the program crashes immediately.

Steps to Reproduce:
1)Insert a slide in the presentation file and put some title in the title field.
2)Next go to the insert button and click the summary slide button.
3)A summary slide is inserted with the title of the previous slide in the text
  field.
4)Again go back to the insert menu and notice the presence of expand slide 
  option.
5)Click the expand slide button.
6)Unrecoverable error occurs.

Additional Condition: 
There should be at least one slide with the title present in the file before 
the summary and expand slide buttons are activated.

Actual Result:
 The program crashes with the message Â“unrecoverable errorÂ”

Expected Result: An additional slide with the sub-details of the presentation 
should be inserted.

Build date and Platform: 
Encountered on the build 638C on 11/12/01 on Windows 2000 5.00.2195 service 
pack 2

Additional Builds and Platforms: Encountered on Window ME as well.

short_description: Embedded Graphics Disappear Randomly in slides (also in Writer)
long_description:
On creating and saving slides embedded graphics and pictures disappear 
randomly and leave empty image placeholders in their place.

Using OO1.1 on Windows XP fully patched with SP1 and all hotfixes. The 
graphics I was trying to embed were standard jpg images approx. 30k in size. 
Disappearence seems random but I have managed to re-produce the issue on the 
same system using the same details below. Problem is not immediately obvious 
and does not manifest straight away - timing is random. Other users have noted 
the same problem here on Redhat systems

http://www.oooforum.org/forum/viewtopic.php?t=3436&view=next

however I can find no bug relating to this specific issue seems to have been 
logged.

Created a new document using an existing Powerpoint template. Template loaded 
fine with embedded company logo visible and correct. Created title slide and 
15 plain slides with either plain text or embedded additional graphics. After 
a seemingly random time the embedded graphics in the slide began to disappear 
leaving image placeholders in their place. Deleting and re-inserting those 
graphics returned the images temporarily. On changing and moving between 
slides returning to the slide with the graphics showed the graphics had once 
again disappeared.

As stated in the link above linking to the graphics instead of embedding them 
worked and no further disappearence of the linked images occured. However 
eventually (and at a different time to the graphics in the slide) the embedded 
graphics on every slide created from the template disappeared.

mike

short_description: Wrong line break due to hyphenation problem
long_description:
If you insert a full stop (.) after the German word zusammen so that OO is 
forced to hyphenate it the word is wrongly displayed across the margin. The 
error occurs in OO.org 1.1 German version with German hyphenation dictionary 
and hyphenation enabled (downloaded from http://de.openoffice.org/).

A detailed instruction follows:
1. Create a new empty text document.
2. Enable hyphenation in the settings of the current (= Standard) paragraph 
style.
3. Change the paragraph's language to Deutsch (Deutschland).
4. Type the following word (including the beginning space and the delimiting 
full stop:

 zusammen.

5. Go to the beginning of the line (before zusammen) and type any characters 
you like until the word zusammen has moved so much to the right that it has 
to be hyphenated => hyphenation error occurs.

Note: These steps assume you have installed and activated the German 
hyphenation feature. Unfortunately I cannot reproduce it by using an English 
word. I attached the hyphenation file I use for German texts (downloaded
from de.openoffice.org).

short_description: query page for issuezilla is difficult too use
long_description:
The current issuezilla query page at http://www.openoffice.org/issues/query.cgi
is powerful but too difficult to navigate and use. Bugzilla employments have a
hard time getting people to search for the bugs first and consequently the
biggest waste of time when running a bugzilla deployment is dealing with the
duplicates and very related issues. I know that mozilla makes bugzilla but is
there anyway that there could be a google like (perhaps even google-powered)
search and then an advanced search option (possibly on the same page) that is
the current bugzilla search (as well as a google-like and/or google-powered
advanced). If the search was easier to navigate and produced better results
(and perhaps even a prerequisite to filing a bug) there would be far fewer
duplicates more actual (and relevant) bug reports (because people would be
enouraged to post bugs because of the ease of making sure that they weren't
posting a duplicate).
The main issue I am trying to address is the text search in bugzilla. When
searching for text you can't simply search everywhere and customize things you
have to search by the seperate categories summary description entry keyword etc.
If the novice user wants to report a bug I think they should be able to do so
without having to go through a difficult query page.

short_description: Tabs to the left hanging indents (from MS Word styles) are misplaced
long_description:
For documents created in Microsoft Word paragraphs using a style where there is a tab before the 
left margin of a hanging indent

The display of paragraphs using MS Word styles where there is a tab before left margin of a 
hanging-indent paragrah is misinterpreted in OpenOffice.

To reproduce:
1. In MS Word create a paragraph style with the following values:
     Indent: Hanging 3.75 cm Tabs 3.25 cm right flush
2. apply the style to a paragraph then type a tab on right and another tab then left aligned  
enough times to wrap the line.
3. Save the document

In Word you will see the folowing:
  right aligned   left aligned left aligned left aligned left aligned left aligned left aligned
                         left aligned left aligned left aligned left aligned

4. Open the document using OpenOffice

You will see the following:
                         right aligned left aligned left aligned left aligned left aligned left aligned
                         left aligned left aligned left aligned left aligned

This problem does NOT occur when the tabs to the left of the left margin have been added 
manually rather than via a style.

The problem seems to stem from the fact that OO interprets the tab placement value (3.25 cm) as 
being indented from the paragraph's left margin (3.75 cm) whereas Word interprets the tab value 
as being indented from the hanging indent value (-3.75cm).

When a style having the desired appearance is created directly in OO it uses these measurements:
Western text: + -0.5cm + Indent left 0.0cm + First Line -3.75cm ...

short_description: API: make complex tests more dynamic
long_description:
It would be usefull to have the possibility to call test methods more dynamicly
ie. to call only one specific method

short_description: Discrepency between help file and chart actions
long_description:
In the help file Sort By Columns states: Sorts the whole table by columns. The 
current column will NOT be moved all other columns will be sorted accordingly. 
In my opinion this would mean that the current column will not be moved and all 
other columns will rotate around the column I have selected.
In the chart data spreadsheet when you click on a cell then click sort by 
columns ALL columns are sorted accordingly.

Procedure:
- Insert a default chart
- right click the chart and select Chart Data
- select the data '3.2' in column 2 - row 1
- click 'Sort by Columns'
It will sort all three columns by the data in row 1 - a direct conflict with 
what the help file states.

short_description: DOC: various property browser enhancements
long_description: *** autogenerated child task for Issue 22877 ***

short_description: Configured Email address for domain contact not used
long_description:
I changed the default Domain configuration for the Email address for domain 
contact. I would expect that the configured address is used in the From: 
Header for system messages.
In fact the registration confirmation is send by sourcecast@solstage2... and 
the new forum created notification is send by admin@solstage2....

short_description: API: sc.ScCellCursorObj::XUsedAreaCursor
long_description:
The used Area changes depending of the sequence in which the interface tests
run. The testcase should take care that the used Area is properly defined.

short_description: Change of Bookmark will not realized
long_description:
- Create Writer doc with several pages.
- Insert on first page a bookmark name it as Bookmark1
- Go to another page and set there also a bookmark and name it as Bookmark1
-> In this case you must delete the current bookmark at first and type the same
name for the new place.
- Open Navigator and duoble click to bookmark
-> Cursor jumps to the wrong position.

short_description: Incorrect TAB setting in header and footer (MS Word import)
long_description:
The attached Word document contains a fixed tab position in the header and the
footer. OOo ignores these tabs and uses the default positions instead.
Problem not present in the 1.1.0 release.

short_description: The Document and Files page looks considerably different depending on browser.
long_description:
I generally use KDE Konqueror - in this browser the documents list is very cramped. 
In fact words longer than 'documentation' are split across lines. The files section 
needs allow more room for it. When I reduced the length of some long documents 
names the space was used by description rather than by the folder listing which 
needed it. 
 
In Netscape 4.7 there is too much white space abount the folder listing. 
 
In Mozilla / Netscape 7 the spacing is fine but the page seems to be set to 105% of 
the screen size - you need to use the horizontal scroll bar to see the whole page. 
 
I know it hard to please everybody but from my point of view I would like the 
Konqueror version to look a bit better. 
 
I could provide screen prints on request.

long_description:
Hi
During the branding phase we incorporated much of the style sheet of the production OOo. But 
projects on SC26 for OOo do not seem to be attending to the styles included there.

Beril: advice?
louis

long_description:
The mode TableOperationMode.BOTH is to time consuming for a complete Spreadsheet
and should be excluded.

short_description: API: sc.ScHeaderFooterTextObj::XTextRangeMover
long_description: The testcase provides no valid textrange to move

short_description: Usability: Format for printing formatting and readability
long_description:
in each issue's page
there's a link Format for printing

as its preferred functionality is
having a page that is suitable for printing in paper/hard copy

the page should not include any navigation bar
(e.g. left nav bar and buttons at top including Jump to issue input box)
which not neccessary for a printed out
wasted paper space and make it harder to read.


also it should not include any underlined links
(e.g. Queries: _My issues_ or
_New_ | _Query_ | _Reports_ | _My votes_ | _My issues_)
which may decrease a readability of the page.


and for a line like
--- Additional comments from _Santa_ Thu Dec 25 00:18:54 -0800 2001 ---

in which _Santa_ (underlined Santa) is a link for e-mail
it may be useful to expand it to

-- Additional comments from Santa (sclaus@xmas.me) Thu Dec 25 00:18:54 -0800
2001 ---

so people who read it on paper can know an e-mail address under the link.

----

more about Additional comments:

for a more convinience in referencing
each comment should has its own number.
like this:

  Comment #1 from Bettina Haberer Tue Jul 17 00:18:54 -0800 2001

  Reassigned to Wolfram.

  Comment #2 from wg Fri Aug 3 06:48:51 -0800 2001 -------

  Hi
  I can reproduce this bug in version 632 but not in an actual one.

  Comment #3 from wg Tue Nov 27 03:24:45 -0800 2001 -------

  Bug closed


so when talking about wg's comment
we can know which one #2 or #3.

this more or less means more productivity.

----

Also it would be nice
if the page can have a small timestamp (of the time of querying)
at the top or the bottom of the page for a reference.

short_description: name definitions are buggy and lost
long_description:
The definition of names in OO 1.1 Spreadsheet is very buggy. 
I can reconstruct it as follow :
- create a new empty spreadsheet
- enter the following cell's 
     col   A      B
row
1          a      10
2          b      20
3          c      30
4          d      40
5          e	
- create names for B1 to B5 by selecting A1 till B5 and
  using the menu Insert -> Names -> Create -> Names in Left column
- at this point one can check that the names are indeed created by 
  clicking on the cells and looking at the Sheet Area at the left
- then enter the following function in B5 : 
    =a+b+c+d
- it correctly displays 100
- however if jou look at Insert -> Names -> Define
  one can see there are already two names lost !!!
- now save the spreadsheet leave openoffice
- restart openoffice with the saved spreadsheet
- now the b and d name is completly come and the formula is changed to 
   =a+'b'+c+'d'
   in stead of 
   =a+b+c+d
  because the b and d names are gone 
  one can see this also in the Sheet Area at te left

Could someone please have a look at it because it completly blocks my
conversion to OpenOffice. I have tryed it on Linux and Windows XP : same bug
exists. Because of the automatic conversion of =a+b+c+d to =a+'b'+c+'d' it has
cost me some hours to find out what the trouble was because in simple formulas
like above it displays 100 correctly. 

Please help because naming in spreadsheets is rather important!!!

Thanks
Wim Van Acker

short_description: .NET 2003 needs msvcp71 in external
long_description:
The external module should have a msvcp71 directory for .NET 2003 dlls.
msvcp71.dll and msvcr71.dll.

short_description: please remove de/www/doc/handbuch/impress/pics/Nutzerdialog1.png from repository
long_description:
Hi
when updating SourceCast CVS was updated/changed as well. It is no longer
possible to commit files that match a case-insensitive comparison. This is a
good thing however this prevents us from deleting or updating already existing
duplicate entries.
CVS aborts with the following message:
[cl@bm617259 pics]$ cvs ci
cvs commit: Examining .
ERROR: case-insensitive filename match:
'Nutzerdialog1.png' matches 'nutzerdialog1.pngv'
cvs server: Pre-commit check failed
cvs [server aborted]: correct above errors first!
cvs commit: dying gasps from localhost unexpected
cvs commit: saving log message in /tmp/cvs8eONFZ
[cl@bm617259 pics]$

So please replace the file nutzerdialog1.png by Nutzerdialog1.png 
(mv Nutzerdialog1.png nutzerdialog1.png) and remove Nutzerdialog1.png from the
repository.

Thank you.

short_description: /contrib/helpcontent: common.tree and schart.tree are missing
long_description:
common.tree and schart.tree which OOo1.1 official localized builds have may be
missing in all helpcontent_XX_unix.tgz and helpcontent_XX_wnt.zip dated 03/08/14
under /contrib/helpcontent.
At least they are missing in helpcontent_81_unix.tgz and helpcontent_81_wnt.zip.

short_description: Build with 4NT fails due to conflicting SOURCEVERSION=FIX645 in minor.mk
long_description:
This is for branch cws_srx645_ooo111fix1

The build with 4NT fails due to conflicting SOURCEVERSION=FIX645 in minor.mk.

This is no issue for all non 4NT using systems because they generate

$SOLARVER/$UPD/$INPATH/inc/${UPD}minor.mk in ./bootstrap but for 4NT settings.mk
tries this and fails because of $(SOURCEVERSION) != $(WORK_STAMP)

CC'ing ause

I set this to P1 because it breaks the build for all 4NT users.

short_description: login on home page doesn't work
long_description:
when you try to login on OOo homepage you get redirect to servlets/TLogin and
have to login in a second time  on servlets/TLogins

short_description: Exporting a complete page as bitmap graphic leaves red underlines from automatic spellchecker
long_description:
When using the spell checker words not in the list are underlined in red. 
That's great but when exporting to JPG BMP etc those red underlines are 
present in the resulting picture file! I had to turn the spell checker off to 
avoid this.

short_description: Field in form displays wrong data
long_description:
Field in form displays wrong data
I use:

Windows XP
OpenOffice 1.1
myodbc-2.50.39-nt
mysql 4.0.14b

In great databases the following happens in forms. The data in the form is
sorted after the field Firma Name and Vorname. The first data set is a
private person and has the field Firma empty the last has a Firma. If you
jump to the last row and jump back to the first row in Firma the value off
the last row is displayed. If you go to the next data set the value of Firma
doesn't change until you reach a field where a value for Firma is set.

I tried to find the problem but it didn't find it. To show you the problem I
send you the form a sql-file with the table definition and in the form is a
macro wnDatTestgen. When the table exists and the mysql-database is connected as
Database Adressen you can start this macro. It creates 2000 datasets. Now reload
the data to the form jump to the last data set and back to the first. In the
field Firma is now a value.

The other macros are for copping a dataset.

For questions contact me.

Best regards

Wolfgang Nickl

short_description: Mail Merge section of OOo Help seriously needs updating
long_description:
I am using OOo 1.1.0. Under Help for OpenOffice.org Writer in the Index there
are two entries under mail merge.  They refer to creating/using a form letter.
 The Creating a Form Letter instructions go into (now) unneeded detail about how
to manually create a form letter.  But there are some problems with it:

First it says the first step is to create a template document which can be
misleading because OOo 1.x differentiates between a Text Document Template
(.stw) and a Text Document (.sxw).  So I (following the instructions) went to
File - New - Templates and Documents and found that there were NO templates
there. Then I thought I'd have some help creating one and I went to File -
AutoPilot - Form... and wasted some time trying to get the resulting Form
(seemed like a form letter to me) to be formatted as I wanted (which was like
fields instead of form functions).  So maybe you could consider not calling the
Mail Merge function a form letter and/or try to prevent the above mentioned
confusion by clarifying things more thoroughly.

Second under Printing or Saving the Output of a Form Letter it says To specify
the data to include in a form letter output: 1. Choose Tools - Mail Merge to
open the Mail Merge dialog.  When actually it should be (in this context) to
call the data source view and click on the Mail Merge button on the Database
bar.  Try each way to see the difference....  BTW the help for the Database Bar
calls that button both Form Letter and Mail Merge (because the button used to be
only called Form Letter).

Third explaining the details on how to manually create a form letter is
possibly unneeded because when you choose Tools - Mail Merge it guides you
through each of the steps almost like an AutoPilot.  So I think that it would
be good to change the listing under mail merge in the Index to show how to use
the Mail Merge tool and have a Related link to Creating a Form Letter.  Also
it seems like it would be good to include something about the Business Letter
AutoPilot too.

There are other areas in the OOo help related to this topic that need updating
and I suppose also in other areas of the OpenOffice.org product that have changed.

Also the descriptions on this category/component(documentation) are not clear.
 I am assuming that the manuals subcomponent is refering to the Help file
included with the OpenOffice.org product.

short_description: file aliases in font.dir files and font.alias files are also ignored
long_description:
E.g. RH8's urw-2.0.26 RPM maps the n021003l.pfb file to both Times and Nimbus
Roman. One of these mappings is ignored. E.g. a font file for Times will not
be listed as available even when it is there so a much worse X11 font has to
be used.

short_description: Overstrike characters fail to display
long_description:
I have been using the Greek font BwGrkl (You can get it free at:
http://www.bibleworks.com/fonts.html ).  This font uses the characters: `./ and
v for overstrike accents and breathing marks.  In other words these add a mark
over a previous character rather than inserting a new character.

I was running OO 1.0.3 on my MAC (under YellowDog) and this font worked
beautifully.  I just recently switched to using my laptop (Running Win98 and OO
1.1) because I am on the road.

OO 1.1 displays the greek characters fine but when I try and enter an
overstrike character I get the English equivalent character on the screen and
not a breathing or accent mark.  I checked MS Word on the same machine and it
displays the overstrikes correctly.

For instance if I type: avgaph
I should get the Greek characters agaph with a smooth breathing mark over the
'a' and an acute accent over the 'h'

Thanks for your help.

short_description: Provide example scripts in all languages
long_description:
The set of examples installed with the Scripting Framework is
not complete. We need to have a Hello World example for each language
and also to port some of the existing examples to all of the languages
we support.

short_description: Provide drop down icon for toolbar items instead of green arrow
long_description:
Icon drop down behaviour simmiliar to other application using side small icon 
for drop down instead of using green arrow.

Below is discussion in GSL lits about this.

To: dev@gsl.openoffice.org 
From: Stephan Schaefer   Add to Address Book 
Date: Thu 11 Dec 2003 12:20:34 +0100 
Subject: Re: [gsl-dev] Icon dropdown behaviour 
      
> Now the icon for Font color highlight and others icon
> using small green arrow as mark (that has drop down)
> so when we want the drop down option we need to press
> it for one second. meanwhile in Microsoft office the
> dropdown icon is different using side small icon.
> just pressing that icon and we will get the drop down.

This is already on my agenda for OOo2.0. But feel free to have a look 
at 
it!

> If we want to make this behaviour (for all drop down
> icon) standard/same as MS Office which part of the
> source code I need to modify ? 
> And can somebody guide me little bit how to modify it
> or is there any documentation about this part ? . 

The code of the toolbox class is in vcl/source/window/toolbox.cxx. One 
obvious problem is that the layout code (Toolbox::ImplFormat()) assumes 
that all buttons are the same size which will change if we introduce 
small drop down buttons. Should not be too problematic as the code can 
deal with subwindows between the buttons like the font selection 
listbox as well. The buttons are no VCL windows (ie no pushbuttons) but 
are directly painted by the toolbox class which might make things more 
awkward - on the other hand it gives you a lot of freedom... The green 
arrow is always painted when a toolbox item has the TIB_DROPDOWN bit 
set.

The timeout itself however is not handled by the base class but in a 
derived toolbox class in sfx - that makes working with the toolbox code 
so funny. Have a look at the virtual SfxToolbox::Click() in 
sfx2/source/toolbox/tbxchild.cxx. The click handler is called by the 
base class but as it has no parameter the currently pressed button is 
determinded here by calling GetCurItemId(). Then the code checks if 
this 
item requires a timeout (it's a dropdown item) and starts a timer. The 
popup then is opened when the timer has elapsed by calling 
pControl->CreatePopupWindow(). When Shift is pressed however no timer 
is started but the drop down is opened directly as you can see in the 
code.

So to open the drop down when an arrow button besides the 'real' button 
is pressed I'd suggest introducing a new handler called 
ClickDropdown() 
which has to be called instead of Click() in this case. When this 
handler is called it must be sure that the current item id is set to 
the 
item id of the 'real' button so that the Sfx code can react properly. 
The implementation of the ClickDropdown() would essentially be the part 
from the Click() handler that directly opens the dropdown (the Shift 
key 
part).

Hope you're still interested ;)

Stephan

short_description: thiscomponent.close() and dispose() causes crash on NT/98
long_description:
Hello!

On my companies Windows 2000 machines (SP4) with OOo 1.1 these subs work:

sub main
      oDoc = thiscomponent
      oDoc.dispose() 
end sub

sub main
       thiscomponent.dispose() 
end sub

sub main
            thiscomponent.close(false) 
end sub

But on our PCs with Windows 98 and Windows NT 4 they all cause crashes with
OOo 1.1.

In our company we've got about 30 PCs running Windows 2000 (including the
development PCs) but on about 70 PCs there's still running Windows NT and some 
still run Windows 98 so we need this bug fixed because the macros we wrote with
OOo must also run on these OSs.

Bye
Dominik Di Lorenzo
(dilorenzo@vogelsang-bandstahl.de)

short_description: Specification: Numbering and Bullet Part 1
long_description: Link to spec: http://specs.openoffice.org/writer/numbering/NumberingBullet1.sxw

short_description: Basic concatenation operator not documented
long_description:
The on-line help for OpenOffice.org Basic does not describe the operator used to 
concatenate strings.
This is the & operator. It is used in the examples for most of the string 
functions (Left Mid) but never defined.
The examples for RTrim and LTrim use the + as concatenation operator. But help 
says that + operator is for numeric expressions. The + operator probably works 
on strings for compatibility reasons but this should also be documented.

short_description: non permissive build error invalid conversion
long_description:
Error building bridges with no -fpermissive on linux sparc:
cpp2uno.cxx:491: error: invalid conversion from `volatile sal_Int64*' to
`sal_Int64*'

This was only a warning with -fpermissive:
/cpp2uno.cxx:491: warning: invalid conversion from `volatile sal_Int64*' to
`sal_Int64*'

The full error:
In file included from
/home/jim/680/o2_src/bridges/source/cpp_uno/gcc3_linux_sparc/cpp2uno.cxx:84:
../../../inc/bridges/cpp_uno/bridge.hxx: In function `void
gcc3::cppu_cppenv_computeObjectIdentifier(uno_ExtEnvironment* rtl_uString**
void*)':
../../../inc/bridges/cpp_uno/bridge.hxx:500: warning: cast from pointer to
integer of different size
../../../inc/bridges/cpp_uno/bridge.hxx:507: warning: cast from pointer to
integer of different size
/home/jim/680/o2_src/bridges/source/cpp_uno/gcc3_linux_sparc/cpp2uno.cxx: In
destructor `gcc3::MediateClassData::ClassDataBuffer::~ClassDataBuffer()':
/home/jim/680/o2_src/bridges/source/cpp_uno/gcc3_linux_sparc/cpp2uno.cxx:431:
warning: deleting `void*' is undefined
/home/jim/680/o2_src/bridges/source/cpp_uno/gcc3_linux_sparc/cpp2uno.cxx: In
function `void gcc3::cpp_vtable_call()':
/home/jim/680/o2_src/bridges/source/cpp_uno/gcc3_linux_sparc/cpp2uno.cxx:491:
error: invalid conversion from `volatile sal_Int64*' to `sal_Int64*'
dmake:  Error code 1 while making '../../../unxlngs.pro/slo/cpp2uno.obj'
---* TG_SLO.MK *---
dmake:  Error code 255 while making 'do_it_noopt'
---* TG_SLO.MK *---
 
ERROR: Error 65280 occurred while making
/home/jim/680/o2_src/bridges/source/cpp_uno/gcc3_linux_sparc

To remove the error:
add the type cast in line 491...
- cpp_mediate( nTableEntry pCallStack+17 
+ cpp_mediate( nTableEntry pCallStack+17 (sal_Int64*)

This patch allows the build to proceed other platforms have similar code. But i
do not know if this is valid i can see there are other possibilities?

short_description: join connector in query design lost with special query
long_description:
When one creates a query that joins two tables on a key the line appears in the
GUI showing the join.  However the SQL code that is produced does not show a
JOIN which is needed to retain this visual indicator of the join.  Instead the
SQL utilizes the WHERE = construct.  This does not
allow the program to display the union line in the GUI and it is lost when
exiting the design mode and returning to design mode.

I'm not saying that OOo does not do joins only that the code produced by them
is deficient.

short_description: No index to 'use printer metric for display'
long_description:
Summary says it all.  I had a bug which turned out to be already known (17016) 
and discovered there that it was a 'user hostile feature' with a workaround.

The on-line help didn't do its job.

Ideally could we have a warning on the 'Optimal row height' page to point out 
that the row heights are calculated when the command is invoked for the 
cell data and metrics current at the time.

And could we please have 'metrics' and 'printer metrics' indexed.

Thanks for all the other good work you have done and are doing - Chris

short_description: XSLT filter shall receive a default set of parameters
long_description:
As discussed by phone we should provide a default set of parameters (possibly a
solution for a customer to expand these) for the XSL transformation.

The best scenario is the adaption of relative links when the source document is
transformed into a different directory.

The parameter should be based on the XHTML transformation:

<!-- OPTIONAL: (MANDATORY: for all input document with relative external links):
paramter is a (relative) URL to the source directory.
Relative links from the office document (e.g. to external graphics) will get
this parameter as a prefix -->


<!-- OPTIONAL: (MANDATORY: for zipped input document with relative internal links)
To access contents of a jared office file (content like the meta.xml styles.xml
file or  graphics) a JAR URL could be choosen or
when working with OpenOffice a Package-URL encoded over HTTP can be used to
access the jared contents of the the jared document.
Default: sourceDirURL - in case a zipped office document had been unpacked the
(usually embedded) graphics would reside aside the source directory -->


<!-- OPTIONAL: (MANDATORY: for session management by URL rewriting)
Useful for WebApplications: if a HTTP session is not cookie based URL rewriting
is beeing used (the session is appended to the URL).
This URL session is used for example when links to graphics are created by XSLT.
Otherwise the user havt to log again in for every graphic he liks to see. -->


<!-- OPTIONAL: DPI (dots per inch) the standard resolution of given pictures
(necessary for the conversion of 'cm' into 'pixel')-->
<!-- Although many pictures have a 96 dpi resolution a higher resoltion give
better results for common browsers -->


<!-- OPTIONAL: in case of using a different processor than a JAVA XSLT you can
unable the Java functionality
(e.g. encoding chapter names for the content-table as href and anchors ) -->

short_description: Wrong saving of Hebrew docuements in as MSWord doc
long_description:
When saved as MSWord doc or rtf Hebrew documents either completely loose their
formatting when then opened in Word 97 or appear with errors at problematic
places like a comma and a space which become space and then a comme
parantheses and other similar places where there are always problems with the
directionality.

Here is how I encountered the problem:

1. Opened a Hebrew .doc written in Word 97 in OO. Looked fine.
2. Saved as Wird 97.
3. Opened in Hebrwe Word 97. Lost formatting (all text in the default font etc.)

I tried to save as Word 95 and got similar results. When I saved it in OO as RTF
 I got ythe best results - most of the formatting was retained but the positions
of dots commas endnote digits and other places where the directionality is
problematic were wrong.

I am going to attach an Original written in Word 97 which opens correctly in
OO and then the file as saved by OO which does not look well when openened in
Word again.

short_description: m5sum links confuse the user.
long_description:
John Stephenson wrote:
> I believe I should check the completeness of a download using MD5Sum - but
can't locate it on your site! Can you help?

I can see why you got confused. The whole site is under going an upgrade and the
first link takes to you the list of sums but not the md5sum item on the page as
it should.

User must scroll down the download page
http://download.openoffice.org/1.1.0/index.html to the section labeled MD5SUMS.
From there the link you want is Instructions for us which will take you to
where you can get the windows executable. Now if you are running any *NIX or
MacOSX md5sum is built-in.  Anyway the link you need is
http://www.openoffice.org/dev_docs/using_md5sums.html#links for windows.Hope
this helps to clear up your confusion.

Seems to me that this should be corrected. It was correct on the old page.

short_description: Old dlcompat header install breaks Fink compatability (which affects quite a few thousand user)
long_description:
My name is David HÃ¶hn. I am the project public relations manager. A serious
issue with Fink and OpenOffice interoperatability exists. Fink serves around 36
000 Mac users in installing and checking over Unix packages. The problem below
has been described by the autor of dlcompat now used by Apple in 10.3

Peter O Groman wrote:

No all of these problems with Dl_info are from people who have installed
openoffice. Openoffice's installer ships or at least used to ship
/usr/local/include/dlfcn.h and /usr/local/lib/libdl.dylib. Problem being
that the version of dlcompat that they are shipping is old/different and
does not include support for dladdr thus when something wants to use
dladdr it finds the function available in libSystem in it's configure
script then when the actual code #includes  it gets
/usr/local/include/dlfcn.h rather than /usr/include/dlfcn.h where dladdr
and Dl_info are defined.

It is the fault of openoffice for shipping a header that they do not even
need to ship. Application installers really should not install headers. 

I would be very interested in resolving this issues as it affects more and more
of our users and they complain to us not you guys :)

Thank you.

long_description:

from the documents based on our company letter head after the
first page. The first page is perfect. On the other pages

The text fields are ok.

Interestingly the PDF export is ok no missing graphics on
any of the pages.

The letterhead doc can be downloaded from the issue 23783:
http://www.openoffice.org/issues/show_bug.cgi?id=23783

Regards
Cem Eryasar

short_description: Rhino and BeanShell should be built from source in external project
long_description:
Currently the Rhino and BeanShell external projects contain Jar files which
are delivered to the solver (The Rhino Jar is patched after a modified version
of one of the Rhino source files has been built and placed back into the jar
file.

To be like other external projects the Rhino and BeanShell source should be
placed in OOo CVS. Any patches needed should be applied to it at build time
and after it is built it can be delivered to the solver.

long_description: Open bugdoc export as pdf -> Assertion.

short_description: Print/properties selections have no effect when using Xerox 6250DT PPD file
long_description:
When printing a text document from OpenOffice.org Writer to a Xerox 6250DT
printer using the Xerox 6250DT PPD file as the driver lightly edited by me to
reflect the actual printer configuration options (such as select transparency
tray or switch off duplex) selected from the Print/Properties window have no effect.

I'm using this PPD file with CUPS and options (eg switching
off duplexing and selecting transparency tray) work fine from the
lpr command line.

Other printers I have configured in OpenOffice.org are able to use
printer options fine.

I'll attach the PPD file and some print-to-file output made by
printing to the printer this PPD file is the driver for.

As you'll see there are definitions (including xerox$pagedevice) made in the
*JobPatchFile 1:  section of the PPD file which don't seem to make it into the
postscript print file but which are none-the-less used in that file.

Is this an OpenOffice.org bug?

Thanks

Roderick

short_description: After De-installation of OpenOffice all PowerPoint files open in Slide Show on double click
long_description:
After loading and assigning OpenOffice as the primary application for .ppt files I decided to delete open office as this is my work computer 
and I do not have permission to have this program on my machine.  After running the OpenOffice remove routine the .ppt files only open 
the presentation in slide show mode (using the double click feature of Windows).   (.ppt file originally created using PowerPoint) When I 
select End Show it exits the file and won't let me go into edit mode.  If I open the .ppt file using PowerPoint everything is normal.  It's 
only 
when I double click on the .ppt file that this occur

short_description: Updating records using ODBC link
long_description:
I am currently trying to convert three companies over from MS Office.  
One of the companies main features is using access through an ODBC link to 
connect into a database.  Through this they would view and change records just 
by clicking on the cell they wanted to change.  

I think the openOffice package will be something they would easily convert to  
only that they can't update records in a database table unless they actually 
know how to write SQL at this time.  

Thank you 
DWW

short_description: Scripting Framework scripts should be deployable using pkgchk
long_description:
Scripting Framework scripts (whether they are in UNO packages
or otherwise) should be deployable into an OpenOffice.org
installation using the pkgchk command line tool. If the scripts
are deployed to a running OpenOffice.org installation they
should appear in the OpenOffice.org UI without having to reload
the UI.

short_description: Spaces in username mean that LocalOfficeConnection won't connect
long_description:
I'm using LocalOfficeConnection to connect to staroffice. On Windows it is
possible to have a user name that contains spaces.
i.e. the value returned by java.lang.System.getProperty(user.name) can contain
spaces. 

LocalOfficeConnection uses this value to construct a URL for the pipe
connection but of course if there are spaces in the URL then you have a
malformed url and an exception is thrown (which gets swallowed silently by
LocalOfficeConnection.
The LocalOfficeConnection is created but is not instantiated properly and the
instance of soffice is not launched.

You can test this by running java -Duser.name=user name on any application
that instantiated LocalOfficeConnection

short_description: Cannot invoke a script from the command line
long_description:
It is possible to invoke Basic macro from the command line by passing
the macro name as an argument to the soffice script eg.

soffice macro://Standard.Module.Method

This is not possible for Scripting Framework script urls but it should be.

short_description: singleton / implicit intersection bug ...
long_description:
Enter =B2:B2 in A1 - notice the #VALUE! error - compare with Excel. Not just an
academic exercise - 'OFFSET' will happily generate these references as part of
it's calculations.

This fixes it (never do implicit intersection for a singleton range):

Index: sc/source/core/tool/interpr4.cxx
===================================================================
RCS file: /cvs/sc/sc/source/core/tool/interpr4.cxxv
retrieving revision 1.26
diff -u -p -u -r1.26 interpr4.cxx
--- sc/source/core/tool/interpr4.cxx	28 Apr 2003 15:32:01 -0000	1.26
+++ sc/source/core/tool/interpr4.cxx	26 Feb 2004 19:15:09 -0000
@@ -12486 +124813 @@ StackVar ScInterpreter::GetStackType( BY
 
 BOOL ScInterpreter::DoubleRefToPosSingleRef( const ScRange& rRange ScAddress&
rAdr )
 {
+	// Check for a singleton first - no implicit intersection for them.
+	if( rRange.aStart == rRange.aEnd )
+	{
+		rAdr = rRange.aStart;
+		return TRUE;
+	}
+
 	USHORT nMyCol = aPos.Col();
 	USHORT nMyRow = aPos.Row();
 	USHORT nMyTab = aPos.Tab();

Presumably fixes a number of other manifestations.

May I commit ? and to where ? :-)

short_description: PostScript PageSetup should not change the PostScript content
long_description:
From issue 7262:
I have checked the output from OpenOffice 1.1 based
upon a bug report from a CUPS user and there is a problem with the current
Begin/EndPageSetup comments.

Here is an excerpt from a simple 1-page test file:

    %%Page: 1 1
    %%PageBoundingBox: 12 12 600 780
    %%BeginPageSetup
    %
    [{
    %%BeginFeature: *InputSlot Middle
    > setpagedevice
    %%EndFeature
    } stopped cleartomark
    [{
    %%BeginFeature: *PageSize Letter

        > setpagedevice
    %%EndFeature
    } stopped cleartomark
>>> gsave
>>> [0.06 0 0 -0.06 12 780] concat
>>> gsave
    %%EndPageSetup

The lines marked with >>> must *not* be inside the Begin/EndPageSetup comments
since they affect the graphics state.  The end result is that N-up printing and
page markings (such as classification draft etc. that a user might want to
add to the print job) are lost and the page is scaled improperly.

Simply moving the marked lined after the %%EndPageSetup comment will fix things
nicely.

Thanks!

short_description: OOo crashes if CUPS does not deliver a PPD
long_description:
reported by Chris Halls:
Hi I took the changes to cws_srx645_cups01 for a spin to see how the
code is doing.  I was very impressed with the added support - it works
nicely and I was able to modify my printer parameters within the Printer
Setup box and control my deskjet's draft/normal settings from within
OOo.

I did discover a problem though.  I have a raw printer queue on my CUPS
server that does not have an associated PPD file.  If I select this
printer queue OOo crashes without warning.

A debug build of psprint indicates the problem:

cupsPrintFile found
cupsGetDests found
cupsSetDests found
cupsFreeDests found
cupsGetPPD found
cupsMarkOptions found
cupsAddOption found
cupsFreeOptions found
ppdOpenFile found
ppdClose found
cupsServer found
cupsUser found
cupsSetPasswordCB found
cupsSetUser found
found global defaults in
/usr/lib/openoffice/program/../share/psprint/psprint.conf
global settings: fontsubst = true 8 substitutes
PPD for deskjet is /var/tmp/404dd05249d82
processing the following options for printer deskjet (instance (null)):
PPD for dj-raw is (null)
PPD for dj-raw is (null)


So the 'deskjet' queue was fine but 'dj-raw' has no PPD file.  Using
gdb I found problems during Init with calls to get the language level
but even after that I had crashes in PPDParser::getKey.

So I don't think the workspace is ready for merging yet.

Thanks
Chris

short_description: non-contiguous copy/paste
long_description:
Excel has a copy paste function where seperate sections within a column/row or
adjacent columns/rows can be selected then copied and pasted missing out the
non-selected cells so that when pasted the selected cells move together leaving
no gaps.  The attached file shows the end result of this.  I don't know how many
people use this facility in Excel but in my field (scientific research) it gets
used a lot and I know people who won't use OOo as a result.  Science is an area
where opensource software makes inroads and it would be good to have this
feature.  Please note that I am not asking for any cells from allover a
spreadheet to be selctable but to be able to paste groups of cells missing out
certain parts of row or columns.

short_description: Turning off hyperlinks
long_description:
I do not use OpenOffice to edit web pages.  I use it to edit text and
spreadsheet documents which are later printed.  Within these documents I want
URLs or e-mail addresses to be plain text not hyperlinks. I do not want them
underlined changed to green or blue text changed to arial or another font and
do not want them to activate links or mailtos when clicked.

In short I want URLs and e-mail addresses to sit there as plain black Times New
Roman text doing nothing.

I have gone to Tools | AutoCorrect | and have turned off URL recognition.  This
prevents e-mail address and URLs that are typed from being re-formatted as
hyperlinks.

It does not though prevent copied links and addresses from being inserted as
hyperlinks.

My problem is that when I copy an e-mail address from a web page or other source
that includes a mailto link and then paste it into a Open Office document the
address is pasted as a hyperlink and not plain text. Similarly if I copy a word
or phrase that is part of a hyperlink it is inserted into Open Office as a
hyperlink when pasted.

As far as I can tell from experimentation and from the Open Office user forums
 my options are to either a) paste and then reformat the selection or to use
Paste | Paste Special | Unformatted text.  Either choice involves multiple
actions and neither is easily available from the right click menu or via easy
keyboard combinations.

What I would like:

I would like the option of turning hyperlinks off entirely within Text and
Spreadsheet documents so that all e-mail addresses and URLs are placed as plain
text only.

short_description: Wrong interpretation of words in spreadsheet text
long_description:
In text boxes or frames inserted in spreadsheets many words both in English 
and in other local languages (I tested it in Italian and German too) are seen 
as mistakes from OOo spellchecker even if they are correctly included in the 
dictionary. The words shown as incorrect are not always the same ones and seem 
randomly changing. The same problem is present in drawing documents.
I presume this may be a text parsing issue because Writer spell checks those 
words in a perfect way.

short_description: Headers and footers are stripped when saving as .doc format
long_description:
Headers and footers are stripped from the document when saving to .doc format in
version OpenOffice 1.1.0

steps to recreate with version 1.1.0:

1. open new writer document
2. create header and footer type some text in each
3. save document as native .stw
4. next save as .doc format and close document
5. open the .doc version of the file headers and footers are stripped out of
the document

Other details:

I can open a .stw document created in version 1.0.3.1 in  version 1.1.0
and save it to .doc format. When I close it and reopen the document the
headers and footers were preserved.

If I open a .stw document created in version 1.1.0 with version
1.1.1rc3 and save it to .doc format when I close it and reopen it the
headers and footers are stripped out.

If I create a .stw document in version 1.1.1rc3 with headers and
footers then save it to .doc format when I reopen it the headers and
footers appear as expected.

short_description: Documents Vanish from Whiteboard
long_description:
I have a document for the Whiteboard documentation page.  I have posted this 
document 3 times so far and it  won't seem to stay up.  To be specific:

1. October 2001:  I post the Consultant Survey to the Documentation page.  It 
hangs around as a proposed document for a few days then vanishes 
without ever appearing on the Documents page.

2. November 2001:  I re-post the survey to the page.  Louis approves it and it 
goes up.  Sometime in the month the document vanishes from the page 
without apparent reason.

3. December 2001 - January 2002:  I post the survey again.  It stays up until this 
week.  Then I attempt to edit the document in order to remove some 
punctuation and spelling mistakes.  Instead of becoming a pending document 
or anything similar both the original document and my new edits vanish 
never to be recovered.

-Josh Berkus
  Marketing Project

short_description: Word Completion including umlauted characters fails on sparc/solaris
long_description:
Environment:

SUNBLADE 2000  ultrasparc III workstation 900 Mhz
Solaris  9  12-03 
SUN/GNOME 2.0  
OpenOffice 1.1.1 RC3  for sparc/solaris english/US  language variant.

Description:

I live in Sweden so I try to write swedish text from time to time :-)

With word-autocompletion turned on:
When a word with umlauted charaters  like  anvÃ¤nda  and its derivatives 
like  anvÃ¤ndare  anvÃ¤nder  anvÃ¤nds  are entered  autocompletion 
is garbled into  anvndare anvnder ...   
This seems to happend with most words that contains a single umlauted 
character and exists in the spelling-database..  Words with multi-umlauted
characters like  rÃ¤ksmÃ¶rgÃ¥s  is not garbled.

This Bug is also present in :
OpenOffice 1.1.0   Swedish Sparc/solaris 
StarOffice 7 Product update 2 Swedish Sparc/Solaris 

 This Bug is not present in any OOo or staroffice port to MS-windows 
 that I have used to date.
 
I have reported this bug to SUN. And got this reply:

-------------------
Thank you for using our StarOffice Support Service.

The following solution to your support case number #14236 is:

Your question:
When using the AutoCompletion function together with umlauts in StarOffice[TM]
Writer then the words get garbled. (Swedish version on Solaris only)


Our answer:
The Support Service was able to reproduce this behavior under the inhouse
testing conditions. In order to have this problem corrected in one of the next
versions it was forwarded to the StarOffice[TM] Quality Assurance and
Development teams for further testing.
------------------------

   Regards  
   Lars Tunkrans.

short_description: Improvement of conditional formatting
long_description:
Conditional formatting cold be more simple to use. Right now it is a bit 
complicated and it is just as primitive as the MS Excel one. To do it I must 
first define a Cell style. Why not just include a New style button next to 
the Cell style selector of the conditional formatting dialog? Almost everytime I 
want to use conditional formatting I select a range of cells then format - 
conditional format. Then I enter Condition 1 and when I look for a proper cell 
style I find that I have to make a new one so I have to leave the conditional 
formatting dialog create a new cell style and then back again. A lot of work 
with a minimum of result... A new style button would make it a lot easier.
 
So I said it's just as primitive as MS Excel's version. Why not an unlimited 
number of conditions? Three is not good enough is it? To me the conditional 
formatting seems to be just stolen from Excel. No new fresh ideas at all.
 
Right now the conditional formatting dialog looks something like this:
 
Condition 1
Three button: OK Cancel and Help.
Cell value is
Formula is
 
Equal to
Less than
Greater than
Less than or equal to
Greater than or equal to
Not equal to
Between
Not beetween
 
Formula input field
 
Cell style selection field
 
Then the same for condition 2 and 3.

 
 
My suggestion:
Main buttons: OK Cancel New condition and Help
 
Condition select field (to select condition 1 2 3... depending on how many 
conditions you created)
 
Cell select (where you enter which cell you want to compare to an expression)
 
Cell value is
Formula is
 
Equal to
Less than
Greater than
Less than or equal to
Greater than or equal to
Not equal to
Between
Not beetween
 
Formula field (where you enter the expression to be compared to the selected 
cell in Cell select above)
 
Cell style selection field
New cell style button

short_description: unexpected exception when reading contents of many folders
long_description:
Using the SimpleFileAccess service to read successive files in a number of
folders in a document results in undefined behavior sometimes it works other
times not. When not working com.sun.star.ucb.ContentCreateionException: No
Content is thrown.

I will attach a sample document which when used with the macro below should
demonstrate the problem. Note it may be necessary to run the macro a number of
times ( I've never yet had to run it more than 5 times to get it to misbehave
;-) so it shouldn't be too much of a chore )

Sub Main

dim xMgr as Object
dim theContext as Object
dim theUCB as Object
xMgr = getProcessServiceManager()
theContext = xMgr.getPropertyValue( DefaultContext )
theUCB = xMgr.createInstanceWithContext(com.sun.star.ucb.SimpleFileAccess
theContext )

folders() = theUCB.getFolderContents(vnd.sun.star.tdoc:/ true)

for count = lbound( folders() ) to ubound( folders() )
        msgbox( folder [ + count + ] =  + folders( count ) )
        dumpfolderContents( theUCB folders( count ) + /Scripts/beanshell )
next count

End Sub
function dumpfolderContents( ucb as Object url as String )

subfolders() = ucb.getFolderContents(url true)
for count = lbound( subfolders() ) to ubound( subfolders() )
parceldesc = subfolders( count ) + /parcel-descriptor.xml
msgbox( contents of  + url +  subfolder [ + count + ] =  + subfolders(
count ) +  size of parcel-desc is   +  ucb.getSize( parceldesc ) +  exists =
 +ucb.exists( parceldesc) )

 istream = ucb.openFileRead( parceldesc )

Do
   Dim oBuf() as Integer
   nRead = istream.readBytes( oBuf() 1000 )
Loop Until ( nRead < 1000 )
 istream.closeInput()
next count
end function

short_description: API: ucb.DynamicResultSet
long_description:
Basic Code snippet:

	oOBj = createUnoService( _
                com.sun.star.comp.ucb.TransientDocumentsContentProvider)
	ucb = createUnoService(com.sun.star.ucb.UniversalContentBroker)
	id = ucb.createContentIdentifier(vnd.sun.star.tdoc:/)
	
	content = oObj.queryContent(id)
	
	dim command as new com.sun.star.ucb.Command
	dim cargs as new com.sun.star.ucb.OpenCommandArgument2
	cargs.Mode = 0
	command.Name = open
	command.Argument = cargs
	
	result = content.execute(command 0 null)
	servicenames = result.getSupportedServiceNames()
	for i=0 to ubound(servicenames)
		msgbox servicenames(i)
	next i

Executing this delivers com.sun.star.ucb.DynamicContentResultSet as service
name. This service is not specified in the idls.
The name should be com.sun.star.ucb.DynamicResultSet instead this service
exists according to the idls.

The problem then continues in all of the following tables ... the first table on
page 35 (named Interno glasilo) in OOo has number G.2.1 whereas when opened
in MS Word it has (correct) number G.1.1
...

This bug seems innocent but we had very concrete problem with it: This is
actually public procurement formular. Rules are very strict and this has almost
lead to wrong offer being submitted by the company. Luckily someone noticed the
problem...

short_description: Data Validity dropdown list: highlight current value
long_description:
Great job on adding in-cell dropdown lists devs!  This was one of the major 
missing features that kept me returning to Excel and now I can switch totally 
to OOo!

One slight enhancement is possible:  the dropdown list appears to default to 
highlighting the first entry in the list.  In Excel it defaults to the item 
which matches the current cell contents if there is one otherwise it 
defaults to first item.

e.g. a cell has data validity of Criteria > cell range > sorted named range 
containing values Tom Dick Harry.  If the cell contains 'Harry' and you 
click on the dropdown button the first list entry 'Dick' will be highlighted 
whereas in Excel the highlighted item will be 'Harry'.

Cheers!

short_description: XML import/export needs to handle object sizes without border definitions
long_description:
Internally Rectangle is used for object geometry. The Rectangle definition is
more for pixel and thus uses ((right-left)+1) so the saved values are one
entity too big (all for size is positive). What is more wanted for vector
graphics is to see size as scaling thus not using the borders. Thus for XML
format the values need to be corrected for load and save. Keep in mind that the
values need to be corrected by -1 when scale is positive but by +1 when
negative (!).

short_description: devguide: document form control binding and validation
long_description:
There are two major implementations for form controls which should be
documented in the next version of the Developer's Guide
(http://api.openoffice.org/DevelopersGuide/DevelopersGuide.html).

First there is a possibility to bind certain form controls/models to external
bindings which they exchange their value with (see issue 18995). This is used
for instance for binding the controls to spreadsheet cells (issue 18997).

Second there is a possibility to register external validators for a form
control (issue 25106) which can impose a validity constraint on the content of
the control.

Both of these implementations introduced significant new API which should be
described in the Developer's Guide when OpenOffice.org 2.0 is released.

short_description: Remove offensive terms from the thesaurus
long_description:
Please remove the words nigger and redskin (and any similar words) from the
thesaurus. If somebody wishes to use offensive terms in their text they won't
need the thesaurus to suggest them and it shouldn't. This is not a question of
political correctness but of basic decency. 

Also please remove the word black where it occurs as a synonym of criminal.
It may be considered offensive and IMO the connection between the two words is
weak. 

Ref: the messages on discuss@ooo with the subject An Oversight in Your Product

short_description: Thesaurus only works for lower case letters

the word is in lower case letters for example color. When the word is the
first in the sentence it is written with an upper case letter and the thesaurus
does not offer meanings and synonyms. I think that both upper and lowercase
letters should be checked.

short_description: users_de@lang.openoffice.org

related with the project not the software. We would like to support new 
OpenOffice.org USERS who do not speak english better than we can right now. We 
could do so with the help of an additional mailing list which could be called

for answers in the web-archive or subscribe themselves to receive answers as

Timon

short_description: Report Autopilot Doesn't Format Date Fields
long_description:
Hi all
I've noticed a very unpleasant bug in the Database Report autopilot when I was
trying to create a report for one of my clients using OOo 1.1.1 FR localized on
a Win200  box.

The report accesses a dBase database that contains date fields. Previous
versions of the Report autopilot (e.g. OOo 1.1.0) worked like a charm with this
base and the date fields in the report were formatted correctly according to
the European date format system DD/MM/YYYY.

In 1.1.1 the date fields are no longer formatted when the report is generated
but left as a number e.g. 32768 which is equivalent to 17/09/1989. This means
that the user has to :
1) know that there is a formatting error and not data corruption (how many
would know that ?) and 
2) go through the whole report reformatting the cells with a date value in

When your report is 50 pages long and it's got to be in to management within an
hour that does not look good :-((


Alex

short_description: Alignment not completely respected for drop down date field columns in table controls
long_description:
* in an arbitrary data source create a table with at least one date field.
Ensure that you have access to write data into this table.
* create an arbitrary form for this table. Either use the auto pilot and chose
tabular layout or create it manually and add a table control
* ensure that the table control in the form does contain a date field column
bound to the date field of the table
* for the date field column open the property browser and set Drop down to Yes
* furthermore set Alignment to Right
* switch off the design mode
* focus an arbitrary cell in the date field
=> the text in the input control for the date field is left-aligned though for
all other rows in this column it is properly right-aligned

worked fine.  Gimp.app used to have the same problem and they fixed it in version 2.0.0.4 but I can't 
tell how exactly from looking at the code

short_description: Configuration import services should trigger backend notifications.
long_description:
When data is imported into a running office instance via the configuration
...Importer services the changes are not picked up by the office. Now that
backend-side change notifications are available the importer should make the
target backend send change notfications to its listeners.

Note: to that end the backend must export an interface for sending these
notifications. In the simplest case this would simply be the listener interface
itself.

@sarah: A candidate for cfgapi.

short_description: Unable to find issues with search
long_description:
Before creating a new issue I try to search for an existing report. Yesterday I
searched for an issue and finding no previous report created a new one. The
result was (rightly) marked as a duplicate.

As this helps no one and wanting to know I'm not a complete idiot I tried again
to search for the topic but even knowing the issue in question and using words I
can see in the issue I still get no match.

eg look at issue 19763. Now put long format date into the search and ... nothing!

I've had similar success (none) on other occasions.

This fails from the simple search
(http://qa.openoffice.org/issue_handling/project_issues.html) and I can't make
contact with the advance search either.  Maybe by tweaking all the controls on
the advanced form it can be reached but sorry I couldn't find the combination
and it is thus not working.

short_description: Auto save does not restore to the current document window
long_description:
It would be interesting that when Open Office executes Auto-save returns to the
window of the document that was in edition. When it asks for each document it
lost the current edition window.

Thanks
MS

short_description: Outline text with Appear animation has extra white line at bottom of text object
long_description:
In Impress if I have a slide with outline text where the text object has been
set to use the Appear animation I get an extra white line where the bottom of
the text object ends once the last line of the text appears. This is only during
the slideshow presentation not in drawing view.

This seems to occur when I use the Ortra theme available from the OOo Extras web
site but does not occur when I use the default white background. (Or maybe it
does but isn't visible on the white background.) I haven't tried other themes.

I have replicated this on several versions of the Windows version of OOo
including the current release candidate and also on the 1.1.0 Linux version.

I'll attach the document as a followup to this issue...

short_description: localize doesn't merge some strings for new languages
long_description:
Ivo

when merging GSI files to sources localize doesn't merge those strings:

sch source\ui\app\res_bmp.src Grafikobjektvorlagen Graphics Styles
sch source\ui\dlg\dgrdata.src Chart Data
sd source\ui\app\res_bmp.src Graphics Styles
sd source\ui\app\res_bmp.src Presentation Styles
starmath source\smres.src Selection
svtools source\dialogs\addresstemplate.src Templates: Address Book Assignment
svx source\dialog\border.src Borders
svx source\dialog\contdlg.src Contour Editor
svx source\dialog\fontwork.src Fontwork
svx source\dialog\imapdlg.src ImageMap Editor
svx source\dialog\srchdlg.src Find & Replace
sw source\ui\dialog\regionsw.src Edit Sections
sw source\ui\utlui\navipi.src Navigator

How I came up with them?

I have just re-merged GSI files for Slovenian and Hungarian to get them updated
to fix2 branch but those strings still are extracted as English ones (because of
01 fallback when localize -e is run).

The same can be seen when you are working on a completely new language as I do
now. You have completely translated GSI file merge it to new sources and then
extract back. The words shown above are not translated even if they are
translated in the original GSI file.

short_description: Goal Seek problem with logical equations.
long_description:
Gentlemen:

In addition to the 60-cell problem the goal seek does not handle logical 
equations in OOO111.  The spreadsheet in question has mostly logical 
equations.  After reducing the cell numbers to less than 60 the goal seek did 
not work. The Excel goal seek works fine on these logical equations with about 
120 cells.

Hope this helps in fixing some shortcomings in this application.  It shows 
great promise and I’m looking forward to converting to OOO.

Regards
Arthur Roth

short_description: 641c - Configure file bootstrap broken
long_description:
Two problems with install.  Downloaded 641c tarball.  Caldera Workstation 3.1 
with full install.

1.  Check for gpc fails due to bad test expressions.  

A. Filename is not enclosed in quotes in test for C and H files.  I put quotes 
around filename and it works.

echo configure:3736: checking GPC files >&5
if test -e ../external/gpc/gpc.h; then
        HAVE_GPC_H=yes
fi
if test -e ../external/gpc/gpc.c; then
        HAVE_GPC_C=yes
fi

If I put  around the path as in ../external/gpc/gpc.h both tests now work. 

B.  The final test where check is made to see if C and H files have been found 
fails.  I replaed the -1 with [....] && [....] and it worked.

if test $HAVE_GPC_H == yes -a $HAVE_GPC_C == yes; then
        AC_MSG_RESULT([GPC files found])
else
        AC_MSG_ERROR([GPC files not found])
fi

2.  Durning build of bootstrap I get

/home/brett/Development/Programs/openoffice/oo_641c_src/sal/osl/unx
-------------
/home/brett/Development/Programs/openoffice/oo_641c_src/sal/util
dmake:  Error -- 
`/home/brett/Development/Programs/openoffice/oo_641c_src/solver/641/unxlngi3.pro/inc/minormkchanged.flg' 
not found and can't be made
---* TG_SLO.MK *---

ERROR: Error 65280 occurred while making 
/home/brett/Development/Programs/openoffice/oo_641c_src/sal/util

I have full privileges to this directory.   At this point I'm stumped.

short_description: testtool: provide command to read registry from win32 system
long_description:
On win32 systems return the Entry if exists - 
else return empty string.
On Unix / Linux systems return always empty string

getRegistryValue (sPath as string sKey as string) as string

e.g.: sPath = HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Sun Microsystems\StarOffice\8
        sPath = Path
        returns file://c://StarOffice 8/program/soffice.exe

short_description: datapilot dialog has shareware style look
long_description:
open datapilot dialog
->the area for 'page fields' is not aligned with the right edge of 'column/data
fields'
Due to the 'page fields' area has to be five items wide the left side would show
the same problem after the change. But IMHO this is still better than the
current look.
Two more issues are the ugly grey empty square on the left side of the fields
area and the string 'page fields' that is only aligned in the middle of itself.
This is all pretty disharmonic.
IMHO the best solution would be to change the spec and reduce  'page fields' to
a width of 4 and align it with 'column/data fields'.

short_description: loadComponentFromURL fails to load new document when loading from loadComponentFromURL
long_description:
When loading documents using XComponentLoader.loadComponentFromUrl (Java
language binding) using the InputStream property and the private:stream/ URL
loading fails when then current document also has the URL private:stream/. 
As a workaround it is possible to append a unique identifier to the URL e.g. 
private:stream/uniquefoo.
