short_description: Q-PCD affiliate: Paste and delete modify cells hidden by autofilter
long_description:
columns which are hidden by using AutoFilter are overwritten upon paste or
delete etc. I have compared this with Excel 97 and it does not change such columns.

Try the following test:  

1) Create a blank spreadsheet with row 1 containing 2 column headers e.g.
A1='Item' and B1='What'
2) Fill columns A2 to A16 with numbers 1 to 15
3) Add a text 'XX' to columns B5 B10 and B14 only

4) Turn on AutoFilter: -standard-what=-empty-  This should hide rows 5 10 and 14

5) Add text 'ZZ' to B2 copy it and paste into B3 to B16

6) Switch AutoFilter off (all display -all- on column B). This shows that B5
B10 and B14 have been overwritten with 'ZZ' but they should be untouched.

short_description: Crash on opening an RTF document
long_description:
Double-click on an RTF file and soffice starts the launch. The splash screen is
displayed. Then you get a message box that says: An unrecoverable error has
occured. All modified files have been saved and can probably be recovered at
program restart.

This is 100% repeatable. It happens every time I open an RTF document. I also
get exactrly the same error if I try and open an RTF document from an already
running instance of soffice.

short_description: Zoom editing needed of Help system
long_description:
The Help system needs to be edited in two places describing Zoom.

I'm working in OpenOffice.org Writer 1.1.1 on Windows XP.

According to the Help Zoom does the following: Reduces or enlarges the screen
display of the current document.

I don't think current document is accurate. Try this: Set Zoom view to say
200% for one document and then close that document. Open another document. On my
machine it opens in 200% as well. It seems to be the default size until it's
set otherwise.

Also the Help system says To change the default zoom factor for
OpenOffice.org documents menus and dialogs choose Tools - Options -
OpenOffice.org - View and then enter a new value in the Scale box.

I don't think this is true. I think Scale is only for the menus and dialogs.
Document sizes are modified by View - Zoom or by clicking the icon at the bottom
of the screen (where it says 150% or whatever).

short_description: DicOOo: enhance update mechanism
long_description:
Although the self update mechanism of DicOOo (and FontOOo) is much better now I
ended up with breaking my DicOOo Autopilot after update.

If DocOOo (or FontOOo) find a newer version of itself it will ask for update
and let the user select a path to save the new version. This is ok and will work
for the current run. But weh the autopilot is invoked the next time the old
version will be used again :-(
This version will again ask for an update but if you choose the same path as
before it will fail with path does not exists or file is already there.

This is very confusing.

short_description: change tooltip to match new tab page title

Please change tooltip for numbering/list icon in Styles and Formatting window to
match new tab page title List Styles specified in numbering and bullets spec
(see issue 23723) 

The reason for this change is that the styles listed under this category are
both bullet list and numbering whereby list is the more general term. Not to
mention that other programs also refer to the category as List Styles.

Change Numbering Styles -> List Styles

This change is absolutely necessary for consistency on the UI and in the
documentation. Therefore it is a child task of the num and bullets spec so that
they get implemented for the same product release.

at the Example of QUARTILE

correct: =QUARTILE(A1:A50;1)

correct： 標準正規分布の確率を返します。
Additionally at the Construction and EXAMPLE of NORMSDIST
S has been forgot.(NORMDIST -> NORMSDIST)

When choosing INTERCEPT in the formula auto-pilot (Ctrl+F2)
the description of DATA X is incorrect.
incorrect： 従属変数Xの値が入力されているセル範囲。
correct： 独立変数Xの値が入力されているセル範囲。

short_description: Data Loss when saving Unicode File to OO File Format
long_description:
Summary:
Unicode files with code points U+1XXXX or greater can not be saved in Open 
Office format. The characters are missing when the *.sxw file is reopened.

Setup:

OS: Win2000 SP4 w/ registry modifications to support Unicode code points 
U+1XXXX and greater (see http://www.i18nguy.com/surrogates.html). Also 
installed GB18030 support package (
http://www.microsoft.com/globaldev/DrIntl/columns/015/default.mspx#Q6) and the 
free CODE2001 font (http://home.att.net/~jameskass/code2001.htm).

Test Case:

Step 1: Copied 4 characters U+1D790 U+1D791 U+1D792 U+1D793 into OpenOffice 
using BabelMap application and doing a copy and paste (OO doesn't have ability 
to enter code points >= U+FFFF). (Characters are invisible at this point since 
my default font does not have the glyphs for these characters).

Step 2: Select Edit:Select All

Step 3: Set font to Code2001 (characters are now visible)

Step 4: Save as Text Encoded UTF8 (This creates a file with a BOM and the 4 
characters.

Step 5: Close file and reopen. Edit:Select and change font to Code2001 (OO 
locks up if Code2001 is used as the default font). Characters are visible so 
this proves OO can successfully save as a plain UTF8 file. Also verified file 
correctness with hex editor.

Step 6: Now save as OpenOffice.org 1.0 Text Document (.sxw) (Again OO locks 
up for me might be a Code2001 font problem)

Step 7: Reopen the new sxw file.  The characters are missing!!

Note: The lockup problem does not seem to occur when I use the  commercial 
SimSun (Founder Extended) font but the missing character problem still 
occurs.  These fonts both have glyphs at code points greater than U+FFFF. See 
my messsage in the users mail group Unicode Plane 2 Questions

short_description: Password-protected file gets undeletable / locked
long_description:
Start staroffice
start a second staroffice with impress
File->SaveAs
Check 'password'
Set 'filename'  ( the automatic test writes isp__ as a filename )
Press 'save'
Type password 12345 confirm with something wrong. such as 54321
Type password 12345 confirm password with 12345
Close document
Open the docutment we just saved
Type password the wrong password. for instance: 34567
Open document
Type the right password: 12345
File->SaveAs
Press 'save' the password dialog should show up.
Type password a12345 confirm with the right password: a12345

Bug:
The document is opened as Read-only.
Any atempt to delete the file before ALL staroffice-instances has been closed
fails. 
The tester has even had problems deleting the file after closing all staroffices
AND 
rebooting ( on windows ). The only thing that worked was to log in with safe mode 
and command-prompt then the file was deletable.

short_description: Need a message for the case when target file is corrupted.
long_description:
The last step during document storing is to transfer the contents to the target
file. Before this operation a backup file is created. If the tranfer fails the
office tries to use the backup to restore the target file since it can already
be corrupted. Unfortunatelly it is possible that the restoring is not possible.
In this case user should be notified by an error message like:
The storing process has failed. The target file has become corrupted and can
not be restored. You can find the backup version of the target file in <path to
the backup>.

short_description: Rework Basic IDE Macro Chooser and Macro Organizer
long_description:
The Basic IDE Macro Chooser
(Tools/Macros/Organize Macros.../%PRODUCTNAME Macros)
and the Basic IDE Macro Organizer
(Tools/Macros/Organize Macros.../%PRODUCTNAME Macros/Organizer...)
should be reworked to conform to the ScriptOrganizer
specification at

http://specs.openoffice.org/scripting_framework/ScriptOrganizerSpecification.sxw

Especially the following items should be adapted:

- Separation of Application Basic macros into user and share

  The macros and dialogs which belong to the user installation
  should be listed under the root node 'My Macros' 'My Dialogs'
  or 'My Macros & Dialogs'. The macros and dialogs which belong
  to the share installation should be listed under the root node
  '%PRODUCTNAME Macros' '%PRODUCTNAME Dialogs' or
  '%PRODUCTNAME Macros & Dialogs'. 
  This affects the tree list box in the Macro Chooser the tree
  list box in the 'Modules' and 'Dialogs' tabpage of the Macro
  Organizer the first list box in the 'Libraries' tabpage of
  the Macro Organizer the tree list box in the Object Catalog
  the list box in the Basic IDE toolbar the window title in the
  Basic IDE and the status bar title in the Basic IDE.
  For more details please see the specification.

- Icons

  For the user and share installation root nodes in the tree list
  boxes the hard disk icon should be used instead of the blue star icon.
  For the document root nodes a document specific icon should be
  used instead of the default document icon.

  In the 'Dialogs' tabpage of the Macro Organizer the new icons
  for loaded and unloaded dialog libraries should be used.

- usage of '+'/'-' in tree list boxes

  The tree list boxes should use a '+' for a non-expanded entry
  and a '-' for an expanded entry.
   
- String changes

  In the 'Dialogs' tabpage of the Macro Organizer the fixed text
  should be changed from 'Module' to 'Dialog'.
  In the 'Libraries' tabpage of the Macro Organizer the title
  of the first list box should be changed from 'Application/Document'
  to 'Location'.

short_description: ooo1.0 connectivity/source/drivers/dbase/makefile.mk fix for PPC Linux
long_description:
Hi

In connectivity/source/drivers/dbase/makefile.mk there has been a change to 
work around a compiler optimization issue for PPC Linux for DTable.cxx.  This 
change actually causes problems since DTable.obj is both listed in 
EXCEPTIONFILES_OPT and as NO_OPTFILES for PPC Linux

The attached patch fixes this for PPC Linux while making sure the fix does not 
cause problems for other platforms by adding in DTable.obj

Please see the attached patch for your approval.

Thanks

Kevin

short_description: 64bit basic patch
long_description: Fix compilation of basic module on 64-bit platforms

short_description: Use of Page Styles causes data loss
long_description:
Creating a document of 32 pages for a publication the first two and last two 
pages without footer the pages in between with footer which contains 
Pagevariable displayed.
Succeeded in outputting the document as required to a .pdf but after saving 
the document as a .sxw OpenOffice crashes when trying to re-open the document.

First OO gives a warning it is closing down:
OpenOffice.org 1.1.2
Er is een onherstelbare fout opgetreden
Alle gemodificeerde bestanden zijn echter
opgeslagen en kunnen waarschijnlijk bij de volgende
programmastart worden hersteld

then there is a warning from Windows:
Program Error
Soffice.exe has generated errors and will be closed by Windows.
You will need to restart the program.
An error log is being created.

Localising the occurrence of the problem:

The above was implemented by creating a seperate Page-style for each individual 
page each Page-style having the Page-style of the next page defined as its 
Next Page-style.

After creating a document with a number of pages each with its own Page-style 
each style having its successor as the next none of the Page-styles had a 
footer inserted. After saving the document it could be re-opened without any 
problem. 

After inserting a (empty) footer into the Page-styles except to the ones used 
by the first and the last pages and subesequently saving the document the 
document could not always be re-opened. 
It happened ones with a three-page document the second time trying to open the 
document OpenOffice could repair the damage and after that it did not happen 
again with that three-page document.

With a four page document with no footer inserted in the first and last the 
second and third a footer inserted in its Pagestyle. On the second page the 
Pagevariable was defined and in the footer of the same page the Pagevariable 
was displayed. The footer of the third page remained empty. The document could 
be saved and reopened without any problem.
Subsequently the pagevariable was also displayed in the footer of the third 
page. After saving the document it could not be re-opened.

Yet this does not happen consistently. I have one 32 page document only the 
two first and the two last pages are without footer all other pages have the 
page variable displayed in the footer. I can still open the document. After 
saving it again under another name I cannot re-open that document. I cherish 
that document but I don't dare to change and save it.

I've not been able to find the error-log which was apparently created by Win2000

The same happened with the previously installed version OO 1.1

short_description: Make OOo buildable with MS VC Toolkit 2003
long_description:
berkeleydb and icu are buildable without the IDE right now see issue 30561 and
issue 30978.

I tried to build the rest of OOo (without python/pyuno) and here is what I found
so far:

You also need the .NET Framework SDK (for msvcrt.lib) and the 64 bit part
of the PSDK (for nmake).

You have to to add the path to ?/Microsoft SDK/Bin/Win64/ (for nmake) to
your PATH before calling configure and apply the following patch.
Attention! HACK it hardcodes some pathes for libs/includes unconditionally
for vc toolkit.

Changes:
Add: c:\Programme\Microsoft Visual Studio .NET 2003\Vc7 (Framework SDK) for
     msvcrt.lib
and  $PSDK_HOME/lib/IA64 (Platform SDK) for otherwise unavailable *.lib
to $ILIB.

Add: $PSDK_HOME/include/Win64/crt for comutil.h + ? to $SOLARINC

This compiles a while ...

short_description: Catastrophic behaviour of images.zip in instset_native
long_description:
When doing a build in instset_native (and probably inset_nativeoo) the first
thing that happens is that images.zip gets removed and built again. This is a
major nono per se since packing it anew takes quite a while.

But adding insult to injury images.zip gets created in the common tree - which
might be a nice idea in priciple - but makes parallel building of install sets
for different platforms impossible since invariably one platform will delete
images.zip while another is packing it; which results either in a build error
because images.zip is not found or in and incomplete install set because
images.zip is truncated.

The current behaviour is unacceptable twofold: first it must be possible to
build different platforms concurrently - this is the standard case after a
resync to a new minor after all. Second building images.zip each and every time
is wasting lots of time. If there currently is no way to get the dependencies
for images.zip right please devise a new way.

short_description: [Edit]->[Change]->[Show] produce wrong numbering output.
long_description:
When the [Edit]->[Changes]->[Record] is on
deleting first numbered style paragraph makes the number incorrect.

Reproduction of bug:
1. Create new document by clicking [File]->[New]->[Text Document].
2. Make sure [Format]->[AutoFormat]->[While Typing] is ON.
   Make sure [Edit]->[Changes]->[Record] is OFF.
   Make sure [Edit]->[Changes]->[Show] is OFF.

3. Type 1. foo then press . You will see 1. is turned to
   the automatically numbering style.
4. Type 2. bar then press 
5. Type 3. car then press 
6. Now you can see the document which looks like this:
-----------------
   1. foo
   2. bar
   3. car
-----------------
7. Make [Edit]->[Changes]->[Record] to selected (ON).
   Make [Edit]->[Changes]->[Show] to unselected (OFF).
8. Delete the first line 1. foo so that there will be only two items.
   Then you can see following...
-----------------
   3. bar
   4. car
-----------------

NOW. WHY bar HAS THE NUMBER 3 NOT 1???

When you generate some custom numbering style it has the same defect.

Reproduction of bug (custom style):
1. [File]->[New]->[Text Document]
2. Creating a new numbering style.
   a. In pragrah style dialog (press F11 if not visible)
      click the Numbering Styles button.
   b. click the right moust button on the list then
      select New to create a new style.
   c. change following entries:
      Organizer->Name: olist-numbering
      Options->Numbering: 1 2 3 ...
   d. Click ok to finish.
3. Create a new numbered paragraph style.
   a. In paragraph style dialog (press F11 if needed)
      click the Paragraph Styles button.
   b. click the right mouse button on the list then
      select New to create a new style.
   c. change following entries:
      Organizer->Name: olist
      Organizer->Next Style: olist
      Numbering->Numbering Style: olist-numbering
   d. Click ok to finish.
4. click olist in paragraph style dialog to
   start with olist style.
5. type a few items (more than 3).. it looks like this:
-----------------
     1. foo
     2. bar
     3. car
     4. cdr
-----------------
   Note that the number is automatically appeared.
   You only need to type foo bar car cdr.
6. Select [Edit]->[Changes]->[Record].
   Make sure [Edit]->[Changes]->[Show] is turned OFF.
7. Remove the foo the first item. So that there will
   be only three items. It will look like this:

-------------
     3. bar
     4. car
     5. cdr
-------------

Here's the bug. WHY THE NUMBER STARTS FROM 3 NOT 1?

8. Now try to turn on [Edit]->[Changes]->[Show].
   It will show the removed item foo properly.

---

Personally I don't know this is a bug or not. But I'd like to
know how to solve it since I'm using OO to write some kind of
standard document.. *sigh* A quick solution is needed..

short_description: multilingual instalation does not work correctly
long_description:
Pepa Cacek reportoval toto: 
--- 
Zatim jsem narazil na problem (Win OS) pri instalaci - ta probihala vzdy 
nezavisle na nastaveni promenne LANG v cestine a po instalaci byl vychozi 
jazyk anglictina. Po prepnuti jazyka pomoci setofficelang to uz fungovalo 
korektne. 
--- 
Mozem potvrdit az na to ze instalacia prebehla v slovecine. 
Postupoval som takto: 
1 root 
2 ./install 
3 user (braklo) 
4 /usr/local/OpenOffice.org1.1.3> LANG=sk_SK ./setup 
(intalacia v slovencine ako workstation)

short_description: We need a resolution state for incomplete bug reports
long_description:
Hi
in the moment there's no real state to flag a bug with a lack of information.
You can set them to 'invalid' or 'worksforme' but in most cases this doesn't
match the intended goal.
A new flag called i.e. 'incomplete' would give an better overview on open tasks
and unexperienced bug reporters would better understand what you want from them.
Thanks Peter QA - StarOffice

short_description: Regular Expressions Don't  Seem to work
long_description:
I am trying to use regular expressions in the DSUM ( and other) 
functions within the spread sheet.  Whenever I enable regular
expressions all the queries fail.  For example I have a text column
Name and a numerical column Price.  I wanted to sum all prices
which are in rows with the substring robot in the Name column.
If I do DSUM with regular expressions enabled I get no matches even
when the Regualar Expression is robot and I have a row which has
exactly the Name robot in it.  If I turn off regular expressions then
DSUM correctly returns the sum of all rows which have exactly the
name robot.  The regular expression search also seems to fail in the 
Search and Replace window.

  The same queries fail in both versions 641C and 638 under both
Linux and Windows98 all running on PentiumIII's.

  I'm new to IssueZilla.  I tried to find any previous Issues with the phrase
regular expression in the summary -- but found nothing.  

  I realize I may be making some kind of trivial mistake -- so I tried to use
the exmaple presented in the help docs where it says you can type all.*to find
every cell which starts with all.  This also fails.
   Am I doing something trivially wrong?

 I just guessed on the subcomponent.
Dan Graham
graham@prospero.uoregon.edu

short_description: xslt filters are not chosen according to specified extension or preselection
long_description:
Misbehavior Earlier in OpenOffice 1.1.2:
Only one new XSLT filter can be added. Single added UBL filter works fine even
without doctype. As soon a second filter is being added even an export filter
of a different application (e.g. Calc flat xml export) the filter choice dialog
pops up.
It works only if the filters have a doctype set by the non-documented
'doctype:' feature as both input documents have no doctype at all.

Misbehavior in StarOffice8 (src680_m54-5):
The UBL filter (attached JAR created in a the src680_m54-5) is not able to load
a UBL XML document without setting the so far undocument prefix 'doctype:'
which states a search string for the input document (in this case
doctype:CommonAggregateTypes).
In all other cases the XML is being loaded as flat ASCII even with especially
addressing the UBL filter.

Further issues:
- StarOffice8 have to be restarted for dialog changes taking affect (works in
OOo1.1.2).
- Setting of 'doctype:' prefix under DocType vanish from the dialog after
reopening (although it still exists in the configuration) this makes it very
hard for externals to understand why other filters work.
- Filters saved in SO7 may not be compatible with SO8 (FilterDetection get lost)
- Filters saved in SO8 will be most probably not work in SO8 (statement AS)
- removing of filters (e.g. XHTML filters) become only apparent after reload
(OOoLater)

short_description: OOo cwsanalyze fails to recognize valid .cvspass entry
long_description:
cwsanalyze fails for me with:
$ cwsanalyze.pl all
cwsanalyze -- version: 1.3
Analyzing child workspace 'vq02' master workspace 'SRC680'.
Child workspace approval status: ready for QA
========== Analyzing module 'helpcontent2' ==========
Retrieving changes ...
XX:pserver:vq@localhost:/shared/data/helm/cvs/repositoryYY

The cvs rdiff command is broken for the OOo CVS server.
To fix this problem you have to issue the following cvs login command:

    cvs -d :pserver:vq@localhost:/shared/data/helm/cvs/repository login

The password is your ususal OOo password.

The problem is that my .cvspass contains lines like:
/1 :pserver:vq@localhost:2401/shared/data/helm/cvs/repository xxxxxxxxx
-------------------------^^^^
but sub is_valid_login in CvsModule.pm checks for:
:pserver:vq@localhost:/shared/data/helm/cvs/repository

I don't know if the port number is a cygwin artifact I don't think so but
the following patch fixes this problem for me.

short_description: support surrogate pairs in Insert Special Characters Dialog

Characters dialog only displays unicode characters in the range 0x0000-0xFFFF
even if the font contains characters in the extended range (>0xFFFF).  This
makes extended characters characters difficult to use.
Even if an extended character is pasted in there are other problems. See issue
31168.

assertions.

Broken with rowlimit changes.

short_description: at-poke flagges hidden controls as showing and visible
long_description:
- Start OOo
- New text
- Tools - Customize - Toolbars
- Toolbar dropdown button - Icon and text
- Ok
(now some icons are hidden in the selectore at the end of the toolbar. Ex: Zoom)
- start at-poke
- go in at-poke to the Standard OOo toolbar
- Choose the Zoom icon
-> it is flagged as showing and visible which is not true

short_description: allow RTTI support under IRIX in sal/inc/sal/types.h
long_description: RTTI is supported on IRIX.

short_description: Chinese simplified/traditional conversion: Cursor & Undo
long_description:
According to specification when starting the Chinese simplified/traditional
conversion (not the Korean Hangul/Hanja!) the cursor position should be stored
before the conversion in order to restire the view and cursor position after the
document is converted.

Also since the Chinese conversion is done in a single step Undo should restore
the whole document.

TL: Since I don't know how both task can be achieved in the specific
applications I think it is best when you take over.

short_description: Typos and wrong entrys compared to the spec
long_description:
The German and English strings for Tools Options StarOffice Security must be
changed according to the Spec.

Button Makro Sicherheit in German version is to small and the String has changed
to 'Makrosicherheit' according to the Spec.

Trusted Sources Tabpage on Macro Security dialog : The second occurens of
Trusted sources must be changed according to the Spec to Trusted certificates
(English and German).

The separator line between tusted certificates and trusted file locations in the
Macro Security Trusted Sources dialog could change position approximately one
line up. The location field could be 1 line smaller.

The date in Expiration date in the View certificate / trusted certificate
dialogs must be lowercase.

Warn on PDF creation must be checked against the Spec.

short_description: [cws eforms2] add instance in datanavigator doesn't work correct in new models
long_description:
1. open a new XML form
2. open the datanavigator
3. create a new model
=> you have an instance1
4. create a new instance with the instance button
==>> now you have a new instance but Instance1 is gone

short_description: Crash on sxw -> doc via uno
long_description:
I am trying to convert the following OOo Writer document to MS Word format using
Java and it would crash OpenOffice.org 1.1.2.

Document itself is pretty simple. An A4 portrait page with Heading 3 first
paragraph followed by a 40 row table that spans into the next page. If I remove
the first heading paragraph or reduce the number of rows in the table it would
not crash when storeAsURL() is called.

short_description: Euro sign is not printed
long_description:
Hi

OOo 641c built for Mandrake Linux 8.2 with gcc-3.0.4 and STLport 4.5.3. This
build will fail to print the Euro sign. It appears that both OOo and StarOffice
have the issue. Our printer guy had to say:

<< The bug is the following. Both Star Office and OpenOffice.org generate 
PostScript which defines the encoding in the beginning (so that  GhostScript or
the PostScript printer do not need to know the ISO-1252 encoding which these
programs use internally. But they do a mistake: They use /euro as name for the
Euro symbol and not /Euro. >>

short_description: I would like to access CVS module of ja native-language project
long_description: I would like to access CVS module of ja native-language project.

short_description: cannot access Evolution 2.0 address books
long_description:
Evolution 2.0 has the user's address book files in ~/.evolution rather than
~/evolution as in 1.4. OOo does not seem able to access the new version and
there is no mechanism to point it to the new directory structure. (As an aside
changing the 1.4 directory name does not prevent OOo from finding the old
address book).

short_description: Add Esperanto to postset.mk
long_description:
Howdy!

Trying to update postset.mk and get this:

[joey@suse]:/ooo/solenv/solenv/inc> cvs -d :pserver:k0fcc@localhost:2444/cvs
commit -m Added RES_ESPER for Esperanto L10N postset.mk
User k0fcc doesn't have  access to project tools
cvs [server aborted]: correct above errors first!
[joey@suse]:/ooo/solenv/solenv/inc>

Please either give me access or add the following to the file:

.IF $(RES_ESPER)!= || $(give_me_all_languages)!=
alllangiso+=eo
.ENDIF 
completelangiso+=eo	#RES_ESPER

The frame is positioned with From top and have no wrap.

short_description: Crash when searching backwards
long_description:
I had pasted the Linux Networking Howto into the word processor in order to 
format & print it.  Had saved the document several times after making changes.

I began searching for paragraph headings using their numbers (eg. 12.).

I searched several times then wanted to search UPWARDS so selected 
the 'Backwards' checkbox & clicked the 'Find' button (twice I think).

Upon doing this three things happened:

1.
The highlighted and the unhighlighted part of the current paragraph heading 
were reversed.

2.
The program did an autosave of the file.

3.
The program crashed with a message re. unrecoverable error.

Directly afterwards the word processor restarted & offered to recover the 
document which opened up ok.


Then I tested by copying part of that doc to a new one.

Once it simply reversed the highlighting & didn't die.

Twice it did die as above and it also caused the soffice module to die 
(illegal operation).  Below is the detail:

-----
SOFFICE caused an invalid page fault in
module  at 0000:00000038.
Registers:
EAX=020c02b8 CS=0157 EIP=00000038 EFLGS=00010286
EBX=032a0001 SS=015f ESP=0093ddd8 EBP=0093dde4
ECX=b8cade00 DS=015f ESI=032a0034 FS=5767
EDX=01310828 ES=015f EDI=01470f48 GS=0000
Bytes at CS:EIP:
9a 00 69 08 65 04 70 00 07 00 52 d0 4d f8 00 f0 
Stack dump:
1d613477 021d0301 020c0278 0093de24 1d593a09 032a0028 032a0201 03210e78 
032a0228 020c0278 00400007 00a60007 01470f48 032a0000 00000000 00a60000 
-----

Hope that's a help.

Adrian Hicks

short_description: Convert Autopilot crash
long_description:
Hi 
 
Using Autopilot > convert 
Select D:\ directory and all microsoft files 
 
An unrecoverable error (c.s.s.ucb.InteractiveAugmentedIOException) occurs in 
 
Function ReadDirectories 
 
on line 
 
DirContent() = oUcbObject.GetFolderContents(AnchorDirTrue) 
 
When it occurs the AnchorDir points on a system directory (Hidden) named 
System Volume Information I can't access through explorer (access denied) 
 
Reproduced with OOo 111 and 113 
 
laurent

short_description: Macro: Crash when editing last module
long_description:
Automated test: f_basic.bas / tMakro_Modules/..._Dialogs

Reproduction:
1. create a new module for the current writer document
2. hide the module via context-menu on the tabbar
3. open the settings (last item in context menu for the tabbar)
4. select the module (last entry in treelistbox)
5. click edit

-> The office crashes. 

IDs are: rzxxcg rzxkcg and many more ...

short_description: Autosaving should be suppressed if doc is being saved/was saved
long_description:
The AutoSave dialog window that pops up from time to time (if enabled in the
options) should be suppressed under following two conditions:

- The document is currently being saved
- The document has just been saved and was not altered since then.

It is especially dumb (and annoying) if I save a big document (e.g. a big
spreadsheed) which takes some minutes - and have this saving process
interrupted by a dialog asking me it save the document. Just if I react on this
dialog the saving continues.

This minor bug is to be found in any version of OOo1.0 and 1.1 I know.

short_description: german version of m56 has english menu entries
long_description:
The german version of m56 uses the wrong language in menus (english instead of
german).

ftp://ftp.linux.cz/pub/localization/OpenOffice.org/1.1.3/OOo_1.1.3_Win32Intel_install_cs.zip

Thanks.

long_description: berkeleydb is missing NetBSD support

long_description: In a table: right clic -> command Limte tabella instead of Limite tabella.

short_description: NetBSD uses lpc to access the printer
long_description:
Change the order how commands for accessing the printer are tried to match the
Linux version which is also the NetBSD way.

long_description: sablot is missing NetBSD support.

short_description: performance: Math initial startup takes too long
long_description:
install soffice
start soffice (just the framework)
open a math document
--> the initial startup of a math document needs ~16.5 seconds on a 1.8 Ghz
Pentium 4 with 512 MB ram

JA: measured on my JDS2 working system

short_description: F_OK is already defined by pthreads
long_description:
F_OK already gets defined by the GNU pthread library to 0 so the enum in
sw/source/filter/ww8/ww8par.hxx breaks. (The value in the enum is also 0).

short_description: Make view shell creation synchronous
long_description:
When a new document and the associated ViewShellBase object are created the
stacked sub view shells are created asynchronously.  This leads to several
problems (see issue 31283 issue 32314 issue 32926 issue 29592 issue 34941.)
One problem is that the controller is not available directly after creation of
the ViewShellBase object.

short_description: Enhanced selection in case of existing selection
long_description:
In case a table already inhibits a selection the user should be able to simply
select a row or cell and click ONCE to activate this new selection.
The spec (see URL) has been updated accordingly.

short_description: configimport must not call javaldx
long_description:
Please make sure that the configimport utility does not call javaldx. This issue
is P2 because of  i34825 and i35537.

short_description: visibility attribute work
long_description:
The source needs annotating with the symbol visibility attributes to improve
performance.

short_description: Opening a document hangs in an endless loop
long_description:
I cannot open a document I created before. During the opening OOo displays the
still empty document window shows the correct document title in the title bar.
It also shows the progress bar progressing from the left to the right. However
after that OOo refuses to display the document in the document windows but
instead spends billions of CPU cycles in what seems to be an endless loop.

Further information:
- The document has a somewhat complex structure of chained and unchained frames.
- The document was created with the same OOo release.
- I could recover the data by creating a new text document and inserting the
problematic document into it. But this cannot be regarded a solution of course.

short_description: RNG: Invalid attribure svg:points
long_description:
According to the OASIS Open Office spcification the svg:points attribute
(available for  has to be renamed tp draw:points

short_description: en Help: an UNO -> a UNO
long_description:
In /text/shared/guide/start_parameters.xhp
'Notifies the $[officename] software that upon the creation of UNO Acceptor
Threads an UNO Accept String will be used.'

Thanks.

short_description: Wrong display of Draw/Impress as OLE object
long_description:
When a Draw or Impress document is embedded as OLE object into say a Writer
document then the OLE object is displayed not correctly:
- the initial repaint is missing so that the OLE content is not displayed
- the size of Impress OLEs is wrong
- when switching from one view to another in an Impress OLE the content is again
not displayed correctly

short_description: some slots in chart are not working
long_description:
In m55 all worked fine in m56 not anymore.

running the following script fails on calling e.g the slot
FormatAxisYAxis which is mapped to an ID but also changing to 
.uno:DiagramAxisY doesn't resolv the issue.
I also tried to activate chart by hand and try to call the slot -
no change.

Looks like no slot from the chart menu Format or Insert works.

sub main
tchart
end sub

sub LoadIncludeFiles
    use global\system\inc\master.inc
    use global\system\inc\gvariabl.inc
    gApplication = calc
    Call GetUseFiles
end sub

testcase tchart
	hNewDocument()
	sleep 2
	insertChartCalc
	kontext AutoFormatDiagrammBeginn
	if AutoFormatDiagrammBeginn.exists(5) then
		printlog insertchartcalc worked
	endif
	Fertigstellen.Click
	sleep 5
	' one escape to deactivate chart
	gMouseClick(9999)
	sleep 1
        'click into chart to select it again
	gMouseClick(2010)
	sleep 1
	try
		editobjectedit
	catch
		warnlog editobjectedit couldn't run because object wasn't selected?
	endcatch
	sleep 1
'	try
		FormatAxisYAxis
'	catch
'		warnlog chart wasn't activated?
'	endcatch
	hCloseDocument()
endcase

short_description: linux version opens incorectly text document created by openoffice from MS word template

Steps to reproduce:
1. take MS Word template with dropdown list of values. I used list of month.
2. create document using that template. 
3. set combobox values in document. I set July in my case.
4. save document

Behaviour of OO in Windows:
5. open saved document. It shows saved values of comboboxes. In my case it show
July.
 
Behaviour of OO in Linux(Debian):
5. open the same document. BUG: It shows last values of comboboxes. In my case
it show December.

Linux version of OO saves values of combobox but does not show.

with a style:list-style-name attribute that is attached to the 
element. If bullet lists are switched of the attribuet value has to be emtpy.
If they are switched on the name of the bullert list contained in the parent
style has to be used. Since that's probably the only one that is supported
anyway it seems to be okay to use any style name for the moment.

short_description: Improve performance of RTL_LOGFILE_ stuff
long_description:
The RTL_LOGFILE_TRACE/CONTEXT... macros in rtl/logfile.h and rtl/logfile.hxx
always calculate osl_getGlobalTimer() and osl_getThreadIdentifier(0) even if
rtl_logfile_trace does not output anything (if the environment variable
RTL_LOGFILE is not set).  On Linux for example every call to
osl_getGlobalTimer leads to a gettimeofday system call so that the RTL_LOGFILE
stuff slows things down unnecessarily.

short_description: flat XML filters don't support OLE objects
long_description:
Currently flat XML filters of OOo or OASIS file formats don't support OLE
objects i.s. if you save any files with OLE objects (MSO Math Chart etc) to
flat XML files of OOo or OASIS you can't open these files and see those OLE
objects again although the binary data of these objects (base-64 encoded) are
saved in the flat XML files already.

Due to this bug  important features of importing MsWordXML files with OLE
objects (e.g. Math Chart etc) are impossible to implement.

(see http://udk.openoffice.org/common/man/draft/tests.html how to execute it).

short_description: Helper UNO interface needed for accessing script storage URIs
long_description:
Currently when implementing a new LanguageScriptProvider UNO service the
initialize method is passed a string by the Scripting Framework. This string
is the context in which the LanguageScriptProvider should look for scripts.
It can be difficult to transform this string into a URI which can be used
with the XSimpleFileAccess interface of the the Universal Content Broker.

The Scripting Framework should provide a ScriptURIHelper service to assist
LanguageScriptProvider implementators.

short_description: xStorable.store can destroy an OpenOffice document
long_description:
In a Basic macro (for example) open as read-only an existing document.
Store again the document using xStorable.store

obviously bugged for such case. It should either store the same document unchanged or 
throw an exception.

The problem exists at least from 1.1.0.

long_description: the test need longer sleep time outs

short_description: [RFE] data source browser in embedded forms should display the database which it belongs to
long_description:
When you open an arbitrary text document and press F4 the data source browser
opens and allows you to browse all database documents which are registered in
Tools|Options|OOo Base|Databases.

When you open a database document and a form therein and then press F4 the
same happens: You see all registered databases.
In particular if the database which the form belongs to is not registered you
don't see this database. This makes designing a form uneceesarily complicated.
For instance to quickly create form controls you could normally just display
the respective table in the data source browser and drag'n'drop the columns
into the document.

Today you need to open the table as a separate window and start a
drag-and-drop-operation between differents tasks - which is quite a hassle.

In agreement with the iTeam for the new DB application we decided the following:

The data source browser in a embedded form document should display exactly the
database which the form belongs to and not the registered databases.

certain 641 (original) worked correctly.

to use %PRODUCTNAME 5.0 PreFinal by October 1998 if you specify your e-mail
address.;

Please remove it completely so translators do not see such strings at all.

short_description: en Help: Wrong description for Imp operator
long_description:
In /text/sbasic/shared/03060300.xhp the following four changes are necessary.

Re:
Sub ExampleImp
Dim vA as Variant vB as Variant vC as Variant vD as Variant
Dim vOut as Variant
A = 10: B = 8: C = 6: D = Null
vOut = A > B Imp B > C REM returns -1
vOut = B > A Imp B > C REM returns 0
vOut = A > B Imp B > D REM returns -1
vOut = (B > D Imp B > A) REM returns 0
vOut = B Imp A REM returns -3
End Sub

1. vOut = B > A Imp B > C REM returns 0
 -> vOut = B > A Imp B > C REM returns -1

2. vOut = A > B Imp B > D REM returns -1
 ->  vOut = A > B Imp B > D REM returns 0

3. vOut = (B > D Imp B > A) REM returns 0
 -> vOut = (B > D Imp B > A) REM returns -1

4. vOut = B Imp A REM returns -3
 -> vOut = A Imp B REM returns -3

short_description: Numeric data treated as text (although formatted as numeric)
long_description:
I have formatted cells as numeric by selecting the cells and choosing Format-
>Cells...->Numbers Tab then choosing the Number category and any format 
other than General.

Then when I enter numeric data it is treated as text. It is left justified and 
it is not recognized in numeric formulas.

For example:
     In cell A1 enter 123
     In cell A2 enter 456
     In cell A3 enter =A1+A2

The result is:
     In cell A1 left justified 123
     In cell A2 left justified 456
     In cell A3 right justified 0.00

If I precede the numbers in A1 and A2 by an equal sign then the result is:
     In cell A1 right justified 123.00
     In cell A2 right justified 456.00
     In cell A3 right justified 579.00

It may be that there is an option that will treat numbers as numeric without 
preceding them by an equal sign. If there is such an option I haven't been 
able to find it and my searches through the online help have not turned it up. 
If this is the only data entry option then in my opinion (as a professional 
accountant) this is a serious design flaw. I should be able to rapidly enter a 
column of numbers via the 10-key pad. Most 10-key pads I have seen on PCs do 
not have an equal sign which requires the hand to be moved to the regular 
keyboard for each entry or it requires two-handed entry.

short_description: OOo should check whether java-settings are valid and if not ask for the new location of the JRE (java support shouldn't be disabled silently)
long_description:
Upon installation of OpenOffice.org 1.x the user is typically asked to setup a
Java Runtime Environment for OOo to use (via the jvmsetup program).  Everything
is fine and good after that until they uninstall the JRE version that OOo is
setup to use.  Even if they install another JRE version OOo doesn't seem to
notice and the Java-dependent features of OOo are disabled.  Which is a problem
especially for users dependent on the accessibility features that OOo provides.
 So IMHO what I recommend would be for OOo on startup to check to see if the
runtime library (RuntimeLib=...) listed in the OOo1.x\user\config\java.ini file
still exists.  If not then run the Java Setup program (jvmsetup).

I am currently using OOo 1.1.2rc on Windows 98SE. Please confirm if this issue
extends to other Operating Systems also.

short_description: TableWizard: Primary Key page should offer two AutoValueCheckboxes
long_description:
When the primary key is to be added automatically there should also be a
checkbox to choose Autoincrementation (if supported by the database). As not
always all numeric database types of a database also support autoincrementation
the primary key data type should -if possible- be of a numeric datatype that
also supports autoincremtation. Consequently the order according to which an
appropriate datatype  for the primary key field is searched for is as follows:
1) INTEGER
2) FLOAT
3) REAL
4) DOUBLE
6) NUMERIC
7) DECIMAL

This is the same order that is chosen as a fallback when a datatype of  a table
scenario is not supported by a database.

if Autoincremtation is not supported by the database the relevant checkboxes 
are both disabled.
if the autoincrementation of a selected primary key field has been assigned on
the second page already the checkbox must be checked too.
The specification ot the tablewizard must be changed accordingly.

short_description: Creation of a user-friendly feature list
long_description:
I started working on a user-friendly feature list similar to the one that I
created for OpenOffice.org 1.1:

   http://www.openoffice.org/dev_docs/features/1.1/index.html

My goal is to use Elizabeth Matthis' and Sophie Gautier's work as a bases for my
feature web page:

   http://marketing.openoffice.org/2.0/featureguide.html

People who want to participate/help with this effort can attach screenshots of
new features and short user-friendly feature descriptions to this issue.

A first draft should be available by December 9 (Thursday).

fÃ¼r'  and 'Ausgestellt durch' is cut off. The Information about the certificate
holder and the Issuer should be shown under this text or the information should
be cut.

short_description: officecfg: add dependencies on build tools
long_description:
In officecfg the generated output (xcs and xcu files) and depends not only on
the input (xcs and xcu files) but also on the build tools (xsl files) which
may change as well.

A special case of this are validation files (dtd and xsl files) which determine
whether the build succeeds at all.

The makefiles should specify dependencies of the outputs on all these auxiliary
files to avoid build breakage during incremental integrations.

short_description: Format -> default should be available in Stylist
long_description:
Consider calling it remove hard formatting or revert to style or something.
Also this functionality should be accessible from the styles window. In
particular format->default and apply style default appear to do different
things (the latter preserves hard formatting). 

Brendan

short_description: create_patch does not work for files containing CRLF lineends
long_description:
tg_ext.mk:
	+-cd $(PRJ)$/$(ROUT) && diff -rc misc$/$(TARFILE_ROOTDIR)
misc$/build$/$(TARFILE_ROOTDIR) | $(PERL) $(SOLARENV)$/bin$/cleandiff.pl | tr -d
\015 > misc$/$(NEW_PATCH_FILE_NAME).tmp

- For files containing CRLF lineends tr -d \015 effectively destroys the diff
generated. If patch shall be applied 'patch' recognises that source line in
file to patch is binary different from source line given in patch file (CRLF vs
LF) and therefore refuses to apply the patch.

short_description: Crash when inserting Math object after recovering document
long_description:
When inserting a Math OLE object in the Writer 
somewhere in the stack below the com::sun::star::lang::DisposedException
excpetion that gets thrown by the call xAccess->hasByName in 
  EmbeddedObjectContainer::HasEmbeddedObject

short_description: Activate OSL_TRACE only if OSL_DEBUG_LEVEL>1
long_description:
Currently OSL_TRACE is active if OSL_DEBUG_LEVEL is greater than zero. (true for
non-pro builds even if not compiled with debug info). This leads to several
(annoying) trace messages when working with a non-pro build. Output is not
supposed to be a hint for malfunctions; thus it is not of common interest. 

OSL_TRACE should be only active in case OSL_DEBUG_LEVEL is greater than one
(true if compiling with debug information regardless of pro or non-pro build).

short_description: mis-matching ImageList icon size & alpha ...
long_description:

reality for a while with our slightly incomplete Industrial icon set ] we get a
situation where the default alpha (non transparent) for the border region of 2
pixels on right & bottom shows up as black.

This patch fixes that & (I hope) shouldn't make life any less efficient.

A beautiful piece of cut & paste coding in this module though - someone needs an
extra 5 gold stars for producing ever more LOC / day ;-) [ or something ;-> ]

short_description: Change to gtk 2.4 is not compatible with our baseline libc-2.2.0
long_description:
SRC680 m67: failure during startup. In all cases crash in symbol resolution on
loading either libtk or libsfx2.
smoketest on up-smb (SuSe 7.1 lib-2.2.0): fails
smoketest on v60x-so4 (SuSe 7.1 libc-2.2.0): fails
smoketest on hr-1 (SuSe 9.0): works
smoketest on v20z-so3 (SuSe 9.2): works
smoketest on linux-1 (SuSe 7.1 libc-2.2.5 (!)): works

In all failing cases the problem can be workarounded by either removing 
gconfbe1.uno.so *or* by copying the following gnome/gtk libs into the installation:
/so/env/gnome/linux/cinnabar_b15/usr/lib/libORBit*
/so/env/gnome/linux/cinnabar_b15/usr/lib/libgthread-*
/so/env/gnome/linux/cinnabar_b15/usr/lib/libgobject-*
/so/env/gnome/linux/cinnabar_b15/usr/lib/libgmodule*
/so/env/gnome/linux/cinnabar_b15/usr/lib/libgconf*

Preliminary analysis: Kay and I concluded that we hit a bug in the runtime
loader which was present in libc-2.2.0 but not in libc-2.2.5 or newer. The bug
gets triggered if the gnome/gtk libs are not found by gconfbe1.uno.so and
corrupts the some internal run time linker data structure which lead to a crash
sometime later if another shared lib is loaded.

It has not yet been ruled out that it's a multiprocessing bug on older libc's
runtime linker. One more test on a base line conforming single processor machine
is needed.

Maybe it's time bump up our base line requirements? Or disable the gnome/gtk
loading mechanism for older libc's. I would prefer the latter aproach :-)

short_description: DBase column names get mangled when containing zero chars
long_description:
Working with DBase tables calc does import fine. But when the export is done
with column names starting with numbers an containing number with leading
zeros it fails:

88_06_20 	is mangled to 	N88__6_2_

We have two issues here:

1. first char of column name is set from number to char

It is correct to do this by the DBase spec I think (at least for the first
char) but several other programs work this way and calc should too.

2. '0' chars get exchanged by underscores

This is an error zeros in the column name should be left untouched.


When the export is done via drag and drop to a database anything works as
expected and the column names stay untouched. Only the way using the
menu 'file - export' is concerned.

short_description: address import from evolution 2.0.2 unusable
long_description:
I like very much how OpenOffice can retrieve data from the Contacts database
of evolution (I'm using evolution 2.0.2 on Fedora Core 3).  However 
OpenOffice gets the entire address label in 1 field called address_label_home
in a very unusable format.  

In evolution you can define the address (e.g. the home address) in several
fields:
 - Address
 - City
 - Zip/Postal Code
 - State/Province
 - Country

If you look in the file addressbook.db in which evolution stores this
(with db_dump -p) you see that the address is then stored e.g. as:
  ;;Nieuwstraat 100;Brussel;;1000;\0d\0a

But once this gets into OpenOffice you get in address_label_home:
  Nieuwstraat 100Brussel1000

So from the db file of evolution it is clear that OpenOffice should be able
to get the different subfields from the address field but OpenOffice only 
gets the entire field and moreover removes the separators.

Unless I'm doing something wrong here it means that it's very difficult
to use these addresses e.g. to make labels.

short_description: Performance: org.openoffice.Office.Common data reparsed at each start on Gnome
long_description:
The binary configuration cache (in $userinst/user/registry/cache) is designed to
prevent unnecessary reparsing of multiple (unchanged) xcu files. The detection
of changes that require a reparse and remerge is based on the XTimeStamped
interface implemented by the layer objects of the various backends.

On Gnome the cache for org.openoffice.Office.Common is recreated on each office
start. The reason for this is that the timestamp provided by the gconfbe backend
is not based on data modification time but generated from wallclock time at
each office start.

The recommended solution is to create a timestamp from the actual data. For
backends providing few short values this can simply be a concatenation of the
values otherwise a hash over the values can be used to avoid an excessively
sized timestamp.

short_description: Memory leaks across all applications just opening/closing empty documents.
long_description:
Attaching zip that provides a very simple demonstration of the problems. There 
are 3 empty documents in the zip -- a doc ppt and xls file. By placing these 
files at the root of your C:\ drive and running the opentest.vbs script you 
will notice memory being incrementally eaten. The test just simply opens and 
closes the document you point it at 2000 times (see comment at top of script). 
Here's how much memory is lost during each test:

doc: 44MB (~22k per open/close)
ppt: 70MB (~35k per open/close)
xls: 37MB (~19k per open/close)

These documents are empty so there's nothing fancy going on. The problem is 
magnified when documents actually have real content in them. Impress seems to 
be the worst offender so I'm logging this under the Presentation area.

This problem makes it difficult to run OO as a server because you have to 
monitor memory usage and shut OO down and restart it periodically to regain 
memory. Please consider fixing this before release. I will do more testing on 
real documents if this is addressed so we can figure out where memory leaks are 
occurring beyond the simple empty document case.

short_description: FTP UCP does not work on Linux with set ftp_proxy environment variable
long_description:
On Linux set the environment variable ftp_proxy to some HTTP proxy URL
(http://host:port).  (On my SuSE 9.1 machine this variable is already set when
I start due to some part of the configuration of that machine.)  In soffice
under Tools - Options... - Internet -Proxy set Proxy server to None.  Then
try to open some FTP URL via the file open dialog: an error box General
Input/Output error appears.

short_description: Crash when trying to save a new template
long_description:
New textdocument enter some text choose templates/save from file-menu enter a
name for the template and press enter -> crash !

short_description: Help file references Ellipses toolbar
long_description:
When in help you access Toolbars > Tools Bar > Ellipses you are taken to a page
that states icons and information about the old Ellipses toolbar that no longer
exists.  The tools are still present in Draw but they are in two toolbars the
Drawing toolbar and the Basic Shapes toolbar.

short_description: File type text for HSQL database is incorrect/misleading
long_description:
- File/New/Database
- Create new database
- Save and proceed/Finish

The popup for save as gives a default file type of StarOffice XML (Base).
This misinforms the user that it is a XML flat file database when in fact it is
a HSQL database that is being created. 

The text should at the very least mention HSQL either:

HSQL database (OpenOffice Base)

OR

OpenOffice XML (HSQL database)

There has already been a lot of confusion about this with the early adopters and
quite a few web sites and email forums are already saying that file type
actually means HSQL as people are wondering where the HSQLDB is.

short_description: build break in basctl/source/basicide/moduldl2.cxx
long_description:

for basctl (http://tools.openoffice.org/modules.html lists unknown)

When compiling m72 with older compiler (in this case gcc 3.2) the build will
break in basctl with following error:
/home/cl/programming/shadow/basctl/source/basicide/moduldl2.cxx:838: no matching
function for call to
`com::sun::star::ui::dialogs::XFilterManager::appendFilter(rtl::OUString (&)()
rtl::OUString&)'
(full listing see attachment)

The error is the same cause as issue 38506 and issue 38504

short_description: bump configure unxlngi to be unxlngi6
long_description:
To sync with the Hamburg environment and to pick up with linking with CXX and
optimizing with -Os I propose the following patches to make config_office use
unxlngi6.mk. It also reflects in the extra -W for CFLAGSWALL which are in
unxlngi4.mk and not unxlngi6.mk which may or may not be desirable.

short_description: Implement private:factory/sdatabase?Interactive
long_description:
The URL private:factory/sdatabase?Interactive is a substitute from sservice:...
URL which has to be removed out of the ooO.Common.xcu. 

How to verify:

Press the New Toolbar for the database. -> The icon changes if this bug is
fixed. :-)
Open the templates and documents dialog and select New document and there the
New Database entry. Switch between preview and info. -> Nothing should happen.
In prior versions this starts the wizard.

short_description: Configuration logging: spurious warning for localizations
long_description:
By design the localized data layer (share/registry/res//..) contains
localizations even for components that are not installed.

Such items trigger a warning: {configmgr::LayerMergeHandler.overrideNode()}:
[800] Node ... to be overridden does not exist - skipping in the configuration log.

A warning (at a rather high LogLevel) is not appropriate for such an
occurence.Even for normal nodes this should probably be demoted to a lower level
(e.g. FINE) for localized nodes this should be even lower (or completely
suppressed).

short_description: Need help index entry Data Validation -> Form Functions ->
long_description:

Can we add a help index entry for this?

This could also be added to our Comparison of MSO Terms table.

Excel Data Validation is described at http://www.contextures.com/xlDataVal01.html

short_description: install program /requires/ that executables can be run from /tmp
long_description:
my system ( and many more secure Linux systems ) mount /tmp with
nosuidnoexecnodev. . .
so the installation program simply doesn't work with no indication that this is /why/ it
doesn't work ( but I've come across this kind of thing before. . . so . . . )

This pertains to the 641D stable release ( and probably all previous ones too )


Suggested ( temporary ) fix: please include this following text in the README file

LINUX:
To run the setup install-script it is necessary that the _/tmp_ directory be 
writeable sufficiently large and it is necessary that it be possible to run programs 
from this location.
  If /etc/fstab's line for /tmp contains noexec then you root will have to
remount -o remountexec /dev/hdXY  
( where X is the drive and Y is the partition or if it is a 
SCSI-based machine then it would be /dev/sdXY )
before the install-script can run.

If this is done then remember to remount to return /tmp to noexec status as soon as 
it is done eh?

short_description: Palettes should float outside windows & be dockable

No idea if this is against the UI guidelines but a common practice with 
floating pallettes is to:

1) Allow them outside of the bounds of their owner window
2) Hide them when the applications is not in the foreground.

I would very much prefer this interface for the navigator and styles pallettes.

It would also be nice if they could be docked with parent windows.

short_description: Cannot close Fax/Letterwizard using system-close-button
long_description:
Reproduction:
1. Open Office
2. Start Faxwizard
3. click close button (frame control)
-> The wizard does not cancel.

Please ensure that cancel and system-close have identical funtionality both
must cancel the wizard.

Tested on Linux other platforms are most likely affected as well.

short_description: Incorrect RTF encoding
long_description:
On systems with EUC-jp as a default encoding for Japanese language like linux 
generated RTF is encoded in EUC-jp while RTF standard encoding for Japanese ( 
charset #128 ) is MS-shiftjis.

It will occur on systems with a default encodiing other tham Microsoft 
standard encoding for the language.

We have to encode RTF with Microsoft standard encoding and I will post a patch 
and RTF samples created by MS word as references.

unxlngppc.pro/misc/filters. This time a new build was successfull.

And because I have not found where the directory wasn't created I just propose
the following workaround :


1)  create unxlngppc.pro/misc/filters directory
2) copy all .xcu found inside filter/source/fragments/filters
3)  build and deliver in filter do it

my humble opinion.

short_description: getText().getString() can crash OOo if there are no paragraphs
long_description:
The following behavior was tested using 1.1.3 1.1.4 and the development build 74.

If a text object contains    then all of the
text is returned using ThisComponent.getText().getString().

If a text object contains   then only the text in the
paragraph is returned using ThisComponent.getText().getString().

If a text object contains  Then OpenOffice.org CRASHES if you call
ThisComponent.getText().getString().

I first saw this behavior for a text Header and/or Footer that ONLY contained a
text object. You are not likely to find a document that ONLY contains a text
table. More likely in a header or footer. Luckily when the error occurs for a
header or footer it only stops the macro and does not crash OOo.

for a text document however OOo crashes.

Create a text document and then delete all of the paragraphs. You can use a
macro such as the following if you desire (after creating a text table).

Sub DoIt
  MsgBox ThisComponent.getText().getString()
  DeletePars(ThisComponent.getText())
  MsgBox ThisComponent.getText().getString()
End Sub

Sub DeletePars(oText)
  Dim oParEnum 'Paragraph enumerator
  Dim oPar 'Current paragraph
  oParEnum = oText.createEnumeration()
  Do While oParEnum.hasMoreElements()
    oPar = oParEnum.nextElement()
    If oPar.supportsService(com.sun.star.text.Paragraph) Then
      oText.removeTextContent(oPar)
    End If
  Loop
End Sub

This macro will be included in the document that I attach.

I expected getString() to work even if the first thing found is a table. I never
expect OOo to crash from this.

short_description: floating toolboxes are moving with each new document (in maximized windows)
long_description:
- open a new text document
- open another new text document
- maximize both windows
- close one of both documents
  (this is just to ensure that the maximized state is remembered so that newly
  opened text documents are maximized too)
- View|Toolbars|Tools
=> the Tools toolbar opens floating
- open a new text document
=> the new text document opens maximized with a floating Tools toolbar
=> the toolbar moved (about) 10 pixels in each direction (to the right and down)
   from where the toolbar in the first document was

Those 10 pixels may not sound too much but after quite some work with OOo this
means that the toolbars are vanishing off the screen (which should be fixed with
issue 40008) at at least that the user has to permanently adjust the toolbar
position which renders our remember the toolbar layout-feature somewhat useless.
That's why I took the freedom to target this issue to 2.0 but feel free to
correct this :)

This does happen on Windows only not on Linux (at least not with my run a
Linux version on a Solaris-Sparc-Gnome display scenario).

short_description: [A11y] Initial Registration Dialog can't be spoken with Gnopernicus
long_description:
With a new installation of Solaris 10 (on x86/x64 if that matters):
1. Set up a new user for accessibility; configure your JVM to support accessibility
2. Launch Gnopernicus
3. Launch StarOffice (for the first time)
4. Go through the installer
5. Tab through the initial create something dialog a few times eventually
choosing to open a new text document
6. Get a new text document window and the registration window (and the
Paragraph Styles Windows)
7. While Gnopernicus is still speaking all of the Create Window events start
pressing tab to go through the Registration dialog controls.
8. Note that you get no speech from these Tabbings.  Wait for the Create
Window speech to stop and then press Tab some more.  Still no speech.  [BUG]
9. Alt-Tab away see that you have speech.  Alt-Tab back to the Registration
dialog then Tab some more through it.  Still no speech. [same BUG]
10. Get rid of this dialog and get a rather strange/surprising dialog telling
you something you foolishly forgot to write down about and error but not having
web access or something...

short_description: Interoperatability with Thai MS Excel 97 : BAHTTEXT() and t number format prefix
long_description:
Thai version of MS Excel 97 has two custom extensions that will introduce
incompatability when converting the Excel document to OOo Calc if not handled
appropriately.

1) The BAHTTEXT() function only available on Thai Excel 97. It is used to
spellout Thai currency e.g. ฿210.50 becomes two hundred and ten bath fifty satang.

2) The 't' number format prefix. It is used in Thai Excel 97 to make a number
displayed using Thai digit the same way OOo uses '[natnum1]'. For example Thai
Excel 97 number format 't0' is the same as OOo '[natnum1]0' and will make 210
displayed as ๒๑๐.

The OOo Excel filter should be able to support the use of these extensions to
import/export the documents (that use the features) correctly. The 't' number
prefix should be easy to convert (to [natnum1]). But the BAHTTEXT() function
requires the same function or alike to be implemented in OOo.

short_description: tdoc ucp should use new model collection instead of traveling top level frames
long_description:
Currently there is a gap between creation of the tdoc ucp and creation of the first 
office document. That's why the tdoc ucp travles over all top level frames to know all 
still open documents and listen afterwards on the GlobalEventBroadcaster service 
to be informed if further documents will be opened.

From now the GlobalEventBroadcaster service provides a new interface css::
container::XSet. It makes it possible to get access to an enumeration of all 
currently open office documents which allows to be useable by everyone.

yet shown the window should have a (guessed) fullscreen size.
On GTK-based systemms GtkSalFrame::calcDefaultSize() sets a size of 920x875 for
a resolution of 1280x1024. At least here the desktop size seems to be guessed
quite well.

short_description: FreeBSD porting : support JDK 1.3.1-pX ; pXX should understand as m_nUpdateSpecial
long_description:
Since minVersion in  javavendors_unx.xml is 1.3.1
   1.3.1
javaldx for FreeBSD with JDK 1.3.1 fails like:

% javaldx
[Java framework] Using configuration file
file:///work/ports/editors/openoffice-2.0-devel.jdk13/work/solver/680/unxfbsd.pro/lib/jvmfwk3rc
[Java framework] Using bootstrap parameter UNO_JAVA_JFW_ENV_JREHOME with
JAVA_HOME = /usr/local/jdk1.3.1.
[Java framework] Using bootstrap parameter UNO_JAVA_JFW_VENDOR_SETTINGS =
file:///work/ports/editors/openoffice-2.0-devel.jdk13/work/solver/680/unxfbsd.pro/lib/javavendors.xml.
[Java framework] sunjavaplugin: Using configuration file
file:///work/ports/editors/openoffice-2.0-devel.jdk13/work/solver/680/unxfbsd.pro/lib/sunjavapluginrc
[Java framework] Executing: file:///usr/local/jdk1.3.1/bin/.java_wrapper.
[Java framework] Java executed successfully.
[Java framework]  Java wrote to stderr: .java_wrapper was not found in
/usr/local/jdk1.3.1/bin/i386/green_threads/.java_wrapper
 .

[Java framework] Executing: file:///usr/local/jdk1.3.1/bin/java.
[Java framework] Java executed successfully.
[Java framework]  Java wrote to stderr:  .
[Java framework] sunjavaplugin.so: Detected another JRE: file:///usr/local/jdk1.3.1
 at: file:///usr/local/jdk1.3.1.
[Java framework] The JRE specified by the bootstrap variable
UNO_JAVA_JFW_JREHOME  or  UNO_JAVA_JFW_ENV_JREHOME  could not be recognized.
Check the values and make sure that you use a plug-in library that can recognize
that JRE.Assertion Failed: File
/work/ports/editors/openoffice-2.0-devel.jdk13/work/jvmfwk/source/framework.cxx
Line 781: [Java framework] The JRE specified by the bootstrap variable
UNO_JAVA_JFW_JREHOME  or  UNO_JAVA_JFW_ENV_JREHOME  could not be recognized.
Check the values and make sure that you use a plug-in library that can recognize
that JRE.
javaldx failed!

since
/usr/local/jdk1.3.1/bin/java -version
java version 1.3.1-p9
and 1.3.1-p9 is smaller than 1.3.1
so
int SunInfo::compareVersions(const rtl::OUString& sSecond) const at sunjre.cxx
evaluates as 1.3.1-p9 < 1.3.1 so JDK is detected as prior to 1.3.1.

Since for FreeBSD -p9 should understand as m_nUpdateSpecial
like 1.3.1_09.

short_description: CTRL should suppress toolbar docking (like MS Office and other Windows programs)
long_description:
In OOo it's impossible to place toolbars as floating windows nearby other toolbars.




In Programs that use MS API (I think MS API is the reason I'm not a
programmer) for example MS Office and many other programs this problem is
solved in the following way:

While moving toolbars holding down CTRL suppresses docking of toolbars. This is
visualized by hiding the docking frame that shows where the toolbar will be
docked to after releasing the mouse button.




This should also be added for OOo. I call this a bug of OOo since it's
impossible to place toolbars as floating windows everywhere.

short_description: Support for Thai numbering types
long_description:
Thai usually use two additional types of numbering other than those provided by
OOo. One is using Thai native numbers (๑. ๒. ๓. ๔. ๕.) and another is using Thai
letters (ก. ข. ค. ง. จ.). However these numbering types are not shown in
Format->Bullets and Numbering->Numbering type. You have to manually specify it
in Format->Bullets and Numbering->Options->Numbering. The Thai locale data file
should be updated to add commonly-used Thai numbering types.

However more than 8 numbering types will be needed which is impossible now -
see issue 42965. And three letters must be deleted from the Thai-letter
numbering sequence - see issue 43045.

short_description: Crash on calling Special Character from the UI context menu

2.Click Tools  Bibliographic Database
3.Right click the ISBN Field 
4.Select Special Character from the right-click menu

Type drag down box.  It crashes both for the right click menu and the hot-key 
(Ctrl Shift S).  It crashes from the columns in the table and the input fields 
below.  

I  tested it with version 1.1.2 and the character map opens fine but it 
doesn't appear to be the whole set of characters I usually have.   With 1.1.3

it acts the same as 1.1.2.

I don't see how any of these fields would require a special character except 
perhaps the user-defined fields.

short_description: Broken Menu Item (Bibliographic DatabaseEditCut)

Steps to reproduce the bug:

1.	Open a new document in Open Office writer.
2.	To open the bibliography Database go to Tools>Bibliography Database.
3.	Create a new record with values for all the fields in the form.
4.	Select entry in the Author(s) field in the form.

does not happen. Cut menu item seems to be broken. If we use shortcut key Ctrl-
X cutting operation is working.

short_description: Problem creating unique index/primary key manually
long_description:
Within OOo 2.0 beta (build 1.9.79):

1. Create a new table (e.g. Design view).
2. Close/save the table *refusing* the offer to create a primary key.
   At this point records cannot be entered (no primary key).
3. Edit the table design again; choose Index Design.

PROBLEM:
Even if you tick the Unique field for a new or pre-existing index in the Index
Design dialogue box this change to the uniqueness doesn't appear to be saved
(even though the program asks Do you want to save changes made to the current
index?). Consequently you can't create a primary key or enter records.

SUB-PROBLEM perhaps:
When an index is created in the Index Design table view it has the default name
of Index1. It seems impossible to create an index actually called Index1 -
the following SQL error is generated:
  SQL Status: S0011
  Error code: -23
  Index already exists in statement [CREATE INDEX index1 ON Table3]

My guess is that the dialogue box creates the index (defaulting to the name
Index1) for the user to fill in values (e.g. which fields are being indexed)
saves this index called Index1 in the database before the user has chosen the
fields to index and then forgets that it's done so so when it tries to resave
the user's changes the database complains.

short_description: Unsetting Data Validity Input Help clears contents
long_description:
This issue may be related to (closed) Issue 43756.

The problem is that when a cell that doesn't require input validity checking is
included in a selection where the other cells do require checking changing the
Display Input Help setting resets the validity tests.  This misbehavior is
also exhibited when selecting/deselecting the Show error message... box under
Error Alerts.

The expected behavior is that the displays will be affected only in the range
where the settings are in effect and that the data validity tests will remain
unchanged.

The cell addresses used here are to simplify explanation only.

Easy to replicate.

1.  In a new sheet populate a range of cells with some values; for example
A1:A10 with values 1-10.
2.  Set up a cell for data input from the above range e.g. B1;
(Data>Validity>>criteria>Cell Range.  Use absolute addresses ($col$row) to
define the range.
3.  Enter a value for Input Help (only needs the title) ensure there is a check
in the Show Input Help ... box and close the Data Validity window.
4.  Copy this cell (B1) into a range of cells (e.g. B2:B10) using Paste Special
(Uncheck Paste All). In B11 enter any value or formula e.g. =sum(B1:B10).
5.  Observe that each cell in the range B1:B10 displays the Input Help when
hovered over.
6.  Select a range that includes one or more of the cells in the range B1:B10
prepared in Step 4 AND which includes at least one cell outside the range.  For
example if the range in step 4 is B1:B:10 select B6:B11.  Observe that when
B11 is included the combo dropdown list arrows adjacent to B6:B10 hide.
7.  Select Menu>Data>Validity>Input Help.  The check box Show Input Help... is
unchecked. Select then Deselect the Show input help... check box.
8.  Select any cell in the range B6:B10.  Notice that there is no selection
arrow (combo box drop down).
9.  Select Menu>Data>Validity and observe that all values have been reset and
when Cell Range is selected that the range box is cleared.

short_description: Replace empty windows when opening documents

Start an OpenOffice application such as Write and then use the menu or toolbar
to open an existing file. The file opens a new Write window leaving the initial
empty Write window on my desktop. The following behavior would be preferable:

Start an OpenOffice application such as Write and then open an existing file.
If the initial window is empty the file should open in the original window
rather then creating a new one. A new window should only be created if the
original window has content.

This should work across applications. If I have an empty Write window and I open
an Impress document from the menu the empty Write window should be replaced
with the Impress window and document.

BTW I'm using the OpenOffice 641 RPM from the Mandrake 8.2 distribution.

short_description: libsts is not PIC
long_description:
The link options for libsts specify:

.IF $(GUI) == UNX
SHL1STDLIBS+= -lapp
.ENDIF

Unfortunately -lapp means libapp.a which is built from the basic module
and is compiled from OBJFILES not SLOFILES.  That means that on x86 it is not
able to be PIC (since OBJFILES aren't compiled with -fpic on x86 for some good
reasons).  This is a Bad Thing (TM).

Either the dependency on libapp.a should be removed or libapp.a should be
available in .so format as well.

short_description: Pasting short text doesn't erase display of longer text
long_description:
Working in a Writer document I paste a short string over a longer string.  The
short string is replaced however the remnant of longer text is still visible;
i.e. the document display does not refresh properly.

Minimizing the Writer window and restoring it will make the display render properly.

Note that this only presents when you paste the short string in the middle of
the longer string.  The behavior is correct if you replace the entire line.

To reproduce:

Open a new Writer document.

Type a long phrase on a single line.

Type a shorter phrase or single word on a separate line.

Copy the short phrase/word to the keyboard.

Select text on the long phrase beginning at some location to the right of the
beginning of the line.  Hit Ctrl-V or Edit Paste to replace the selected text
with the clipboard contents.

Observed behavior:  The selected text is replaced but the display artifact of
the original text still remains after the paste occurs.  

Minimize the window and restore it and the 'extra' text will be gone.

short_description: Title bar of Writer/Web just shows Openoffice.org Writer/Web missing the filename or title
long_description:
If I load a .sxw or .odt document in Openoffice 2.0 BETA the filename of the
document or (if present) the title of the file properties is shown in the title
bar of the window.
But if I load a html-file the title bar just reads Openoffice.org Writer/Web.
The same can be found in the Windows menu.
This makes it hard to find one of several documents opened at the same time.

If I enter the File/Properties dialog and edit the title there the title bar is
updated to reflect the new name. If I delete the title there completely the
filename is shown instead. (Both in additon to Openoffice.org Writer/Web)
However if I save this file and reopen it the title again just reads
Openoffice.org Writer/Web.

short_description: Work Processor crashes consistently with my document
long_description:
I have a document that consistently causes the word processor to crash.  The 
document is a 590K Word file.  It is a manuscript for a book and has a huge 
number of footnotes.  

Under Windows 98 the word processor crashes during import.  Under Windows 
2000 I can import and repaginate the document but it crashes if I click on 
View Online Layout and then attempt to go to the bottom of the document.

I believe the problem is related to the large number of footnotes.  The author 
experiences many crashes while editing his manuscripts in MS Word.

I can't post this manuscript publicly but would rather make it available to 
the person working on the problem.  Please contact me directly at 
igor_birman@yahoo.com and I can make the document available.

Thanks!
Igor Birman
igor_birman@yahoo.com
