short_description: bad gcc version checking in getcompver.awk
long_description:
getcompver.awk is not able to deal with suffixes to the gcc-version. For example
a version like gcc-3.4.3.20050110 (which we use in Gentoo) causes the build to
break:

 * Building OpenOffice.org...
build -- version: 1.86.18.2
Checking dmake...

=============
Building project helpcontent
=============
/var/tmp/portage/openoffice-ximian-1.3.8/work/helpcontent/unx/schart
mkout -- version: 1.3
------------------------------
Making: ../../unxlngi4.pro/misc/uschart.dpz
echo # > ../../unxlngi4.pro/misc/uschart.schart.schart01.dpzz
cd   . ; zipdep.pl -u -prefix   ./ ../../unxlngi4.pro/bin/schart01.zip
english_us/schart.* -x *CVS* >>
/var/tmp/portage/openoffice-ximian-1.3.8/work/helpcontent/unx/schart/../../unxlngi4.pro/misc/uschart.schart.schart01.dpzz
zipdep -- version: 1.12
Multi Platform Enabled Edition
++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++
ERROR!
Could not detect compiler version!
Please extend tg_compv.mk in
solenv/inc.
++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++
g++ -dumpversion returns
3.4.3-20050110
++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++
dmake:  Error code 255 while making 'compiler_version_error'
---* TG_SLO.MK *---

Patch to solve this problem follows

short_description: misleading language about delete documents in deinstall
long_description:
Deinstallation does not delete any OpenOffice.org 1.0 configuration files or
documents created by the user. You can now determine if these files are also to
be deleted by deinstallation.

can imply that the deinstaller is going to hunt around the user's drives and
delete documents created using OpenOffice. I've seen people worried by this
dialog. what is really meant is files saved (mistakenly) to the OpenOffice
program directory can also be removed.

likewise configuration files could be saved anywhere and presumably they could
survive a deinstall but this dialog implies otherwise

also why not call a person 'you' rather than 'the user'? 'the user' makes sense
in some situations but in this one you have a chance to be clearer by being more
personal

the dialog would be more informative if it read:
Deinstallation does not delete any OpenOffice.org 1.0 configuration files or
documents created by you and saved in the OpenOffice.org application directory.
However you can choose to allow these files to also be deleted by deinstallation.

[] Delete all files from the OpenOffice.org application directory

'irretrievably removed' better matches the language used in OpenOffice's help
rather than 'deleted':
Deinstallation does not remove any OpenOffice.org 1.0 configuration files or
documents created by you and saved in the OpenOffice.org application directory.
However you can choose to allow these files to also be irretrievable removed by
deinstallation.

and this could be further improved by instructing people that removing config
files will prevent them from being used by future installations of OpenOffice:
Deinstallation does not remove any OpenOffice.org 1.0 configuration files or
documents created by you and saved in the OpenOffice.org application directory.
You can choose to allow these files to also be irretrievable removed by
deinstallation but this will prevent you from re-installing OpenOffice.org in
the future and migrating your old confiiguration to the new installation

short_description: C++ UNO Bridges: Use executable memory for generated proxy code
long_description:
In bridges::cpp_uno::shared::VtableFactory::createBlock/flushCode use
executable memory for the code snippets (and thus for the vtables also although
this would not be necessary) and then generally use non-executable memory for
the heap.  (See for example flushCode for msvc_win32_intel.)  Some new function
like rtl_allocateMemory(size alloc_flags) is necessary in sal.

short_description: Help is not readable
long_description:
Installed 1.0 on RedHat 7.2 with KDE 2.2.

Open help using the help menu. I cannot read it. Most help items in the hel
ptext box don't have any text at all. Many have a heading but there is a
horizontal bar  in dark blue from the font foot to halfway up the font the font
itself seems rendered in light gray.

Some boxes have some graphics of a drawing pin or light bulb but no text. One
or two topics have some text but it scrolls off the right hand side of the page.

I'll try and attach a PNG screen dump.

Cheers
James

short_description: slide sorter: all slides in the upper left corner
long_description:
Was ok in 2.0 Beta
occures on Windows and Sols. I can't reproduce it on Linux.
- start an Impress
- insert some slides more then space in the slide sorter
- change to the Handout view
- change back to the slide sorter view
- all slides are in the upper left corner.
- If you drag one slide to another position all slides are visible again but the
space between the slides is too smal.

short_description: Direction of selection of text for custom animations has effect on result
long_description:
Follow up of i47031. The direction in which you make the selection differs the
result:
from front: everything is fine.
from back: only the second line gets the animation.

short_description: table copy wizard: when copying records fails there is only a message for the first error
long_description:
The error reporting in the table copy wizard is still not very good since it
leaves the user without a clue what actually went wrong.

To see this follow the steps described in issue 47315 to copy a table where
the copy process yields an error.

First problem is that the error message is not really helpful to the user.
Except the fact that there was *some* error it doesn't tell the user anything -
not at which record the error occured not what was the underlying driver error
(which could be helpful for diagnostics).

Second problem is that the error message is shown only once while a later
examination of the copied table shows that in fact two records were not copied.
This is not told to the user in any way so s/he has no chance noting this
except counting records after copying.

short_description: EXCHANGE DATABASE does not exchange data base entries in the condition for hidden text/paragraphs
long_description:
I'm working with Suse Linux 7.3 on Intel PC and OpenOffice.org1.0.
If you exchange the database with edit-exchange database- then the data base
entries in the conditions for hidden text or hidden paragraphs are not
exchanged. 
StarWriter 5.2 did exchnage those entries too.

long_description:

short_description: export to PDF with lossless compression inverts color of png with 1-bit colormap
long_description:
I have a file with multiple figures in jpg and png formats. When I export the
document to a pdf file with lossless compression option selected one of my
monochrome images is not exported properly (the pdf file has the negative of the
image). If I export the file with 100% jpg quality this does not happen. The
original file was in png format.
I will supply the original and exported files too.

Good luck.
BB

short_description: Version 2.0 Product Specification
long_description:
The two most commonly used marketing publications are the Product Flyer and the
Product Specification.

The Product Flyer is a sheet of A3 printed double sided landscape and folded
down the middle. That gives a 4 page A4 sized booklet. The Flyer is a selling
tool lots of pictures features and benefits brand values.

The Product Specification is a sheet of A4 printed double sided portrait. The
Spec lists in some detail what OpenOffice.org actually is and what's new in
2.0. The Spec can either be used by itself or as an insert within the Flyer.

This task has been created to hold work in progress copies of the Product
Specification for Version 2.0

short_description: Masterdocument component broken
long_description:
Since version m91 and up to m93 the masterdocument is totally broken. Opening
an existing masterdocument (.odm) is not possible the file is not recognised
(dialog to assign the file-type appears). Creating a new empty one works and can
be opened but when inserting a file (.odt) this is not viewable at all except
in the navigator. Opening an old masterdocument (.sxg) works but the
subdocuments doesn't appear on the screen except for the navigator. Updating
all links doesn't work. So the screen remains empty.

I use the localised nl version since m80.

short_description: GSI file for en-GB localised version
long_description:

latest milestone (m93 as of writing) can be obtained here:
http://en-gb.pyxidium.co.uk:32080/OOo/resources/GSI_en-GB.sdf.gz

It has been verified and checked in a test builds under windows and linux and
also contains all the help content string translations too.

The GSI will be kept up-to-date as new milestones become available.

We look forward to en-GB being released at the earliest possible opportunity.

Thanks
David.
(en-GB translation team)

short_description: ja UI: some UI of Calc are incompatible with 1.1 or confusing
long_description:
1. Format Toolbar 
Text direction from left to right  (239704) / Text direction from top to bottom
(239705)
 テキストの向きは左から右へ -> テキストの向き : 左から右へ
テキストの向きは上から下へ -> テキストの向き : 上から下へ

2. Format -> Cell -> Alignment
Degree (221463) 度 -> 角度
Vertically stacked (339589) 垂直方向にスタック -> 縦書き
Asian layout mode (221465) アジア言語レイアウトモード -> 日本語縦書きレイアウト
モード
Property(221471) プロパティ -> 体裁
Hyphnetion active (221473) ハイフネーションが有効 -> ハイフネーションを行う
Shrink to fit cell size (339590) セルサイズに合うように縮小 -> セルサイズに合わ
せて縮小

3. Format -> Page -> Sheet
Scale (211644) 倍率  -> 拡大縮小

short_description: Incorrect display of currency name in English UI with Khmer locale

When using OOo 680_m84 and earlier versions with the UI in English and the
locale is changed to Khmer the currency dialog box shows the word RIE (code for
Khmer and then a mix of white squares and unreadable text as in:

http://www.khmeros.info/ooo/issues/wrongriel.jpg

When the UI is changed to Khmer the correct font is used for the display as in:

http://www.khmeros.info/ooo/issues/rigthriel.jpg

The translated legend displays de RIEL sign (one character that looks like a d
with a horizontal short line in the middle) and the the legend khmer language


When using the UI in English a similar problem appears in month and weekday
lists in Calc as in:

http://www.khmeros.info/ooo/issues/CalSortList.jpg

short_description: Cannot remove last version in versions dialog
long_description:
In 1.9.90.1cs (as well as older version) I get a weird behavior on attempt to
remove the last item in versions dialog:

 - if there has been only one version it remains there and with every attempt
to remove it window title is extended by the titles original value (repeats itself).
 - if there have been more version all the previously deleted ones reappear.

The only way to get rid of all version from a file seems to be using Save
As... and saving under another filename.

This bug(?) actually doesn't seem to be only word processor specific.

With the package size and all conversion work RPM format means to me I was not
able to test and confirm this on many version different languages. Someone else
may might be able to.

short_description: OpenOffice_org-nl 1.1.3-16.1 description says 'German' should be Dutch
long_description:
hi

if you install the OpenOffice_org-nl 1.1.3-16.1 localisation via Yast in Suse
9.2 you get the following description:

OpenOffice_org-nl - Dutch localization files for OpenOffice.org
The German localization files for OpenOffice.org.

This is wrong because Germany is a different country than the Netherlands.
In Germany they speak german in the Netherlands they speak dutch.
the second line should be either :

The Dutch localization files for OpenOffice.org.

or

The localization files for the Netherlands for OpenOffice.org.

It's a small but to the dutch *very* unpleasant mistake.
(They HATE being called germans if you meet a nasty Dutch person you should try
it sometime :-) )
(Sort of saying you Americans to an Englishman)
It also creates doubt about the quality of the package...

Baziel

short_description: Thai sequence input checking should be enabled by default
long_description:
Thai sequence input checking works great but at the moment users have to go
into Language Settings|Complex Text Layout and turn on both Sequence checking
and Restricted to make it active.  Most Thai users won't realize they need to
do this. Sequence checking is an absolutely basic feature that Thai users expect
normally to be active.  Word enables it by default.  Nokia phones have it always
turned on (for writing SMSs) and don't even allow you to turn it off.

long_description:

anice convenience to be able to save to one (maybe more) Wiki format - e.g. the
format used by Wikipedia or Twiki.  It would be a great way to get lots of
information currently locked up in Word files into a really open and
collaborative format.

Should be quite simple too - easier than HTML export I reckon.

luke

short_description: Corrected localedata for zh_CN
long_description:
As required by LOCALE DATA(URL given) I've revised the locale data as a native 
Chinese speaker. Here is what I want to tell you.

N1360: You are right. Please align to CLDR.
N1361: You are right. China takes Monday as the first day of a week. If 
possible please correct CLDR. Thanks.
N1362: None of them are right. In fact Chinese rarely assign numbers to the 
weeks. But you can just take it as 4 days which is the most newspapers are 
following.
N1363: Both of them are correct. While the former is the abbr form the latter 
is the regular form. For a better understanding I would suggest that you align 
to CLDR.
N1364: We are using both of the two punctions. If we are listing the words or 
phrases we will use the one OOo assumes. But if we are listing several 
sentences the one from CLDR would be fine.

short_description: openoffice-core left after upgrading to version with openofficeorg-core01 package
long_description:
I was running (IIRC) m74 which shipped with an openofficeorg-core package.

Upon upgrading to m95 I ran out of disk space. After freeing up enough space
for  installation I discovered the m74 package of openofficeorg-core was still
insalled.

IMHO openofficeorg-core01 should either obsolete openofficeorg-core (which will
result in automatic removal of openofficeorg-core on installation of
openofficeorg-core01) or (if parallel installations of different versions
should be possible required) there should be a psuedo (ie containing no files)
package openofficeorg-core which requires the other openofficeorg-core* packages.

(this was item 3 from issue 48783)

short_description: method  creates invalid undo action
long_description:
The method  creates the invalid undo action 'Insert:
frame|draw object' if the page style contains a page header/footer which
contains a floating screen object (frame graphic drawing object or OLE object).
This causes a crash or an inconsistent document if such an invalid undo action
is performed followed by other correct undo actions.
E.g.: 
(1) open document  attached to issue 46941 and change the margin
of the page -> Undo stack contains undo action 'Insert draw object'.
(2) copy a page style of above given type from a document A to a document B
after you had inserted and deleted some paragraphs in document B -> Undo stack
contains undo action 'Insert draw object' --> trying to undo all actions causes
the Writer to crash

long_description: add OpenOffice1 and OpenOffice2 alias to CVSROOT/modules

short_description: configuration data inconsistency due to updated xcs file
long_description:
If an xcs file gets extended (this is a compatible change) in a new milestone
and the userdata from a previous milestone will not be removed before using the
new milestone office configuration cache will become inconsitent. The ccahe
still contains the data for the old milestone and config manager does not detect
this inconstency.

This scenario might for instance happen in case a final office will be updated
to a new official minor version (product update).

Config manager must detect changed xcs files and react accordingly (invalidate
the cache).

short_description: Unconfirmed issues are not shown in my issues
long_description:
With the issues #4105 and #2778 the default status of a submitted issue was
changed to unconfirmed which is what we intended. Unfortunately now there's
the problem that unconfirmed issues do not show up in the default owner's My
Issues which requires querying such issues. This is pretty inconvenient. As
My Issues is only a query anyways it should be easy to make this query
include unconfirmed issues too.

short_description: Count Blank Lines in line numbering options behaves unreliably
long_description:
Steps to reproduce:

1. Create an empty document
2. Type this example text:
A
b

c
d

e
f
3. Choose Tools/Line numbering from menu check Show numbering set
Interval to 1 check Count/Blank lines and press OK. This will result in
lines numbered from 1 to 8 (the line with f is numbered 8)
4. Choose Tools/Line numbering from menu uncheck Count/Blank lines and
press OK. Now the empty paragraphs don't have numbers next to them but the
numbering is still from 1 to 8.
5. Go to the first empty line (the one after b) type any character and use
Edit/Undo or Backspace to delete that character.

Now the numbering ends at 7 and the next line is numbered 3 despite the fact
it was numbered 4 before the insert char/delete char or insert char/undo
sequence. This looks like a bug.

6. Choose Tools/Line numbering from menu turn counting empty lines on. Now
the empty line 3 and the following one (the one with character c) are numbered
3. This looks like a bug too

Conclusion - disabling Count/Blank lines doesn't update the line numbers.
Reenabling Count/Blank lines doesn't update the line numbers. The only way to
update the line numbers is to insert/delete a character in each empty paragraph.

I think it could be easy to overlook because it's only obvious when numbering
interval is set to 1.

short_description: Installationshandbuch für OOo 2.0
long_description:
Das Installationshandbuch muß vom Projekt selbst erstellt werden.  
  
Hinweise auf Mailinglisten (Hintergrundinformationen):  
http://documentation.openoffice.org/servlets/ReadMsg?list=dev&msgNo=1942  
(Langer Thread)  
http://de.openoffice.org/servlets/ReadMsg?list=dev&msgNo=16669  
(Thematisierung des Installationshandbuchs)  
  
  
Weitere Dokumente zum gleichen Thema:  
http://documentation.openoffice.org/setup_guide2/2.x/en/SETUP_GUIDE_draft.odt  
(Ideen zum neuen Handbuch)  
http://www.openoffice.org/issues/show_bug.cgi?id=17534  
(Unser Issue zum Handbuch Version 1.1*)  
http://www.openoffice.org/issues/show_bug.cgi?id=37513  
(Der Issue des internationalen Doc-Projekts zur Erstellung eines  
Installationshandbuchs) 
http://www.openoffice.org/issues/show_bug.cgi?id=49029 
(ReadMe zur OOo 2.0; hilft vielleicht auch noch bei Details und gibt Hinweise 
auf eventuelle Probleme)  
  
  
Notwendig sind Anleitungen für die verschiedenen Betriebssystemplattformen:  
-- Linux (rpm/deb-Distributionen)  
-- MacOSX  
-- Windows  
-- Solaris  
-- weitere?  
  
Vorwegnahme von Installationsproblemen und Spezialfälle  
(Mount von Installationspartitionen über nfs und ähnlich Gemeines)  
  
Die Arbeit an dem Handbuch läuft über OOo-Authors (http://oooauthors.org/de/)  
womit sie leider nicht durch das IZ-System erfasst wird und leicht aus dem  
Bewusstsein aller verschwindet.  
  
Das ist der Grund für die Erstellung dieses Issues.  
  
Bitte wichtige Milestones der Arbeit hierüber koordinieren und Dokumente immer  
dann hier hochladen wenn sie zwischengelesen werden sollten und  
dokumentieren wie weit die einzelnen Teile gediehen sind.  
  
Gegebenenfalls reichen auch Links zu den Arbeitsverzeichnissen nach  
OOo-Authors.  
  
Es muß nicht jeder Schritt dokumentiert werden; das ist arbeitsaufwändig und  
bringt nicht viel.

short_description: Unopkg fails to install shared components after clean installation
long_description:
After performing a fresh install of ooo680m100 (as Administrator for all
Users) unopkg fails with the following exception until ooo is _used_ the first
time by Administrator. Apparently the component registry gets initialized
during the first _use_. Since the Administrator account often is used _only_ for
installation (never actually using ooo as Administrator) this initialization
should be performed from within the installer in order to be able to install
additional _shared_ components after ooo-install.

How to reproduce:

1. Fresh install as Administrator for all Users
2. Do _not_ run ooo as Administrator
3. Try to install an additional shared comp. or simply try to list them:

cd C:\Program Files\OpenOffice.org 1.9.100\program
unopkg list --shared

Result:

unopkg prints the following:

ERROR: (com.sun.star.uno.RuntimeException) { { Message = No valid file URL in b
ootstrap.ini: file:///C:/Documents%20and%20Settings/Administrator/Application%20
Data/OpenOffice.org1.9.100 Context = (com.sun.star.uno.XInterface) 0x0 } }

unopkg failed.

After _running_ ooo as Administrator it correctly prints  in the above
case.

short_description: testtool assertion logs are unreadable and eye-hurting
long_description:
Reading the assertion logs of the testtool is something my optician would
definately prohibit. Yellow background with green filled circles and black text
color - sorry but we can't be serious about this can we? It *hurts* when
looking at more than one such line and is heavily and unnecessarily unreadable.

For instance if the tool shows the backtrace of an assertion this is easily 20
lines or so. Finding the relevant information in the large yellow-green mess is
really difficult and surely not what they mean with workplace ergonomics.

Please find another more healthy background. If the intention is to have
something which springs to the reader's attention then there must be more
choices than yellow!

trivial I suggest fixing this in time.

short_description: tools: missing forward declaration
long_description:
The new gcc-4.0-pre is more strict about forward declarations in the C++ code.
The problems are even marked as errors. The most typical mistake is that the
construction:

     friend class XXX;

does not declare the class XXX. The construction does not longer invoke implicit
declaration. The class must be explicitly declared by

      class XXX;

I'll attach a patch that fixes the problem in the module: tools.


I'm sorry if this component is wrong. I was not able to find a better one.

parent window. This way they wouldn't obscure some part of the text. 
Probably some kind of borderless window in which the tool palette was 
displayed would solve the problem. Also it would be the more usual way 
of handling them.

short_description: dylib-link-list internal error possibly leads to wrong library references
long_description:
solenv/unxmacxp/bin/dylib-link-list is used to determine which libraries to link against when a library is 
used (i.e. its dependencies)
Currently this script contains an error because it assumes library versions to be of the type x.x.x where x 
is a digit. However version numbers can contain more than 1 digit.

short_description: W32-tcsh : tcsh cannot find/start command ending in .exe
long_description:
This is a followup to issue 49927. I'm sure this is not a new error but
it just didn't trigger so far :(

My build (was successfull on Saturday I swear!) no consistently fails in
crashrep (Log see at end if this entry).

The problem seems to be that tcsh only finds programs/commands without .exe
in its path hash. See .

Sometimes it also finds the files with .exe but this is considered a flaw?!
So far it worked accidentally.

Fortunately there is a workaround for this problem:
  echo unhash >> ${HOME}/.tcshrc
fixes the symptoms but IMHO the better solution is to use the program files
without .exe extension in makefiles.

--- log ---
Building project crashrep
=============
/cygdrive/d/w1/SRC680_m109p4/crashrep/scripts
-------------
/cygdrive/d/w1/SRC680_m109p4/crashrep/source/all
-------------
/cygdrive/d/w1/SRC680_m109p4/crashrep/source/win32
------------------------------
Making: ../../wntmsci10.pro/misc/soreport.dpc
dmake subdmake=true  -f makefile.mk  depend=t ALLDPC
lngconvex.exe -ulf ../../wntmsci10.pro/misc/crash_res/crashrep.ulf -rc
../../wntmsci10.pro/res/soreport.rc  -rct rctemplate.txt -rch rcheader.txt -rcf
rcfooter.txt
lngconvex.exe: Command not found.
dmake:  Error code 1 while making '../../wntmsci10.pro/res/soreport.rc'
---* TARGET.MK *---
dmake:  Error code 255 while making '../../wntmsci10.pro/misc/soreport.dpc'
---* TG_SLO.MK *---

short_description: Potential speedup for *nix builds
long_description:
While working on issue 50689 (Windows only) I realized that using the -f switch
for tcsh calls from dmake accelerated my build by 16%.

I don't expect such a speedup for more sane environments but I thought you
might give it a try.

Patch:
+++ solenv/inc/startup/startup.mk       15 Jun 2005 15:36:40 -0000
@@ -567 +567 @@
 
 # Recipe execution configuration
    SHELL        *:= $/bin$/sh
-   SHELLFLAGS   *:= -c
+   SHELLFLAGS   *:= -fc
    GROUPSHELL   *:= $(SHELL)
    GROUPFLAGS   *:=
    SHELLMETAS   *:= |();&?*][$$:\\#`'

short_description: Bug in conversion of font information for certain unicode ranges of characters
long_description:
In WordPerfect if one choses a font this font is applied on all characters
independently from whether their unicode number is putting them in the group of
Asian characters or Complex scripts. In OOo the style:font-{namesizeweight}
apply only to western characters. The other two groups have their own properties
style:font-{namesizeweight}-{asiancomplex}. If the later are not set in a
span unlike in WordPerfect it is NOT the font of the Western character that is
used but a default font for the given group (asian and/or complex).
The fix (incorportated in CWS fs02) corrects this by defining in each span
style:font-*-{asiancomplex} properties with values identical to the
corresponding values for Western characters.

short_description: In Calc sheet renaming certain unicode character conbinations lead to Invalid Sheet name error
long_description:
When renaming a Calc spreadsheet using Khmer language names sometimes the
renaming works correctly but other times it returns an Invalid Sheet Name error.

We have been able to isolate reproducible short cases that triggers the error:

For example: a name that is only composed of the character \u17B6 is considered
invalid. This is a combining character (it cannot appear by itself in
rendering). Just in case this was a problem the valid Khmer combination \u1780
\u17B6 also triggers the error message.

Just in case it might help to pinpoint the problem here is a different
behaviour: combining mark \u17B7 by itself gives an error but \u1780 \u17B7
does not.

Reproduction of the error does not require correct Khmer rendering nor fonts
only being able to introduce the Khmer characters.

In case a keyboard driver is needed it is available in:

http://khmeros.info/khmeros_download.html

there are two objects one should be anchored on page one. We do it wrong 
because the object on page one is abchored to the page break. In this case we 
should anchor it to the previous paragraph so we get a better import result
Tracker ID: #78934

CMC: Anchoring is a matter of some debate ms ones differ quite considerably 
from ours in this case you have a good point. Ill see if tht is possible 
without breaking the working usual case

Concerting OOo1.x documents to OASIS file format in document converter does not
preserve any stored versions in the file. The same happens when a document in
OOo1.x format is converted on the fly in the running office.

Amoung other things this has the advantage for us of allowing prelink to find
them and for distributers allows removing LD_LIBRARY_PATH from soffice.sh

short_description: Search & Find context help for Calc needs fixing
long_description:

help.

short_description: Memory problem with new[] and delete operator on Tru64 port
long_description:
As described by Yi Wang on dev@porting.openoffice.org there are quite a few
'operator new[]()'/'operator delete()' mismatches throughout the OOo code. Such
mismatching usage is always wrong and possible damage might not limited to the
DEC C++ compiler and the Tru64 port.

This issue is to track and ensure all fixes currently done on HEAD revisions
also go onto the OOO_STABLE_1 branch.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Hi

While we are debugging the OOo Tru64 port we found a memory problem
with new[] and delete operator.

The OpenOffice.org code is full of new/delete calls where the new is
called with new[] and the delete omits the []. With Compaq cxx compiler
calling new[] gets the array version of operator new.  This adds an 8
byte prefix to the array allocated through new and returns the pointer
to the actual start of the array. It is supposed to call delete[] to
delete arrays allocated through new[] instead of using vanilla delete.

I am wondering if this causes any problem on other compilers. Is it
wrong to use delete (without [] ) on an array allocated through new[]?
Does anybody have good idea on fixing this problem?

Thanks for any ideas and comments.

Yi

P.S. An example to illustrate the problem:

$SRC_ROOT/xmloff/source/style/xmlexppr.cxx: ( array aPropIters )

   488
FilterPropertyInfoList_Impl::iterator *aPropIters =
   489                                          new
FilterPropertyInfoList_Impl::iterator[nValueCount];
   490
FilterPropertyInfoList_Impl::iterator *pPropIter = aPropIters;
    ......
    ......
   528                                  }
   529                                  delete aPropIters;
   530                          }

short_description: First start of user installation causes errormessage
long_description:
- Net-installation of srx645_m57
- Workstation installation of srx645_m57
- Start the Office -> errormessage 'responsefile could not be found

short_description: Freeze on loading document containing a section with condition
long_description:
TO REPRODUCE:
Open attached document.
After a while (after document formatting or when scrolling to the Copyright
section) OOo freezes.

Loading the same document on OOo 1.1.4 does not freeze.

CAUSE:
This seems to be caused be the hide condition of the section containing the
copyright statements and the TOC. When the condition is switched oof the freeze
does not happen.

DETAILS
I tried to reconstruct this from scratch but didn't succeed.
It seems to be a very complex document in which you'll find:
- custom First page style
- custom Second page style applied over page break before at first paragraph
(Copyright) of the page
- custom Third page style applied over page break before at first paragraph
(Contents) of the page
- a TOC
- Page 2 and 3 are included in a section which should be hidden conditionally.
- Headings are also custom styles
- One of the headings has a custom numbering style applied in the Outline
Numbering dialog.

short_description: Support for ARCH_FLAGS when compiling the module icu
long_description:
There is possible to set some extra CFLAGS and CXXFLAGS flags via the variable
ARCH_FLAGS see the issue #47954.

I will attach a patch that allows to use the ARCH_FLAGS when building the module
icu.

short_description: Embedded Excel chart badly sized
long_description:
I have a Powerpoint presentation created using MS Office 2000. Several of the 
slides contain embedded charts created using MS Excel. When I display the 
slides in Powerpoint the charts look fine. When I display them in OpenOffice 
the charts are badly sized i.e.I see just an oversized chunk of the chart.

I can send you a ZIP of the presentation (c 870 kb)to try this out.

Many thanks

Des Atkinson Metron Technology Limited desa@metron.co.uk

short_description: minor regression: WW8 INHALT field should be exported as
long_description:
As in the attached .odt on export to .doc the Table Content field is used in
the past we exported all our fields as german and set the document internal
language to english. Because word 2000 standardized on using english everywhere
we copied them but the INHALT field is still in english.

On export to .doc and refreshing the fields in non .de word (e.g. automatically
after printing) there should be Error bookmarks missing in various places. The
simple attached patch should fix it.

short_description: Tables in OOo Base files lose if the files have been saved with non ascii charaters and then renamed or copied
long_description:
In fact the problem which happens on Windows only appears for over ten
developer builds. 

In OOo Base data can be saved in an embedded table using HSQL engine. Nothing
goes wrong if a user always uses a file on same location. However tables inside
the file disappear if the OOo file is saved to other location. That means if I
open a backup file or a copy data is simply lost although the original file is
all right.

I checked it on 1.9.118 Linux build too. Everything is fine. I believe the
problem is of Windows builds only.

short_description: Crash when linked document sheet contains notes
long_description:
The attached document CS0502.sxc refers some cells of CS0501.sxc. If you load
CS0502.sxc and close it it crashes. It also crashes when you open the Navigator
because in ScPostIt::GetText() the mpDoc used in mpDoc->GetNoteEngine() is
invalid and the ScNoteEditEngine& obtained and used is none. It seems the
document pointer is remembered from the original linked document loaded which
is then destroyed. If you remove the notes from  CS0501.sxc the crash does not
occur. In a very simple scenario with 2 new documents with only one single note
in the linked document however this could not be reproduced.

short_description: [DE] comment still in content item of draw
long_description:
I use OOo 1.9.113 German language pack.
Go to online-help Inhalte (content) then Präsentationen und Zeichnungen then
Allgemeines und Hinweise zur Arbeit mit der Benutzeroberfläche.

The item Verwenden der Tastenkombinationen ... is very long and contains a
comment which should be deleted.

I think that the items in the moduls should be similar which is not so.
In Textdokumente it is Verwenden von Tastaturkombinationen (Zugänglichkeit in
OpenOffice.org Writer)
In Tabellendokumente it is Tastenkombinationen (OpenOffice.org
Calc-Zugänglichkeit)
In Formeln it is Tastatursteuerung (OpenOffice.org Math Zugänglichkeit)
In Modulunabhängige Hilfethemen it is Tastatursteuerung (OpenOffice
Zugänglichkeit).
Datenbankfunktion has no such item.

short_description: OOo fails to open Word 2000 document
long_description:
When opens document created by Ms Word 2000 OOo 1.9.79 (WinXP SP1) shows 
import progress bar. But when it fills and disappears nothing happens. The CPU 
usage in Windows Task Manager of soffice.bin is about 99% for a long time (at 
least 10 min.) After that i gave up and killed the application.
  Same problem appears in OOo 1.1.4.
  
  P.S. Sorry for my english.

short_description: crash when doing an updateRow in a RowSet without escape processing
long_description:
- import the attach SQL script into a MySQL database of your choice
- create an ODBC data source for this database
- in OOo create a database document for the ODBC data source
- register (Tools|Options|Base|Databases) the database document as testdb
- open the attached Basic macro and run it
=> crash

notes:
- the crash does not happen if the underlying database is of type dBase
- the crash does not happen if EscapeProcessing is set to TRUE

long_description:

Open online help with register Inhalte (Engl. contents). Go to Präsentationen
und Zeichnungen (Engl. Presentation and drawings) then Befehle und Menüs
(Engl. Command and Menu Reference). Now go to Zeichnungen (OpenOffice.org
Draw) and then go to Symbolleisten (Engl. Toolbars).

There is a content item Werkzeugleiste which leads to the help page
Werkzeugeleiste.
vnd.sun.star.help://sdraw/text/sdraw/main0210.xhp?Language=de&System=WIN&UseDB=no

Symbolleiste Zeichnen as help page and Zeichnen as content item. In the
content item Symbolleiste is not needed because it is the term of the level
above.
You can adapt the help page to the new title by inserting and deleting paragraphs.

short_description: [DE] “Kopieren von Dias …” does not reflect new UI
long_description:
I use OOo1.9.122 German language pack.
Open online help with register “Inhalte” (Engl. contents). Go to “Präsentationen
und Zeichnungen” (Engl. Presentation and drawings) then “Kopieren von Dias aus
anderen Präsentationen”
vnd.sun.star.help://simpress/text/simpress/guide/page_copy.xhp?Language=de&System=WIN&UseDB=no

Besides the wrong term dia (which is already addressed in issue 48829) there are
additional errors. But I will listen the “dia”-errors too so that they can be
fixed at the same time.

(Dia→Folie) The title is wrong and also on the left side the item in the TOC is
wrong.
wrong
Kopieren von Dias aus anderen Präsentationen
correct
Kopieren von Folien aus anderen Präsentationen

wrong (Dia→Folie)
Es ist möglich Dias aus anderen Präsentationen in die aktuelle Präsentation
einzufügen. Außerdem können Dias aus Präsentationen kopiert und in andere
eingefügt werden.
correct
Es ist möglich Folien aus anderen Präsentationen in die aktuelle Präsentation
einzufügen. Außerdem können Folien aus Präsentationen kopiert und in andere
eingefügt werden.

wrong (Dia→Folie)
So fügen Sie ein Dia aus einer anderen Präsentation ein:
correct
So fügen Sie eine Folie aus einer anderen Präsentation ein:

wrong (change in UI)
1. Öffnen Sie eine Präsentation und wählen Sie Ansicht - Arbeitsbereich -
Zeichnungsansicht.
correct
1.Öffnen Sie eine Präsentation und wählen Sie Ansicht - Normal.

wrong (Dia→Folie)
3. Suchen Sie die Präsentationsdatei mit dem gewünschten Dia und klicken Sie
auf Einfügen.
4. Klicken Sie auf das Pluszeichen neben dem Symbol für die Präsentationsdatei
und wählen Sie dann die Dias die Sie einfügen möchten.
correct
3. Suchen Sie die Präsentationsdatei mit der gewünschten Folie und klicken Sie
auf Einfügen.
4. Klicken Sie auf das Pluszeichen neben dem Symbol für die Präsentationsdatei
und wählen Sie dann die Folien die Sie einfügen möchten.

wrong (Dia→Folie)
So kopieren Sie Dias in einer Präsentation und fügen Sie in eine andere ein:
correct
So kopieren Sie Folien in einer Präsentation und fügen Sie in eine andere ein:

wrong (Dia→Folie; change in UI)
2. In der Präsentation mit den Dias die Sie kopieren möchten wählen Sie
Ansicht - Arbeitsbereich - Diaansicht.
correct
2. In der Präsentation mit den Folien die Sie kopieren möchten wählen Sie
Ansicht - Foliensortierung.

wrong (Dia→Folie)
3. Wählen Sie die gewünschten Dias und dann Bearbeiten - Kopieren.
correct
3. Wählen Sie die gewünschten Folien und dann Bearbeiten - Kopieren.

wrong (Dia→Folie; change in UI)
4. Wechseln Sie in die Präsentation in welche die Dias eingefügt werden sollen
und wählen Sie dann Ansicht - Arbeitsbereich - Zeichnungsansicht.
correct
4. Wechseln Sie in die Präsentation in welche die Folien eingefügt werden
sollen und wählen Sie dann Ansicht - Normal.

wrong (Dia→Folie)
5. Wählen Sie das Dia aus auf welches das kopierte Dia folgen soll und wählen
Sie dann Bearbeiten - Einfügen.
correct
5. Wählen Sie die Folie aus auf welche die kopierte Folie folgen soll und
wählen Sie dann Bearbeiten - Einfügen.

short_description: erraneous descriptions in Function Wizard (EVEN ODD)
long_description:
Function EVEN:
Is - Returns a number rounded up to the nearest even integer.
Must be - Returns a number which absolute value is rounded up to the nearest
even integer and retains the sign. or Rounds postive number up to the nearest
even integer and negative number down to the nearest even integer.

Function ODD:
Is - Returns a number rounded up to the nearest odd integer.
Must be - Returns a number which absolute value is rounded up to the nearest
odd integer and retains the sign. or Rounds postive number up to the nearest
odd integer and negative number down to the nearest odd integer.

short_description: Clarify the property of “Controls layer” in “About Layers”
long_description:
In Online Help goto Contents – Presentation and Drawings – Groups and Layers –
About Layers.

There you find the statement:
Layers do not determine the stacking order of objects on your slide. The
stacking order of objects on your slide is determined by the sequence in which
you add the objects.

That statement has a slight error. If you put an object on to the layer
“Controls” it will be outside of any stacking order of objects on the other
layers. It is always in front and cannot be sent back. This special property of
the layer “Controls” should be mentioned in the part “Controls layer”.

short_description: Cells with multiple formatings: space disappears when loading document
long_description:
PROBLEM:

When the spreadsheet document is first saved the cell looks like this (notice
the space before bar):

Foo<text:span
text:style-name=T1> bar

Now if you open the document that space disappears! Saving the document without
modifying it produces this code:

Foo<text:span
text:style-name=T1>bar


REPRODUCING:

I have reproduced this bug in both OpenOffice 1.1.4 and 1.9.122 (Windows 2000).
Here are instructions on how to do it:

1. Create a new document and write to cell A1 Foo bar and press Enter.
2. Select the cell and underline it (bold and italics have the same problem).
3. Edit the cell select  bar and remove the underlining from it.
4. Now the cell will read Foo bar with Foo underlined.
5. Save and close the document.
6. Open the document.
7. Now the cell will read Foobar with Foo underlined. - The space disappeared!

short_description: PDF export has rounding issues with coordinates
long_description:
currently all coordinates are recalculated by hand and emitted as fixed point
format in PDF export. If we used a matrix here instead we would save us a lot of
rounding issues and let the reader application do the grunt work here.

short_description: configure with system boost fails
long_description:
./configure --with-system-boost fails as following:
:
checking boost/shared_ptr.hpp usability... no
checking boost/shared_ptr.hpp presence... no
checking for boost/shared_ptr.hpp... no
configure: error: boost/shared_ptr.hpp not found. install boost

config.log writes:
configure:10464: checking which boost to use
configure:10467: result: external
configure:10480: checking boost/shared_ptr.hpp usability
configure:10492: gcc -c -g -O2 -I/sw/include conftest.c >&5

It seems that gcc is used instead of g++.
Additionally $CXXCPP is not set on Darwin and that causes warnings.

short_description: Add Chapter no. without separator to the Insert Index/Table dialog
long_description:
This is a request to include a Chapter no. without separator button to the 
Insert Index/Table dialog. This will allow chapter numbers such as A-1 when the
Chapter (for example a Heading 1) has a numbering of Appendix A with the
Appendix being part of the separator before the number. This will make
creating Table of Contents easier in large documents without resorting to
manually editing a Table of Contents. This is similar to what occurs when you
can insert a field in a footer that either has a Chapter no. or a Chapter no.
without separator.

short_description: IT: wrong tooltips on 'Bullets and Numbering' toolbar in Italian
long_description:
For both right ('up one level') and left ('down one level') arrows the tooltip
is 'un livello piÃ¹ in alto' while for the right one it should read 'un livello
piÃ¹ in basso'.
In a similar way also the other arrows present inconsistent or wrong translations:
'move up with subpoints' (double left arrow) should be translated: 'aumenta
livello con sottopunti' and not 'in alto con sottopunti'; in this way it would
be consistent with the 'move down with subpoints' one (double right arrow) that
reads: 'riduci livello con sottopunti'.
Up and down arrows are OK but double up arrow reads 'Sposta con sottopunti verso
il basso' which is wrong: it should read: 'Sposta in alto con sottopunti'. Like
that it would be right and coherent with the double down arrow which reads
'Sposta in basso con sottopunti'.
I cast the issue as P3 because I think this a bug very visible to the average user.
My installation is 1.9.122 for Windows. The same problem has been reported on Linux.

Issue 52946 is an imprecise duplicate of this
issue

The reason is that a component may want to return the same instance for the same set of parameters 
and it can do so by implementing the factory itself.

Regards :-)

Philippe.

short_description: Edit mode restored after loading an Impress document
long_description:
Create an Impress document go to master page mode and save the document.
Afer closing and loading the document the current page is set correctly to the
first page.  However the master page mode is still restored.  According to the
(updated) spec the document has to be loaded into edit mode.

The edit mode can be restored to the one active on the last save with the
Shift-F5 accelerator.

short_description: error pasting calc sheet with unicode text as table
long_description:
When pasting a calc sheet as a new table unicode text isn't properly 
interpreted and instead of seeing the text the way it should be every 
non-latin utf-8 code is interpreted as two (?) characters essentially making 
the text unreadable. 
 
I tested whether base accepts unicode characters and yes that part is 
properly internationalized. However pasting a spreadsheet sheet transforms 
the unicode characters into gibberish. 
 
I used documents containing Hebrew text alongside English text. 
 
BTW I specify UTF-8 as the character encoding because I noticed that the 
Latin text was properly shown in the OpenOffice base table.

short_description: --with-package-format and more values
long_description:

 _rene_: after integration of cws debianer PKGFORMAT changed its
semantic.
 oh?
 right now you can use PKGFORMAT=rpm deb to build both RPMS and DEBs.
 ah nice
 do you think it would be useful to have configrue
--with-pkgformat=rpm deb? or something similar? Can you please think about it?
 uh there is already?
 is it?
 that's what PKGFORMAT comes from
 but I think it gets confused by multiple values in configure
 unless sun changed that too
 --with-package-format=deb is there since a long time and was the
origin of PKGFORMAT :)
 I guess I should fix it for knowing about deb rpm
 ok I'll test it. MMnt...
 I remember that there are some PKGFORMAT = foo checks...
 which of course will fails with rpm deb
 of course sun didn't see the urge change that too ;)
 _rene_: yes it fails. I'll file an issue for you.

Running configure with --with-package-format=deb rpm results in

checking which package format to use... configure: error: unsupported format deb
rpm. Supported by EPM are:
aix - AIX software distribution
bsd - FreeBSD NetBSD or OpenBSD software distribution
depot or swinstall - HP-UX software distribution
deb - Debian software distribution
inst or tardist - IRIX software distribution
osx - MacOS X software distribution
pkg - Solaris software distribution
rpm - RedHat software distribution
setld - Tru64 (setld) software distribution
native - Native software distribution for the platform
portable - Portable software distribution

short_description: querying DISTINCT values from a dBase table is incredibly slow with larger data sets
long_description:
- extract the attached archive to a location of your choice. It contains a
  database document (.odb) and some dBase files
- open the database document
- Edit|Database|Properties -> adjust the path to the dBase files to the location
  you just extracted the archive to
- open the query performance_distinct which does a
    SELECT DISTINCT * FROM performance
  where the performance table contains 5 columns and 500 records
=> this takes about 5:30 minutes on a 3GHz Athlon XP

This is incredibly slow IMO and we should investigate where this can be improved

short_description: COlumn order specified in create table wizard not implemented.
long_description:
Steps to recreate:
1) Start table create wizard.
2) Choose invoices
3) Select all columns
4) Click next.
5) Click invoiceID (4th from top)
6) Use ^ to move column to top
7) Click finish and save to database.
8) Now open up the table in the designer

You will see that invoiceID is not the first column in the table despite step (5).

short_description: runner: give office more time for closing itself
long_description:
The officeprovider is able to close the office. It must be possible to change
the timeout for the closing process of the office itself.

short_description: Advanced filter ignores not equal  comparison
long_description:
Using advanced filter with a seperate filter criteria area which contains  for
a not equal match doesn't work.
The not equal condition is ignored and matching continues IF there is more than
one line of criteria.
e.g.

| status   | programmer | tester |
| done | PT         |        |
| done |            | PT     |

If used as a criteria for a filter should find all rows where programmer or
tester is PT but status is not done.

However the Status field is disregarded or has no effect.

If you remove one line from the filter definition so only one remains then the
status comparison works properly. Although in the this case obviously we can
only check the programmer OR tester columns.

If you change the status to an equal match then that also works properly.

I hope that makes sense.

short_description: Fax Wizard Help IDs not in hid.lst; some re-used
long_description:
The Fax Wizard uses help IDs in the range of about 41120 to 41166. Most of them
are not included in the hid.lst file. Some can be found in the hid.lst but with
a long name that doesn't relate to the wizard's control.

short_description: Office crashes if Impress is embedded into another OLE containers and tabs are clicked
long_description: OOo crashes if Impress is embedded into other OLE containers and tabs are clicked.

short_description: cs vs. sk: The same extras used for more localizations
long_description:
The following file is installed for both Czech and Slovak localizations:

presets/config/paleta.soc

I build more localizations and want to put each localization into a separate RPM
package. It makes problems if a file should be included in two packages.

Could you plesae rename the duplicit file?

short_description: python : g_exportedScripts interpreted within commented line
long_description:
Steps to reproduce (OOo 1.9.xxx) :
- use a perfectly correct python scrip ending with line
g_exportedScripts = .......
- comment-out the line
# g_exportedScripts = .......
- try to run it through tools > Macros > execute : impossible. 
The log file will print:
[ERROR] Error invalid syntax (line ...) while evaluating ....

g_exportedScripts should not be interpreted within commented lines.
If this is not possible please warn readers in python-framework web page !
I have lost a bunch of hairs finding this.

I did not test on other g_xxx static variables could be the same.

short_description: python : log file not written until OOo is closed
long_description:
Using these values on pythonscript.py file:
LogLevel.use = LogLevel.ERROR
LOG_STDOUT = False

On Windows XP SP2 Home when you try to run a python module with errors the log file 
is only written when closing OpenOffice.org.
This is very annoying when you try to find out what's wrong.

Log file should be written immediately. If not possible please warn readers in python-
framework web page !

short_description: Macro with Autofilter function created with macro recorder crashes OOo
long_description:
I created a macro by autofilter containing 2 filters conderning date and content
of a special column. xecuting that macro crashes OOo.

I sent an error report.

short_description: Corrupt file on Australian mirrors
long_description:
The ZIP file for the Win32 release of OOo 2.0 beta seems to be corrupt.

At least on the two AU mirrors I tried anyway.

I attempted 3 different times
Once from planetmirror unexpected EOF in zip
Once from pacific with the same error
Once from pacific without a DL manager same error

I have ADSL so I didn't stop and resume at all through the downloads.

The only way I could fix it was to get the torrent and it resumed where the 
HTTP mirrors left off.. Bittorrent seems to think it was missing a few meg on 
the end and fixed it up.

Is this a common issue that others have had?
Just letting you know anyway.

short_description: 1.1.5rc4 and 2.0 beta2 zh builds ready
long_description:
1.1.5rc4 and 2.0beta2 for zh_cn and zh_tw are ready.
Thanks.

short_description: ADO/ Access Autoincrement fails
long_description:
I have created a form that uses a table from an Access database. The primary key
is based on an autoincrementing integer. The connection is through ADO 2.6 and
later and JET 4.  

When a new record is created the record cannot be saved because the
autoincrementing value is not generated but remains null.

short_description: PNG Reader scanline support (performance improvement)
long_description:
For some graphic formats full scanline support is supported now: 8 bit palette
24 bit rgb.

The full scanline support is possible only if following features are not used:
-alpha
-special gamma value
-16 bit color component
-transparent colors
-interlace mode

short_description: Install needs to check for patch 106950 for Solaris 7
long_description:
I could not get openoffice to install or run on my Solaris 7 systems without
patch 106950-03 or later installed. -01 does not work. Don't know if there is a
-02 or whether it works. 

Without this patch the installation program would just abort. If I installed on
another system and nfs-mounted the directory the user install would crash. Once
I had run the user install on another system now just trying to run soffice
causes it to abort before the splash screen is displayed.

The installation program should check for this (and the README should make
mention of it too) in addition to the C++ runtime library patches that are
checked for.

A suitable version of this patch is included with recent recommended patch
clusters but it's not really *necessary* to install the whole cluster which
requires a reboot when all you really need is one patch which does NOT require
a reboot. In an everyone administers his own workstation world the patch
cluster approach is reasonable but in large shared environments it's not.

short_description: De Help: Not translated parts in DE Help
long_description:

long_description:

from OLE to MetaFile in order to ease the transition of data to OOo Impress.

short_description: Crash when deleting record from a form.
long_description:
I have tried this with both the latest JDBC and ODBC drivers from MySQL.

I have an address book in MySQL on our primary SQL server that I have been using
with OpenOffice 1.1.4 as well as many other programs.  A database document was
created with OOo 2.0 beta 2 to access this database.  From the table view;
adding deleting and editing records works fine.

I created a form with the OOo 2.0 Database Form Wizard so that the records could
be viewed in an organized manner.  The records are displayed correctly.  I can
Add and edit exiting records but if the X delete record button is pressed
OOo crashes starts document recovery and then sends debug info to Sun
Microsystems.  The record does get deleted.

At this point I have to reboot the computer to get OOo working correctly again.

Príkladom takého dotazu je:
SELECT EVC Nazov ID_REF FROM Knihy Knihy WHERE ( ( ID_REF IS NULL
 ) )

Takéto dotazy sa dali editovať len v design view späť do SQL view sa už nedalo 
prepnúť (zobrazila sa chyba)
Ten problém sa vyskytoval len u dotazov ktoré mali kritérium IS NULL. V 
anglickom OO 1.9.130 sa táto chyba nevyskytuje.

short_description: Backslash+space and blank characters not handled correctly for self-defined format of number

correctly.

Examples

(1)   ###\ \A_B\C
(2)   ###\A_B\C

2. Fill cell A1 with 123 and set cell format to (2). Save file as Test.ods and
open it again. Format is shown as ###A  C.

Note: Backslashing of A and C (\A \C) is not necessary for this test case.

short_description: python disabled on last build
long_description:
Hi

As a first issue I'll provide you an easy one.
On last build taken on http://ooofr.org/telechargement/macosx/2.0/m130 (fr
version) two issues detected about python (and another one about XDarwin I'll
investigate it tonight to make a new issue):

* python-core-2.3.4 should be symlinked to python-core in OpenOffice.org
2.0.app/Contents/openoffice.org/program

* python-core-2.3.4/bin/python isn't executable as it should be.

Patch proposed for the already installed OOo:

cd /Applications/OpenOffice.org 2.0.app/Contents/openoffice.org/program && ln -s
python-core-2.3.4 python-core && chmod u+x python-core/bin/python

short_description: Two enhancements for the Help regarding the ampersand symbol
long_description:
Two enhancements for the Help are suggested:

1. A search with & or with ampersand should lead us to the place where an
explanation for the ampersand symbol is given in the Help;

2. The explanation given in the help page (Help -> Contents -> Index -> Search
term -> formula functions;operators) does not inform us that if the ampersand
symbol is sided by numeric cells then the numeric values are converted into
text. This information would be very useful specially if in the company of some
examples.

short_description: NL: translations of styles Title and Caption are the same
long_description:
Both Title and Caption are translated as Titel and therefore only one of
them is shown in Styles and Formatting. Caption needs to be translated in a
different way.

keyids: 217873 (Caption) 218337 (Title)

short_description: OOO_STABLE_1/X11+Aqua:  config_office needs patch to bootstrap
long_description:
1)  The configure script (as in OO638C) needs some work to compile for the Aqua
VCL done with ./configure --without-x.  If --without-x is specified
explicitly and the X11 headers are present configure ignores --without-x
because it finds the X11 headers and builds for X11 anyway.  This patch changes
the configure.in file to force an Aqua build if --without-x is given to
configure.  !!REMEMBER!!:  need to run autoconf in config_office after applying
the patch.

2)  Also adds the QUARTZ define when building the Aqua VCL on MacOS X.

short_description: OOo 2.0.1 crashes when deleting the 2 of 2 records in a form
long_description:
I have just installed 2.0rc2 and went back to testing the database
functionality.  I had to stop with rc1 because of crashes.

With 2.0rc2 I am seeing the following problems all related to database
navigation from within a form created with OOo base.  If you would like me to
file separate issues on each of the following problems let me know.  However
from what I can tell these appear to be related.

1.  Moving from record to record I have seen two crashes that prompted for
automatic document recovery.  I will attach the error report.  This happens when
adding and deleting records and does cause the data loss of the displayed record.

2.  Data that is displayed in the form is not the same data as in the raw table.
 This is especially true with autonumber fields.  For instance I created a two
record database with a Primary ID autonumber field and a text field.  I created
a form with the form wizard.  Five records were added and then the last three
were deleted.  Three more were added but the autonumber field in the form
always displayed 1 within the form.  I closed the form and checked the table.
 In the table the autonumber field showed the actual data as 12678 which is
what I would expect.  I reopened the form and again the autonumber field always
showed 1.

3.  Deleting the last record in the table is causing problems.  In the same test
as above I moved to the last of the five records and pressed the X delete
button.  After responding yes to the question the record was deleted.  I
expected to be positioned on record 4 but I was actually positioned to record
3.  When I got down to two records and deleted the last record the form locked.
 I closed the form and reopened it and the last record was indeed deleted.

4.  Deleting a record in a one record database caused an error to appear.  I
continued the above test and deleted the only record in the database.  An error
window popped up that said:  Error inserting new record.  Function sequence
error.  Pressing OK closed the error and properly displays a blank record.

All of these errors occurred using both a MySQL database and an OOo flat
database file.

Let me know if you need any further information as this is a showstopper for our
organization.

short_description: Improve the accuracy of ERF/ERFC for large x value
long_description:
This issue is a spin-off of Issue 19991.

The patch in Issue 19991 fixes incorrect ERF/ERFC values for large x values
where the original algorithm produced erroneous results.  However the algorithm
should be further improved to match the values computed by octave/gnumeric.  The
revised algorithm in Issue 19991 while it does a better job than the original
algorithm converges to 1 too quickly.

short_description: Add Save as Single Document option also to Mail Merge print dialog
long_description:
When you save a mail-merge document throught the mail-merge wizzard
there is an option to save the document to a single file. It would
be very usefull (at least to me ;)) if this option would also be
available in the regular mail-merge print dialog.
I think people would also notice this feature better if it would
be also in regular mail-merge print dialog and I would not have to
advice separetly people to go through the mail-merge wizzard if
they want to save the document to a single file.

Thanks.
   Saku

short_description: guides remain randmly during move
long_description:
There seems to be a repainting problem while moving rules in UI - at least in
Write Impress and Draw. A guide line remains at several positions while moving
a   rule resizing a table etc. See attached screenshot. Tested on linux x86  /
Xorg 6.8.2 with ATI and Matrox drivers.

short_description: Spreadsheet: DataPilot: OpenOffice.org crashes when Data button dragged onto Filter
long_description:
OpenOffice.org crashes when the Data button in a DataPilot table is dragged
onto the Filter button. I will attach a small example spreadsheet.

Problem found in OOo 2.0 RC1 reproduced in OOo 2.0 RC2. Problem not present in
OOo 1.1.5.

This may not be a common or sensible thing for people to do but a more graceful
failure would be nice. For instance doing this in OOo 1.1.5 pops up a dialog
saying The data range can not be deleted.

short_description: please remove dba/connectivity/source/drivers/kab/KCondition.cxx from CVS repository
long_description:
Unfortunately there are two files in dba/connectivity/source/drivers/kab whose
names differ in case only. While this is usually not a problem on Unix systems
cvs updatess on Windows break at this location since the name becomes
unambiguous.

The files are kcondition.cxx and KCondition.cxx.
Please completely remove KCondition.cxx from the CVS repositoy.

short_description: WW8: Page number frame too small after export
long_description:
When I open a MS word document (.doc) the page numbers are shown incorrectly 
above 9. I just can see the first character of the page number. For example 10 
is shown as 1. 11 is also shown as 1. From 20 to 29 page numbers are 
shown as 2. If I save the document back to .doc and open it by MS word the 
page numbers are already erronous like in OOo. (The original document was 
perfect in MS word).
I am using the latest OOo: 2.0rc3.

short_description: performance: psprint fontcache reader should be optimized
long_description:
psprint's font cache spends a lot of time tokenizing constructing and
destructing ByteString objects. This could be improved by either OString
tokenizer or perhaps an own specialized version.

short_description: CVS diff: no output return value 0
long_description:
Hi

today Fri Oct 21 08:48:18 CEST 2005 somewhere between 08:00 and 08:20 there
were problems with web (read: no web) with CVS (read: no CVS) etc. I had a
tunnel running all over the night messages there:

pavel@paveljanik:~> OOo_tunnel
Tunnel established.  Type ctrl-c to exit.
channel 2: open failed: connect failed: Connection timed out
channel 3: open failed: connect failed: Connection refused
channel 2: open failed: connect failed: Connection refused
channel 2: open failed: connect failed: Connection refused
channel 2: open failed: connect failed: Connection timed out
channel 3: open failed: connect failed: Connection timed out
channel 2: open failed: connect failed: Connection refused
channel 2: open failed: connect failed: Connection refused

I was building m135 and my build failed in sd/.../AccessibleSlideSorterView.cxx
thus I tried to see the diff between m134 and m135 with this command:

pavel@paveljanik:~/.ooo/ooo_SRC680_m135_src/sd/source/ui/accessibility> cvs diff
-r SRC680_m134 -r SRC680_m135 AccessibleSlideSorterView.cxx

The result was *empty* ie no output *and* the return value (echo $?) was 0. I
was fooled that there were no differences! But there were changes!

(The file was updated after the first tagging and now it builds OK.)

short_description: OpenOffice.org 2.0 built without java not able to save or load Documents at all
long_description:
The --without-java-build is not usable at all atm as it is not able to save or
load in OpenDocument or the old OOo format. The problem is that the Filter.xcu
file is not built correctly it's just an empty file. Copying over a correct
version of that file solves this. In the build log you can see that Filter.xcu
indeed is not built correctly:

===================================================================
Building language packages Filter for filters
===================================================================
mkdir -p
../../../unxlngi6.pro/misc/filters/ui/langpacks/en-US/org/openoffice/TypeDetection/
IN ../../../unxlngi6.pro/misc/filters/ui/merge/filter_ui.xcu -PARAM lang en-US
>
../../../unxlngi6.pro/misc/filters/ui/langpacks/en-US/org/openoffice/TypeDetection/Fi$IN:
Command not found.
------------------------------
Making: ../../../unxlngi6.pro/bin/fcfg_langpack_en-US.zip
rebuilding zipfiles
------------------------------
cd  ../../../unxlngi6.pro/misc/filters/ui/langpacks/en-US ; zip -u -r
/var/tmp/portage/openoffice-2.0.0/temp/mknq1ZLK.__en-US.zip  * -x delzip  -x
*CVS* || if ($st$        zip warning:
/var/tmp/portage/openoffice-2.0.0/temp/mknq1ZLK.__en-US.zip not found or empty
  adding: org/ (stored 0%)
  adding: org/openoffice/ (stored 0%)
  adding: org/openoffice/TypeDetection/ (stored 0%)
  adding: org/openoffice/TypeDetection/Filter.xcu (stored 0%)
cp -f /var/tmp/portage/openoffice-2.0.0/temp/mknq1ZLK.__en-US.zip 
../../../unxlngi6.pro/bin/fcfg_langpack_en-US.zip
rm -f /var/tmp/portage/openoffice-2.0.0/temp/mknq1ZLK.__en-US.zip

The root of this problem seems to lie in the following portion of code in 
filter/source/config/fragments/makefile.mk :

.IF $(SOLAR_JAVA)==
#cmc hack to workaround the java build requirement
MERGE:=python ../tools/merge/pyAltFCFGMerge
.ELSE
MERGE    := $(JAVA) -jar $(CLASSDIR)$/FCFGMerge.jar
.IF $(JDK) == gcj
PACKLANG := $(JAVA) $(JAVACPS) $(SOLARBINDIR)/xalan.jar
org.apache.xalan.xslt.Process -XSL langfilter.xsl
.ELSE
PACKLANG := $(JAVA) org.apache.xalan.xslt.Process -XSL langfilter.xsl
.ENDIF
.ENDIF

and later on the actual build command:

+$(PACKLANG) -IN $ $@

It seems like there is just no case for a build without java defined here. It
worked in 1.1.x as the filter information was not localized there so it only
showed up in 1.9.x.

For us in Gentoo that's quite a killer bug atm as we have lot's of users who
want to build without-java and get a broken build atm so every advice or help
(or even better: solution) would be appreciated a lot.

short_description: 64bit:Trivial long/ULONG -> sal_Int32/sal_uInt32
long_description:
I have extracted a lot of trivial long/ULONG -> sal_Int32/sal_uInt32 patches 
related from ooo64bit02 CWS and I would like to commit them to 'long2int' CWS.     
     
The reason is that though they are essential for the 64bit porting they do not       
depend on any other stuff from ooo64bit02 so we can integrate them sooner not       
having to wait for the other stuff from ooo64bit02.  This should also save QA's       
work because the impact should be much more predictable (from a 'cvs diff')     
than when integrating all the huge ooo64bit02 CWS.     
     
They build both on x86_64 as well as on x86.  The patches are available at   
http://www.go-oo.org/patches/64bit/ (trivial-*.diff).

short_description: uno and rtl Reference clear() and set() are not reentrantable
long_description:
the methods clear() and set() from
com::sun::star::uno::Reference and rtl::Reference are not reentrantable.

f.e. have class A have a reference to class B

If an instance of class A assigns a new instance of Class B to this reference
the old instance of class B may die because the instance of Class A has the last
reference to it.
In the d'tor of old class B instance there may be access to the Reference in
class A. 
This still points to the destructed reference.

Creating a copy of the reference while the instance of class B is still in its
d'tor causes the refcount of the old B instance to be raised to 1 again and
later decresed to zero a second time leading to a duplicate destruction of B.

short_description: Incorrect regression line transparency after saving and re-opening a chart
long_description:
Whenever I save a file (either .odt or .ods) containing a chart with a
regression line on it when I open it again the transparency of the regression
line goes to 100% (invisible) and all the error bars disappear. Then I have to
go back through and fix them all and I save it close it and open it again
and the same thing happens ... it's pretty annoying. I've attached some samples
when I open the Raw Plots before file ... I can visibly see the regression
line and error bars for about 5 seconds and then they disappear. Curiously
enough when I try to close the file it asks me if I want to save the changes
when I never made any. The Raw plots after is the result of saving the
changes. The same thing happens with .odt and .ods files.

short_description: document does not remember printer settings
long_description:
Printer settings (such as printer tray duplex page size) are no longer
remembered in documents in Linux.

Reproduce:
1. Open blank Writer document
2. File->Printer Settings
3. Change to non-default printer tray duplex page size
4. Save as OpenDocument (.odt)
5. Close OpenOffice.org completely
6. Re-open document

Now notice in File->Printer settings the default printer is selected but a
non-default printer should be selected.

Windows:
I can't reproduce the problem on Windows 2000 Pro with OOo 2.0.0.

System:
Fedora Core 4 (x86 32-bit) using official OOo 2.0.0 Linux RPMs (not Fedora's OOo)
CUPS network printers

Note:
In our office the seemingly-small feature of remembering printer settings is
very useful.

short_description: Selection attribute not honoured when using dispatch api to print
long_description:
The macro ( see below ) was recorded to print the selected sheets of a calc
document.
When you run this macro ALL sheets are printed and not the selected ones.

it seems to me the logic in sfx2/source/view/viewprn.cxx is slightly skewed.
Given that Range and Selection printing are mutually exclusive ( or so it
appears from the code ) the order of checking for the selection attribute is
wrong. will attach a patch that fixes that.

sub Macro5
rem ----------------------------------------------------------------------
rem define variables
dim document   as object
dim dispatcher as object
rem ----------------------------------------------------------------------
rem get access to the document
document   = ThisComponent.CurrentController.Frame
dispatcher = createUnoService(com.sun.star.frame.DispatchHelper)

rem ----------------------------------------------------------------------
dim args1(2) as new com.sun.star.beans.PropertyValue
args1(0).Name = Copies
args1(0).Value = 1
args1(1).Name = Selection
args1(1).Value = true
args1(2).Name = Collate
args1(2).Value = false

dispatcher.executeDispatch(document .uno:Print  0 args1())


end sub

short_description: Startup: reduce rdb file iowait time
long_description:
So - since we know services.rdb & types.rdb are bad cold-start seek offendors I
added this patch as a quick fix:

It also preloads the *ui* libraries - which of course may not be used but ...

--- desktop/source/pagein/makefile.mk	8 Sep 2005 17:44:11 -0000	1.8
+++ desktop/source/pagein/makefile.mk	10 Nov 2005 12:51:35 -0000
@@ -8123 +8127 @@ UPDDLLPOST=$(UPD)$(DLLPOSTFIX)$(DLLPOST)
 
 $(MISC)$/$(TARGET)-calc : makefile.mk
 	@+echo Making: $@
-	@-+echo $(DLLPRE)sc$(UPDDLLPOST)  >  $@
-	@-+echo $(DLLPRE)svx$(UPDDLLPOST) >> $@
+	@-+echo $(DLLPRE)sc$(UPDDLLPOST)   >  $@
+	@-+echo $(DLLPRE)scui$(UPDDLLPOST) >>  $@
+	@-+echo $(DLLPRE)svx$(UPDDLLPOST)  >> $@
 
 $(MISC)$/$(TARGET)-draw : makefile.mk
 	@+echo Making: $@
-	@-+echo $(DLLPRE)sd$(UPDDLLPOST)  >  $@
-	@-+echo $(DLLPRE)svx$(UPDDLLPOST) >> $@
+	@-+echo $(DLLPRE)sd$(UPDDLLPOST)   >  $@
+	@-+echo $(DLLPRE)sdui$(UPDDLLPOST) >>  $@
+	@-+echo $(DLLPRE)svx$(UPDDLLPOST)  >> $@
 
 $(MISC)$/$(TARGET)-impress : makefile.mk
 	@+echo Making: $@
-	@-+echo $(DLLPRE)sd$(UPDDLLPOST)  >  $@
-	@-+echo $(DLLPRE)svx$(UPDDLLPOST) >> $@
+	@-+echo $(DLLPRE)sd$(UPDDLLPOST)   >  $@
+	@-+echo $(DLLPRE)sdui$(UPDDLLPOST) >>  $@
+	@-+echo $(DLLPRE)svx$(UPDDLLPOST)  >> $@
 
 $(MISC)$/$(TARGET)-writer : makefile.mk
 	@+echo Making: $@
-	@-+echo $(DLLPRE)sw$(UPDDLLPOST)  >  $@
-	@-+echo $(DLLPRE)svx$(UPDDLLPOST) >> $@
+	@-+echo $(DLLPRE)sw$(UPDDLLPOST)   >  $@
+	@-+echo $(DLLPRE)swui$(UPDDLLPOST) >>  $@
+	@-+echo $(DLLPRE)svx$(UPDDLLPOST)  >> $@
 
 # sorted in reverse load order (ld.so.1)
 $(MISC)$/$(TARGET)-common : makefile.mk
@@ -1394 +1436 @@ $(MISC)$/$(TARGET)-common : makefile.mk
 	@-+echo $(DLLPRE)vcl$(UPDDLLPOST)   >> $@
 	@-+echo $(DLLPRE)tk$(UPDDLLPOST)    >> $@
 	@-+echo $(DLLPRE)svt$(UPDDLLPOST)   >> $@
+	@-+echo types.rdb                   >> $@
+	@-+echo services.rdb                >> $@
 	@-+echo soffice.bin                 >> $@

short_description: DocInformation:Modified field no longer works correctly
long_description:
When a document is saved with version 2.0 the DocInformation:Modified field is
emptied.  This used to work correctly in the 1.9xx series.  Documents with the
DocInformation:Modified field filled in by 1.9xx that are modified and resaved
under 2.0 have the field cleared.

short_description: use jaxp api for helpcontent building utilities
long_description:
XmlSearch and xmlhelp use some sun.com.* stuff which is available only for sun
java but provided for older versions of sun java and non sun java through the
use of jaxp.jar and parser.jar. The following proposed patch uses the final jaxp
api instead.

The advantage is that this api is also provided for by jaxp.jar and parser.jar
but allows those .jars not to be used if the java being used to build OOo has
builtin jaxp api support. This would enable some distributions which are nervy
about using sun java components to build OOo to avoid parser.jar and jaxp.jar.

long_description:
deliver is meant to copy files from current module to solver. It must not copy
from elsewhere especially not from solver to solver. Obviously every ugly thing
that can be done gets done so this possibility should be disabled.

This is required when building the X11 version of OOo for OS X.

This patch should be applied after applying the config_office patch from
Issue 5564.

SchMemChart as data container by a UNO based interface and implement this in
chart2 and sc.

short_description: Help - about does not show full version number
long_description:
The Help - about dialog does not show the full version number what should be
2.0.1. Using ctrl S-D-T to identify the Milestone / Build numer is no option as
the user would need to map milestone to version number but usually has not the
knowledge to do so.

To me this is a stopper for 2.0.1 as comon users would not be able to tell the
correct version number when searching for help at the user lists or filing
issues in issuezilla.

short_description: SOLARDEF not needed any more?
long_description:
In ssrc680.ini (setsolar environment) and set_soenv.in (config_office
environment) a variable SOLARDEF gets set which seems to be not in use any more
and partly redundant to CDEFS entries in platforms mk's. Please check whether it
is really obsolete. If so please remove.

short_description: gcc-4.1: toolkit: warning: control reaches end of non-void function
long_description:
The warning: control reaches end of non-void function could point out a real
bug. So we want to fix all packages to be built without this warning.

I'll attach a patch that fixes the warning in the module: toolkit

If you agree I could commit the patch to CWS gcc41.

short_description: Session management does not work with KDE plugin
long_description:
When receiving a save yourself callback with shutdown=true from the session
manager Qt begins to do lots of things in its KApplication::commitData
funtction including calls to the Xserver. Since this is not protected by the
SolarMutex from concurrent X calls within OOo's main thread this gets instantly
punished by an unexpected asynchronous reply.

Overloading the KApplication::commitData method and simply returning fixes the
problem.

short_description: [DE] inkonsistent translations for toolbox in Basic Dialogs IDE
long_description:
I use German buildid=680m143(Build:8986) and English m139

Create a new Basic Dialog. In the toolbar Macro there is a symbol for opening
the toolbar Toolbox. The German translations are inconsistent:

The short tip says
(English) Insert Controls
(German) Bedienelemente einfügen
A literal translation would be Kontrollfelder einfügen.

The extended tip says
(English) Opens the Toolbox bar.
(German) Öffnet die Abreißleiste Kontrollelemente.

The bar itself has the title
(English) Toolbox
(German) Werkzeugleiste
Werkzeugleiste has a special meaning in OOo1.1 and should not be used here.
There should be another translation for Toolbox. I suggest Dialogelemente.

I couldn't find a spec for the basic IDE so cannot say whether this is a defect
or an enhancement.
