The file was download from a Novell server and all the spaces where converted to
%20. (nothing strange about that really)

I have tried to open it several times but each time OO crashes.
The filename is: TS%20lp%203.xls

If I rename the file to TS.xls it works without a problem.

So AFAIKT this is purely an OO thing since it can't handle % in filenames. Is
this a restriction that's meant to be or?



/Richard

short_description: Default font for Thai should be Angsana 16pt not Angsana 18pt
long_description:
User feedback on 2.0.1 indicates that the new default font size for Thai (as
implemented in issue 56145) is too big.  The default font should be Angsana 16pt
not Angsana 18pt.  This requires a spec change to the spec in issue 42725.

(The background to this is that Angsana contains scaled Times Roman glyphs for
English characters and with Angsana 18 points the glyphs for English characters
are the same size as Times Roman 12 points.  So it seemed logical to make the
default 18 points.  Unfortunately it seems that the relative scale of
Thai/English characters used by Angsana is bad.)

short_description: Text not wrapping at em dash ()
long_description:
Em dashes should be counted as a possible wrapping point just like spaces. 
Currently Writer thinks that the em dash is part of the word because you don't 
normally put spaces around em dashes.

I'm not sure exactly what the style guides say but I've seen lots of well set 
text that has the em dash both at the end of a line and at the beginning of 
line in a paragraph of text.

short_description: can not save password protected sxw file in odt format
long_description:
Procedure to produce the problem 
- open the sxw-document pwd_test2.sxw 
- enter the password 
Everything OK 
- save as with password 
- enter password (twice) 
Error is shown: see error_when_save_as_odt_with_password.png. 
The file with the extension odt is created. However the filesize is 0. 
 
The buttons save on the menu-bar becomes available: 
- click save 
- OO ask for fileformat. I have to choose between old OO 1.0 format (yes) or 
OpenDocument format (no). See oo_asks_for_file_format_when_saving.png. 
I choose no. Error is shown: see error_when_save_as_odt_with_password_2.png 
 
- click save 
- OO ask for fileformat. I have to choose between old OO 1.0 format (yes) or 
OpenDocument format (no). See oo_asks_for_file_format_when_saving.png. 
I choose yes. Same error is shown: see 
error_when_save_as_odt_with_password_2.png 
 
The password on the doc is testoo 
The document used to be (very) long ago a M$ Office document. 
It is saved as a sxw-document and maintained as a sxw-document using oo 1.1.x 
towards oo 1.1.5. This has never resulted in any problem. 
 
Using OO 1.1.5 the file is saved in sxw-format without password 
- file opened with OO 2.01 
- saved in odt format 
- everything is OK

short_description: wrong scroll bar size
long_description:
- create a new spreadsheet
- resize column D to 50 cm
- select a cell in column C
- press the right arrow to select the adjacent cell in column D
- watch the horizontal slider : the thumb fits i.e some space is left right and
left
- press the right arrow again a cell in column E is selected
- press the left arrow the cell in column D is selected again
=> wathc the horizontal slider : the thumb fits the entire slider area.

This is a bug to be fixed. 
1) It should make no difference if you come from the right or the left.
2) The thumb should be smaller than the slider area if there is something to scroll

sent a database to me that also has the problem. 

I am attaching an example database to demonstrate. Open the database and the
form contained. Move to the second Authors record and attempt to enter a new
Book record.

The IDENTITY of type BIGINT is working correctly for individual tables but the
subforms are not picking it up.

short_description: Email adresses are not masked in mailing list archives
long_description:
The email adresses of all people who write mails to the mailinglists are exposed
on the web in the mailinglist archives. This results in a massive quantity of
spam. I recently got a new email adress that I only use for OOo mailinglists.
Within 6 weeks the spam started to come. I really urge the ones concerned to do
something about this.

short_description: avoid horizontal scrolling in EIS (don't use  tags or insert linebreaks)
long_description:
Being forced to scroll horizontally is a major pain ans should be avoided
whenever possible.

Currently EIS is very vulnerable in this regard since the edit-box wraps the
text but doesn't add newlines at the same position resulting in very long
lines that force horizontal scrolling because the comments are formatted with
the  tags.

See for example the CWS hunspell
http://eis.services.openoffice.org/EIS2/cws.ShowCWS?Path=SRC680%2Fm149%2Fhunspell&Id=3030

It is very hard to read and thus should be avoided.
One possible solution is to add linebreaks (like IssueZilla does) or not to use
the pre-tag. 
Inserting linebreaks probably is easier and doesn't confuse people used to the
pre-tags (otherwise they would have to check [x] html and insert explicit
s themselves)

refer to the greek philosopher I think it should be Heraklit

short_description: Search for strings in date formats fails
long_description:
Replacement for StarOffice internal issue #112709# because FT left OOo.

(reported by KR)
new calc
type a date e.g. 10/17/2003
format the cell to e.g. 'Friday October 17 2003'
open Find & Replace dialog
search for Friday or October
-> no success whatever options you choose
expand more...
-> still no success whatever options you choose
Excel would find the string if 'Search in (x)Values' is checked

ATTENTION:
Possible traps for implementatation. In comparison to excel we do not
distinguish between a SEARCH and a REPLACE dialog. With our dialog a user could
search for OCTOBER and replace it with FOOTEMBER. What should happen then?
Should the date value be converted to a string (Friday Footember 17 2003)?
Should an error message appear? Or do we offer a smart listbox that offers
possible replacements?
This has to be specified.

short_description: English thesaurus without license
long_description:
I am still unsure about the license of the English thesaurus that is available
at
http://ftp.services.openoffice.org:/pub/OpenOffice.org/contrib/dictionaries/thes_en_US_v2.zip

I expect that it is the same dictionary as the one in OOo sources. I think that
it is covered by the BSD like lincese that is included in the OOo sources in the
file dictionaries/en_US/WordNet_license.txt.

Am I correct?

Could you please specify the license?

Could you please add a README file into the thes_en_US_v2.zip?


IMPORTANT: The text from the WordNet_license.txt is not mentioned in the
installed THIRDPARTYLICENSEREADME.html. This is probably a bug. It even violates
rules of the BSD-like license!!!

add something and try to save it as M$ .doc. Saves ok when saving as 
.odt.
I use the Czech version of OO 2.0.1 downloaded from www.openoffice.cz.

short_description: Deleting dictionaries
long_description:
It seems that having too many dictionaries installed will slow performance
expecially at startup. I'm working regularly in three different languages thus
I have to have at least these installed.
Now OOo comes out of the box with already several dictionaries installed such
as English Italian Swahili (Kenya) Swahili (Tanzania) Thai.
I would like to de-install or delete some of these languages to not overload my
system however I haven't found a simple way to do this. I have read all of the
help concerning languages and dictionaries to no avail. 
The only way I can see is to manually find the files in shared/dict/ooo and
deleting them. And probably also updating the file dictionary.lst ?? Will OO
crash if I only delete the dictionaries and do not change dictionary.lst ? Or is
actually changing this file enough and I don not need to delete the dictionaries
(in case I would want the one day) ? 

Thanks for any hints

Oliver

short_description: Floating toolbars should remember position even when ouside the document window
long_description:
Floating toolbars should remember position even when ouside the document window

(OOo 2.0.1 IT Windows XP SP2)

steps:
1. open OOo 2.0.1 Writer
2. resize the window to occupy 50% the width of the screen
3. position the window on the _left_ half of the screen
3. Drag the Standard toolbar in the center of the document window (so it will
become a floating toolbar)
4. Drag the floating toolbar over the _right_ half of the screen (i.e. outside
the document window)
5. close OOo 2.0.1 Writer
6. Open OOo 2.0.1 Writer
7. BUG: the standard toolbar has been repositioned within the document window

this is particulary annoying with modern 16:10 laptops where every single pixel
of height must be used and ther's spare horizontal space...

P.s.: OOo 1.1 did _not_ have this prolem

short_description: Don't use C++ only flag -ftemplate-depth-32 on c_locale.c
long_description:
Option -ftemplate-depth-N is only for compiling C++ programs 
 
Compiling C programs with option -ftemplate-depth-N will get warning on gcc-
4.0.2 and get error on icc-9.0 (Intel C/C++ Compiler):
> gcc -ftemplate-depth-32 helloworld.c
cc1: warning: command line option -ftemplate-depth-32 is valid for 
C++/ObjC++ but not for C
> icc -ftemplate-depth-32 helloworld.c
Command-line error: pending instantiations option can be used only when 
compiling C++
compilation aborted for helloworld.c (code 4)

But in stlport module -ftemplate-depth-32 is used as warning flag for C 
programs (e.g. c_locale.c) as well as C++ programs:
In gcc-3.0.mak -ftemplate-depth-32 is defined in macro WARNING_FLAGS which 
is included in CXXFLAGS_COMMON and further CXXFLAGS_RELEASE_{static|dynamic} 
which are used for compiling C programs in nmake_common.mak.

There may be multiple approaches to fix this. One simple solution is to get 
option -ftemplate-depth-32 out of WARNING_FLAGS (used for both C and CXX) and 
put it for CXX only like below patch shows:

--- stlport/STLport-4.5.patch.ori
	2006-01-24 00:39:55.000000000 +0800
+++ stlport/STLport-4.5.patch
	2006-01-24 00:43:36.000000000 +0800
@@ -1577 +1577 @@
! # compiler
! # take these from the OOo build environment
! CC*= gcc 
-! CXX*= g++
+! CXX*= g++ -ftemplate-depth-32
! 
! #
! # Basename for libraries
@@ -1847 +1847 @@
! 
! include common_macros.mak
! 
-! WARNING_FLAGS= -Wall -W -Wno-sign-compare -Wno-unused -Wno-uninitialized -
ftemplate-depth-32
+! WARNING_FLAGS= -Wall -W -Wno-sign-compare -Wno-unused -Wno-uninitialized
! 
! CXXFLAGS_COMMON =  -D_REENTRANT -DGXX_INCLUDE_PATH=${GXX_INCLUDE_PATH} -
fexceptions -I${STLPORT_DIR} ${WARNING_FLAGS} ${ARCH_FLAGS}
!

short_description: syntax errors in documentation of idlc-ref
long_description:

short_description: Basic statement name as overwrites existing file without warning
long_description:
I use German OOo2.0.1 on German WinXP Home

Generate a directory c:\test with the file dummy.txt and dummy.sav.
Now test the following script

Sub Main
On Error Goto Fehler
Name c:\temp\dummy.txt as c:\temp\dummy.sav
msgBox Name as done
exit sub
Fehler:
msgbox Fehler Nr.& err &  Text=& error$
exit sub
End Sub

The file dummy.sav is overwritten with the content of file dummy.txt.

Expected behavior: An error 58 File already exists is thrown.

If overwriting is intended then the online help should mention it.

short_description: Do not overwrite PWD macro
long_description:
In startup/wnt/macros.mk and tg_ext.mk we're currently overwriting the internal
dmake PWD macro.

The first change is done because of issue 11093.

The second place should also not be necessary.

Issue 11093 claims:
> - Additional comments from hjs Tue Feb 18 09:53:42 -0800 2003 -
(snip)
> it's a combination of how files which need exception support are
> compiled (recursive dmake call) the .SETDIR option used in
> sw/source/core/makefile.mk and the way dmake handles PWD.
> 
> also setting any macro on the commandline seems to fill the
> MAKETARGETS macro (according to the dmake dokumentation this is wrong :-()

I cannot confirm this works even with the old dmake 4.1 from OOo 1.1.4.
 
> with MAKETARGETS not empty exception support will probably fail...
> look for appearance of TARGETDEPS in target.mk.
> 
> we should better go with the snippet for macros.mk and on the other
> hand cleanup the makefiles in sw/source/*. but this is another issue...
But someone did this so I think the hack is obsolete now.

I'll see how far I get without overwriting PWD.

Btw. I tried to reproduce the old problem with a makefile calling another
dmake (like in sw/source/core/makefile.mk) but I couldn't. Maybe this got
fixed in the meantime.

short_description: errors in help for Basic statement Write
long_description:
Found in /text/sbasic/shared/03020205.xhp
This text has some errors in content and needs improvement.

[par_id3145785]
wrong: Write [#]FileName [Expressionlist]
correct: Write [#FileName] [Expressionlist]
Not the single # character is optional but the whole #FileName part.

In addition: The help should mention that using this statement without
#FileName will show data in a dialogbox.

=========

The description in [par_id3147428] is not precise.
wrong: The Write# statement enters data that is enclosed by quotation marks and
separated by commas into a file. You do not need to use delimiters in the list.
The end of a file created with the Write# statement is indicated by a line end
symbol.

The problems are: 
(1) Not all data types are enclosed in quotation marks but only strings. Boolean
is enclosed in # and numbers are not enclosed at all.
(2) In addition it should be mentioned that numbers with decimal delimiter are
converted as it is given in the local settings. So when you use a local setting
with a comma as decimal delimiter than the data are broken because the decimal
delimiter cannot be distinguished from the data delimiter.
(3) There are not only a line end symbol at the end of the file but each Write#
statement will produce a line end symbol as last entry.
(4) The help doesn't tell which data types can be used.

=======

A link to the Basic input-statement should be added because it is the
corresponding statement to read back the data.

short_description: Formula size changes on re-open
long_description:
This is actually issue # 3752 that I had submitted in March this year as part of
ui and is still labelled new.

This problem exists with OO 1.0 also.

I am using openoffice 641d on Linux Mandrake 8.1. After writing an equation and
saving the document and then re-opening it for the first time equation size is
distorted (reduced) from the original size.

Double-clicking on the equation causes the comand window to open and the size
is automatically fixed.  After that if the document is saved it re-opens fine.

To reproduce this bug (how I do it):

1. Create a new document add a new equation object
   enter in the command window: 
   %lambda {partial %PHI} over {partial F} 

2. Write some text under it:
   This is some text

3. Save document Exit openoffice.

4. Restart openoffice open the document. The equation size should be smaller. 
 If the equation is double clicked the original size is restored and on saving
does not have this error again.

short_description: [DE] (5)wrong and missing translations in Basic open statement
long_description:
Found in /text/sbasic/shared/03020103.xhp

'Access' has been translated inadmissible. It is a Basic keyword. The second
'Dateiname' is wrong.

par_id3154124
wrong
Open Dateiname As String [For Modus] [Zugriff EAModus] [protected] As
[#]Dateiname As Integer [Len = Datensatzlaenge]
correct:
Open Dateiname As String [For Modus] [Access EAModus] [Schutz] As
[#]Datenkanalnummer As Integer [Len = Datensatzlänge]


The emphasized word at the beginning of an explanation must correspond to the
term in the syntax shema. Please emphazise this words like Dateiname: and see
to it that there is no space before the colon.

par_id3154014
wrong
Access : Schlüsselwort
correct
EAModus: Schlüsselwort

par_id3150011
wrong
Protected : Schlüsselwort
correct
Schutz: Schlüsselwort 

par_id3153190
wrong
FileName : Beliebiger Integer-Ausdruck im Wertebereich von 0-511 der die Nummer
eines freien Datenkanals angibt über den später durch diverse Befehle auf die
Datei zugegriffen werden kann. Die Dateinummer kann nicht irgendeine sein
sondern sollte direkt vor der Open-Anweisung mit der FreeFile-Funktion ermittelt
werden.
correct
Datenkanalnummer: Beliebiger Integer-Ausdruck im Wertebereich von 0-511 der die
Nummer eines freien Datenkanals angibt über den später durch diverse Befehle
auf die Datei zugegriffen werden kann. Die Datenkanalnummer kann nicht
irgendeine sein sondern sollte direkt vor der Open-Anweisung mit der
FreeFile-Funktion ermittelt werden.

par_id3151115
wrong
Datasetlength : Bestimmt bei relativen Dateien die Länge eines Datensatzes.
Diese Angabe ist nur notwendig wenn die Datei als Random-Access geöffnet wurde.
correct
Datensatzlänge: Bestimmt bei Dateien mit wahlfreiem Zugriff die Länge eines
Datensatzes. Diese Angabe ist nur notwendig wenn die Datei als Random-Access
geöffnet wurde.

short_description: Issue QuickLinks page should include Base
long_description:
The Issue QuickLinks page http://qa.openoffice.org/issuelinks.html contains
links into the IssueZilla database for easy identification of issues which
require triage or followup. You can select by platform or application. However
OOo Base is not included among the applications so people interested in QA'ing
Base bug reports can't use this page and must build a query by hand. Base is a
full-fledged application these days and should get included on this page.

short_description: Unnecessary queryAggregation calls in ScShapeObj
long_description:
Repeated calls to ScShapeObj's XPropertySet/XPropertyState methods each require
a queryAggregation call to query the aggregated object's interface. This can be
cached.

dans le document.

short_description: Win32: About support (System control: Software)
long_description:
Some users reported that they get wrong/invalid support information when they
click 'about support' under the OpenOffice.org1.0 (also 1.0.1) item on the
System control: Software menu.

How can I find it? 
Just click trough Start > System_Control > Software then select the appropriate
OpenOffice.org installation set.

Where are the settings?
I figured out that the settings have been saved in the registry under
HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Uninstall\OpenOffice.org
1.0

Which settings should be replaced?
Publisher=Sun Microsystems Inc.
URLInfoAbout=http://www.sun.com/
HelpLink=http://www.sun.com/supportforum/staroffice
URLUpdateInfo=http://www.sun.com/staroffice

Which are the new settings (suggestion)?
Publisher=OpenOffice.org 
URLInfoAbout=http://www.openoffice.org/
HelpLink=http://www.openoffice.org/servlets/HelpTOC
URLUpdateInfo=http://www.openoffice.org/dev_docs/source/download.html

What would be also nice?
If all localized builds can support those informations (automatically) without
any manual changes in the builds. For e.g. for the german set we need a separate
URLInfoAbout HelpLInk and URLUpdateInfo then german users are forwarded
directly to their appropriate support site.

What I have done until now?
Nothing special just backed up the original registry settings as
'old_OpenOffice.org_1.0_about_support.reg' and changed the above settings into a
new reg-file as 'new_OpenOffice.org_1.0_about_support.reg' see attached files
on this issue.

The .dot file and .bmp file (how it has to look in MS Word) are attached.

long_description: This patch adds support for the upcoming gcc 3.2 in lbnames.h.

short_description: webdav General Error on save of protected document
long_description:
Tomcat 4.03 webdav server just uncommenting in webapps/webdav/WEB-INF/web.xml (this uses 
BASIC authentication of tomcat as username and password)
I verify setup using MSWord as 
client to read/write a test file
http://localhost:8080/webdav/sillyTest.html (also OOo 
1.0.1 through WebDrive works fine). However OOo 1.0.1 reads the file (prompting for password 
correctly) but then fails to write saying
>   Error saving the document sillyTest.htm:
>      
General Error.
>      General input/output error.
Kai Sommerfeld on dev@ucb.openoffice.org 
suggested this issue report.

short_description: Incomplete storage/retrieval of User Information
long_description:
On all versions from SO 5.1 onward on Windows and OS/2 the dialog that stores 
and retrieves User Informationn (Name Address etc.) does not actually store 
the user's State field and in OOo 1.0.1 specifically when I manually entered 
the data in the proper file the dialog would not display it.

I would like to try fixing this problem but am new to using a CVS code base 
and cannot find the code for this dialog.  If someone could just point me to 
the proper place I'd like to try it.

Thanks
Matt Needles

short_description: Insert envelope ignores addressee paragraph style
long_description:
Insert - Envelope
Envelope tab
Ensure Sender check box is clear (NOT checked)
New Doc.

The newly created envelope document will contain an addressee box with a solid 
line border on all four sides.  Changes to the addressee paragraph style are 
not reflected in the addressee box created in this manner.

If the Sender check box IS checked then the addressee box created DOES 
rflect the addressee style correctly.

short_description: Writer replaces one image with another when loading a word document
long_description:
When I open the following Word 2000 document Writer replaces the second image 
with a duplicate of the first image on the page.

I havn't yet been able to locate the missing image.

Btw. Error also happens under both 1.0.0 - Danish and 1.0.1 - English.

short_description: OOO_STABLE_1/X11:  (sal+tools) nlsupport unimplemented
long_description:
In the latest dev alpha release there's a repeatable crash as follows:
1. Open swriter
2. Open Tools->Options... window
3. Expand Load/Save
4. Click on HTML Compatability
5. Crash

Looks like its caused by the call to strlen in
rtl_getTextEncodingFromMimeCharset (tencinfo.c) and the fact that we're giving
it a charset of RTL_TEXTENCODING_DONTKNOW from our unimplemented nlsupport
(seems like this could potentially affect all platforms).

Anyway changing our osl_getTextEncodingFromLocale in nlsupport to return
RTL_TEXTENCODING_ISO_8859_1 fixes the problem but probably isn't a great long
term solution.

short_description: Blue background - white text in pageview mode
long_description:
Request: Addition of mode that permits dark blue or other dark-colored background with white text 
to replace default white background/black text in pageview mode that does not alter the normal 
black on white print mode.  

Rationale: Easier on the eyes for extended typing sessions.

Folder. are html format and no pdf format.
Kind regards

short_description: Currency format is wrong in Spanish and Catalan
long_description:
Currency cells formatted to System language and default currency are wrong in Spanish (Español (España)) and Catalan (Catalan 
(España)). The problem is present in OpenOffice 1.0.0 and 1.0.1

 Assume a number like '12526' in a currency cell. It has to show as 125.26  in both Español and Catalan but actually shows up as:

- Español --> Pts 126  
              * The currency symbol has to be always after the quantity; Pts currency died on 1-1-2002 and now we use the   (Euro)

- Catalan --> $ 125.26
              * This is the USA format. The Catalan format has to be the same as the Español format.

  Thanks for reading Isma.

short_description: Hyphenation puts a - between two words separated by a protected space
long_description:
Is I separate two or more words by a proteted space (-). When
automatic hyphenation is switched on they are treated as one word but will be
separated from each other.
So If I write word by word it becomes word by -
word at the end of line.

Language of the document does not matter (tested with german and english).

My System: Windows XP OOo 1.0.1 german Hyphenation / spellchecking installed
for englisch german and turned on.

This was reportet with Linux / OOo 1.0.1 german too.

Sorry for bad englisch.

short_description: Writer caption problems
long_description:
Writer captions exhibit some strange behaviour.

For instance if I start a new Writer document enter Some text. at the
start of the first page draw a rectangle (e.g. about 2 inches wide an
inch deep about half an inch below Some text. and 2 inches from the
left margin) right click the rectangle select caption and enter the
caption text : a box. The caption is displayed in a frame of the same
width as the rectangle but much deeper (about 2.5 inches). I can resize
the caption's frame by grabbing the top of the frame but not by grabbing
the bottom.

However the behaviour is stranger if I drag the rectangle/frame/caption
combination around the screen. The caption moves around in its frame
depending on where the whole combination is placed. For example if I place
the combination so that the centre of the rectangle overlays Some text.
the caption moves to just below the rectangle rather than at the bottom of
the caption frame.

If I resize the caption's frame (as above) and then move the
rectangle/frame/caption combination around the screen the caption's frame
varies in size depending on where I drop the combination.

This may be working as intended but if so I'd like to understand the
intention as I can't use captions reliably with my current understanding of
the behaviour.

I'm running on Windows NT with a 642 build of v1.0 downloaded on 9 July
2002.

listing routines for unix be sure to search through the font paths

in order to allow additional true type fonts to be made displayable.

short_description: unused picture files included in .sxi file
long_description:
Unused graphic files are included in Impress's .sxi files:
After inspecting the inside of an .sxi file I noticed that there are 
graphic files included in it which are not actually used in the presentation.
These are files that I used in the presentation but later on I decided
not to use.

To reproduce:

1. Create a new presentation using all the defaults.
2. Type some text in one slide.
3. In Format->Page->Background choose a bitmap as the background.
   For instance pick the leaves.
4. Say Yes to Background settings for all pages?
5. Save the file to test1.sxi

6. From a Linux command prompt do unzip -v test1.sxi
   and we get a list like:

> unzip -v test1.sxi 
Archive:  test1.sxi
 Length   Method    Size  Ratio   Date   Time   CRC-32    Name
--------  ------  ------- -----   ----   ----   ------    ----
   17371  Stored    17371   0%  09-19-02 13:59  c7cbf147 
Pictures/100000000000005E0000005E513A4C71.png
    5205  Defl:N     1055  80%  09-19-02 13:59  faa40899  content.xml
   30846  Defl:N     2789  91%  09-19-02 13:59  37f1503d  styles.xml
    1153  Stored     1153   0%  09-19-02 13:59  79e2909d  meta.xml
    9949  Defl:N     1573  84%  09-19-02 13:59  9bf9f658  settings.xml
     876  Defl:N      286  67%  09-19-02 13:59  f501bd6e  META-INF/manifest.xml
--------          -------  ---                            -------
   65400            24227  63%                            6 files

   ...so at this point all is fine.  The PNG picture is the leaves picture.


7. Continue working on the same file: 
   In Format->Page->Background choose a different bitmap as the background
   image.
8. Say yes to Background settings for all pages?
9. Save the file to test2.sxi
10. From a Linux shell do unzip -v test2.sxi
    and we get a list like:

> unzip -v test2.sxi
Archive:  test2.sxi
 Length   Method    Size  Ratio   Date   Time   CRC-32    Name
--------  ------  ------- -----   ----   ----   ------    ----
    8149  Stored     8149   0%  09-19-02 14:05  e321cd00 
Pictures/100000000000005E0000005EB758AAC8.png
   17371  Stored    17371   0%  09-19-02 14:05  c7cbf147 
Pictures/100000000000005E0000005E513A4C71.png
    5205  Defl:N     1055  80%  09-19-02 14:05  faa40899  content.xml
   31000  Defl:N     2806  91%  09-19-02 14:05  f8434e1e  styles.xml
    1153  Stored     1153   0%  09-19-02 14:05  efda7179  meta.xml
    9949  Defl:N     1573  84%  09-19-02 14:05  9bf9f658  settings.xml
     999  Defl:N      296  70%  09-19-02 14:05  a883fbd2  META-INF/manifest.xml
--------          -------  ---                            -------
   73826            32403  56%                            7 files

    ... now there are two PNG pictures.  One of them is the leaves and the
other one is the one we chose in step (7).  However the presentation only
shows one of them.  In this case the unused picture does not take up 
much space but the unused image could be a large file that the user has
tried and then decided not to use.

        I discovered that the file styles.xml inside test2.sxi includes
references to both PNG files.  However the presentation that you see when
you open test2.sxi in OpenOffice.org Impress shows only one of the images. 
The other one cannot be seen.
        As far as I can tell it is not a matter of an image being placed
underneath the other one.  All I do is choose a background from the
Format->Page->Background and then decide I want to change it and choose a
different one.

        If I close OpenOffice.org reopen it and open test2.sxi again
and then immediately save the file again  the file test2.sxi still
has the unused graphic files inside.

short_description: Program crashes when user tries to enter 0 to column size textbox in the Insert Table dialogue box.
long_description:
Reduplication Steps:
1. Create a new text document in OO 1.0.1
2. Click the insert table icon on the Insert floating bar. This opens an 
insert table dialogue box.
3. Clear default value 5 and then enter 0 from keyboard to column size text 
box.
4. Move cursor away 0 is automatically changed to 1.
5. Move cursor to column size text box again and try to clear 1.
6. A warning message pops up. An unrecoverable error has occurred. All 
modified files have been saved and probably be recovered at program start.
7. Press OK. A second warning message pops up.  Soffice has caused an error in 
SWE641MI.DLL. Soffice will now close. If you continue to experience problems 
try restarting your computer. Close? Debug?

I reproduced this bug on both Win Me/ OO1.0.1 and Win 2000/ OO1.0.1. On Win 
2000/OO 1.0.1 the second warning message is about division by zero. The 
exception Integer division by zero. (0x0000094) occurred in the application at 
location 0x1e479ed8. OK? Cancel?. The instruction at 0x00000001 reference 
memory at 0x00000001. The memory could not be read OK? Cancel?.

short_description: language setting reverts to 'None' affecting spell-checking usage
long_description:
I was having a problem with some documents becoming un-spell-checkable.  I found
issue 5308 and issue 5341.  Issue 5341 led me to select all the text and change
the language to English (from Format -> Character menu).  My guess is that this
will solve the problem in 5308 too.

Now I am trying to figure out how my language gets wrongly set to 'None' in the
first place.  In the Options section I have my default Western language set to
'English (USA)'.  All of my documents start with this language setting. 
However at (as far as I can currently tell) unpredictable times the language
becomes 'None' (and I notice this when the auto spell checker no longer catches
errors).

Why would the language setting change unless the user changes it?

Also by the way I primarily use RTF as my (default) file format.  The person
who reported 5341 was also using RTF files.  However the problem happens to me
when I create new files not just import existing ones.

short_description: Printing can disable other major features
long_description:
Many users in my office are reporting that sometimes following printing open
office 1.0.1 will disable the print icon and the menu item. Additionally trying
to save print preview or close the document results in the following error message.
The document cannot be closed because a print job is being carried out.
The only way to close Open Office is to use task manager to forcibly shut it down.
I have been told that it can be caused by saving the document quickly after
pressing starting a print job but that is not the sole cause.
I have tried to reproduce the problem myself but have been unable to. However
it is being experienced by multiple users on multiple machines.
The printer being used is a Xerox Docucenter the print share is managed by a
Windows 2000 SP2 Server.
Apparently the problem occurs most frequently in Calc.

short_description: make the consequences of file MS Office associations clearer
long_description:
Every four or five days someone posts to the users@openoffice list complaining that they have 
installed OOo and now it has stolen all their MS Office documents and how do they get them 
back?

Of course what has actually happened is that they have ticked to associate word (or 
whatever) files with OOo. They do this clearly without realising what the consequences will 
be. If you don't read the screen carefully at that point it looks as if you are simply agreeing to 
let OOo read your MS Office documents (which everyone wants) rather than changing it to become 
the default program that will open them which very few new users will want. They are trying the 
program out not committing to it all in one go. 

So we need to change the wording of that screen -- 
easy -- and perhaps supply a simple registry script that will restore all mapppings to how they were 
before. 

I think that the uninstall process should automatically restore old registry 
associations. That's just good manners. But the really urgent thing is to change the wording of 
the install screen so it's clear what ticking those boxes will do.

I suggest something like 
this:

OpenOffice.org can read and write MS Office documents. You can open them easily from 
within OpenOffice.org. But if you tick these boxes as well Windows will change the icons of MS 
Office documents and open them automatically with OpenOffice.org. That may not be what you 
want. It has confused people in the past.

short_description: filename auto-complete causes letter case change
long_description:
During a Save As... dialog if a pre-existing filename matches (case
independently) what has been typed so far the filename entry box will show the
match as it's being typed but the letter case may be altered.

For example I have a file oop-tut.html in my home directory. If I try to save
a file as Oo.sxw the first O will match oop-tut.html changing the first
O to lower case. The match will continue until I have typed Oo. but by then
the entry box contains oo..

I am not sure if this is a cross-platform issue but I don't know that any major
OS lacks long filenames as well as case significance for filenames.

Proposed fix: Maintain a string buffer during dialog entry containing what has
been typed exactly. When no filename match is available revert to that string
rather than simply truncating the auto-completed portion.

The temporary work-around is to enter the filename fully then edit the filename
to have the correct case. Another possibility is to enter an extraneous
character at the beginning to force a filename miss (for example aOo.sxw)
then edit the filename to remove the extraneous character (a).

short_description: x86-64 & misc 64-bit fixes for SAL
long_description:
Hi unsorted additions & fixes for x86-64 in SAL.

1) Exact-width types definitions in sal/inc/types.h are wrong on 64-bit
platforms. Ideally they should be derived from uintN_t of . Likewise
it would be advisable to have sal_uIntPtr and sal_IntPtr.

2) We can keep inline assembly version osl_incrementInterlockedCount() for
x86-64 since oslInterlockedCount is a sal_Int32 in both cases.

3) Don't include . (i) because user code is not supposed to do
so explicitly. (ii) the actual definition is bound to be grabbed from 
or derivatives.

short_description: [SAS][SAS ODBC Driver]Function sequence error
long_description:
SAS ODBC Driver v8.2 gives error:
  [SAS][SAS ODBC Driver]Function sequence error
when attempting ODBC-setup access to SAS datasets using the following setup 
(under Win2000 and WinMe):
  Tools..Data Sources
    General: Name=SASUSER Database type=ODBC
             Data source URL=sdbc:odbc: SASUSER
    ODBC: User name=phil no password required no driver settings
          Character set=System
    Tables: All required tables can be seen in list
  Data..DataPilot..Start
    Data source registered in OpenOffice.org
      Database=SASUSER Data source=SHELP.CLASS Type=Sheet

Data can be viewed for Database type=Spreadsheet or dBase.

Useful information about SAS ODBC:
(1) supports SQLExtendedFetch function and SQLSetSmtOption allows you to set 
the rowset size and to select row-wise or column-wise binding.
(2) supports the scalar string functions: ASCII CHAR CONCAT LCASE LTRIM 
REPEAT REPLACE RTRIM SOUNDEX SPACE SUBSTRING UCASE.
(3) supports the scalar numeric functions: ABS ACOS ASIN ATAN CEILING COS 
EXP FLOOR LOG LOG10 MOD POWER RAND1 ROUND SIGN SQRT TAN.
(4) supports the scalar timedate functions: CURDATE CURTIME DAYNAME 
DAYOFMONTH DAYOFWEEK DAYOFYEAR HOUR MINUTE MONTH MONTHNAME MON QUARTER 
SECOND YEAR.
(5) does not support the following fDescTypes for the SQLColAttributes: 
SQL_COLUMN_OWNER_NAME SQL_COLUMN_TABLE_NAME.
(6) uses the TCP/IP protocol to access SAS data.

HTH....Phil Holland

short_description: Datapilot filter thinks the criteria not-empty to mean empty
long_description:
Steps to reproduce:

I have a spreadsheet with several columns one of them being a calculated one.
It contains a string produced with =if(a1=;;foo). For me  means empty
(but I'm not sure whether this is a correct assumption).

Create the datapilot table on a new sheet and you'll see these empty columns
appear as a header.

Click on the Filter button and say:

Field  (=)   - Not empty -  [the = sign is inactive that's why it's in parentheses]

Hit OK.

Result: The datapilot table appears to have no columns even though it should have.

Click on the filter button again and look at the values of your filter:

They read:

Field  =  [        ]   (the empty square brackets symbolize the value for )

If anything should get changed then it should get changed to

Field   [        ]   which is the workaround I've chosen to use until this is
fixed.

By the way this worked fine in StarOffice 5.2

short_description: configureWindowsNT.bat fails when a path name included spaces
long_description:
The OpenOffice.org 1.0.1 aplhs sdk download includes a script
configureWindowsNT.bat which sets up the environment for using the SDK.
This .bat fil fails when given a path name containing spaces (e.g. c:\Program
Files\StarOffice6.0)
Given that the default install location of many programs is under the c:\Program
Files directory this means that it's difficult so set the einvironment up unless
you use a non default installation
Workaround
Install Star Office / Open Office in a directory other than c:\Program Files or
perform a second installation

short_description: OOO_STABLE_1 X11/Aqua : stlport gcc2 patch
long_description:
This patch and patchfile allow the builtin stlport module to build STLport-4.0 with MacOS X support to avoid requiring another manual download and build step.  This automates the process to help ABS development and simplification of build instructions.

To apply:

download both patchfiles
cd SRCROOT/stlport
patch -p0 < stlport.OOO_STABLE_1_PORTS.112402.patch
cp STLport-4.0.macosx.patch .
build

Note that it won't build unless you rerun setup *without* the stlport4 config option or you manually edit MacosxEnv.Set to change the STLPORT4 environment variable to NO_STLPORT4

short_description: Calc
long_description:
With Calc I created a Document: in  the 1st page (or sheet or table as you 
call  it) I put my data; in the 2nd page I created some graphic with this data. 
Then in the 3rd page I put some new and different data which have nothing to do 
with the 1st page data and with the graphics in the 2nd  page. I save 
everything and close the window.
Next time that I open this document I find that my graphic look completely 
different from the previous time: I check the 'origin of the data' and I find  
that this time Calc has opened my graphics using the 3rd page datas!! I've 
found more than once and it happened several times: it seems that Calc uses 
the page with data that is more close (I mean more close in the bottom 
orizontal bar) to the  page with the graphics.

short_description: Word-files: modified time not being updated with file saves on FreeBSD
long_description:

It shows the last time the file was saved in word but any saves in OO don't

I have the modification time as a field and I also checked the properties -
same result.

Deleting the modification data in the properties dialog just makes the field 0
characters long - it still isn't updated when the document is resaved.

I've tried NFS and local disk saves.

Open to suggestions :)

short_description: Saving as Docbook results in empty file
long_description:
When saving a document that includes a linked graphic as a Docbook-XML-file the 
output is an empty file.

- Open new Text-Document
- Choose Insert/Graphics/From File
- Select image (e.g. open_office_org_logo.bmp)
- activate link
- click open to insert the image into the document
- choose File / Save as
- choose doctype Docbook XML
- save
- open the saved file with ASCII-editor
-> the file is empty

Saving the document with an normal graphic inserted (not linked) results in a 
correct output (the image is dropped then).

long_description:
Try this:

1.)	Start OOo 643C.
2.)	Click on Â“FileÂ” at the upper left corner and then select Â“OpenÂ”. As a 
result the File Open Dialog Window comes up. Note that the actual cursor 
position is at the starting point of Â“File nameÂ” field.
3.)	Hit a SPACE.
4.)	Hit ENTER.

As a result of this attack: OOo displays a message: An unrecoverable error has

short_description: Text styles are wrong when exporting to Powerpoint presentation
long_description:
I have a presentation created in Impress (OO 1.0.1 under Linux - ebian/testing) that mixes several 
text styles (normal bold italic).  I've exported it to Powerpoint format but when opening the 
file in Powerpoint the text styles are all wrong.

For example in the original Impress-file 
one line is all normal text except the last word is italic and the next line is all normal text.  When 
opening the exported Powerpoint file in Powerpoint all the text that comes after the italicized 
word is also italic.

However when I load the Powerpoint file back into Impress it looks 
ok.

The same happens when exporting the presentation from Impress in OO 643C under 
Win2k.

Example Impress and Powerpoint files are available 
at
http://www.vraalsen.no/ootestcases/

short_description: Wrong set of data pasted from Data Source window into Spreadsheet
long_description:
*This error is reproducible both on Linux i386 & Win32* 
 
This defect is in 'Data to Text' function in Data Source. The set of data shown in the data 
browser is not copied exactly into the spreadsheet by pressing 'Data to Text' button. 
 
How to reproduce: 
1. Open OOCalc 
2. Press  to bring up the Data Source window. 
3. Browse to a table until you see some data in the data window. 
4. Apply autofilter on a fairly large table to show only a subset of data. 
5. press 'Data to Text' button. 
 
You can see that what appears in the spread sheet is not what appears in the data window. 
 
It looks like this function is re-querying the database to get the results. Why not just copy 
what is in the data window into the spreadsheet?
